Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel but not value for money and disapointed overall”
Reviews.Author: marktheshark
Reviews.Content: We had high expectations before arrival from looking at the hotel website. The location of the hotel is good, close to the financial district and transport and a short walk from Soho area. We arrived on Saturday night and check in was ok a bonus was that we were offered a glass of champagne which was a nice touch. We were disapointed when we got to our room as it felt much smaller than expected, was quite dark and the 'city views' were of the warehouse/office block across the street! The noise on saturday night was just too much for a hotel, not so much the actual volume of the music but the vibration from the bass. There were 'white noise' machines in every room but quite frankly we found these to be utterly pointless and ineffective. The next day we went to reception to enquire about the room type we were in not quite matching the description on their website. We were given what felt like the brush off and excuses about how they had changed their room descriptions since we had booked and that we had actually got the right room (even though it did not match the current description on their website!!!!). I actually became so angry at their attitude that I asked for the manager who eventually did listen to our complaint / argument and agreed to switch out room that evening. The second room was better but it still felt lacking compared to other hotels we have stayed in- we have stayed in several other NY hotels that offer far bigger rooms and much much better city views for the same price per night. The open plan hotel lobby with bar / restaurant is a nice feature and we decided to eat there on the first night as we were tired from travelling. Although the food and service were great we found it to be very expensive overall - expect to pay for two glasses of wine the equivalent cost of a bottle elsewhere. There are only a couple of lifts servicing all floors and at busy times the wait for the lifts can be long. Given that the cost of a three night stay here cost us nearly $1,000 it was definately not value for money, when paying that type of money the guest should not be put in a position where they are made to feel angry when raising a query and complaints should be handled effortlesly and without making the guest feel uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless service, intensely noisy on weekends”
Reviews.Author: bonniemreeves
Reviews.Content: This hotel was or home in TriBeCa for five nights. The negative is the noise, so loud on Friday and Saturday nights that even with the white noise machines standard in the room, neither my partner nor I could sleep until after 2 a.m. There is a nightclub next door as well as a cocktail lounge with music in the open atrium of the hotel and the base booms carried into the rooms incessantly. Sunday through our Wednesday departure were exactly the opposite, no noise and blissful sleep. The staff at this hotel is remarkable. Servers and front staff are just lovely people, genuine and warm. The food at this hotel is marvelous, be it breakfast, lunch, or dinner. Highly recommended venue except for weekends or until the hotel finds a way to turn down the base. Nonetheless, we will book again any week day as we just loved its staff.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Get Away”
Reviews.Author: Gailandfamily
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Tribeca Grand for a weekend to celebrate our anniversary, The hotel is young and hip. The staff couldn't have been nicer. While we did not partake in the festivities (we were busy catching up with friends and family) the hotel lobby/club was a hopping place both weekend nights. The room was well appointed, albeit on the small side. It was kept clean with nice amenities. The only negative I can give is that it was a little bit noisy -- not enough to keep me up (I wear ear plugs anyway) with street traffic and some of the club noise. I would stay there again. It's a great location if you want to be in Tribeca.

Reviews.Title: “Terribly hip hotel”
Reviews.Author: 415traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights with my fiance on a trip that combined work and pleasure. We both lived in NYC for many years and wanted a small hotel with a convenient location and good amenities. The Tribeca Grand delivers on both fronts; being in Tribeca is a great location for transportation all around the city and the hotel itself is quite nice. The hotel is super hip, maybe a little too hip for our taste. The bar and lounge areas were packed on the weekend, and although we were on the fifth floor, we could hear the noise loud and clear. We didn't see the white noise machine until we were leaving, but I have to assume that would have helped! The rooms themselves are nothing special. Like all NYC hotel rooms, they're very small. My fiance was working during the day from the hotel and the desk/chair are definitely not made for that purpose. It looks hip, but it's not very comfortable. We were placed in a handicap-accessible room for some reason and although it meant a large bathroom, the shower basically flooded the bathroom each day. To be fair, I assume that other rooms don't have that problem. The staff is very friendly and accessible and the hotel is clean and up-to-date, but I've stayed in other hotels that offered better rooms and less noise.

Reviews.Title: “Loud and Terrible Neighbor”
Reviews.Author: J C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I live across the street from the Tribeca Grand Hotel. For the past five years, I've been woken up an average of three times a week by early morning delivery trucks idling outside the hotel. Last year I estimate I lost more than 80 hours of sleep because of excessive hotel truck noise before 6 am. Last night, for example, a Sysco refrigerated truck arrived at 4 am and stayed until after 5 am, running a generator the whole time. After it left, a Chef's Warehouse truck showed up and stayed for another half hour. I fell asleep after it left, only to be woken up a few minutes later by the obnoxious Tribeca Grand employee who rides his motorcycle home from work after his shift ends, a little after 6 am. Accepting 4 am deliveries in an otherwise quiet residential neighborhood is not an acceptable business practice. Visitors to NYC, please consider staying somewhere else. The Tribeca Grand is a terrible neighbor and adds nothing to the neighborhood except noise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, terrible staff”
Reviews.Author: Andre S
Reviews.Content: Although hotel premises are nice (not great), the staff is not aware that they are not there doing favors to the guests... they are not polite, nor helpful 9exception to room service people, that are really nice). From Reception Desk to waitress and hostess, the service is one of the worst I have experienced in NY, specially laundry, that did not clean my clothes, neither delivered them on time, and still charged me for the services. Terrible choice for NY!!

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: afr01
Reviews.Content: I have just returned on 21st March from a trip to New York for my 40th birthday. This is my 10th or 11th time in New York and I have stayed in a variety of hotels, including The Waldorf and Trump Soho, but the Tribeca Grand is by far my favourite. Its a small boutique hotel and has a great funky vibe. The staff were so friendly and less formal than you would find in a larger hotel, which made for a very welcoming atmosphere. The rooms are not massive but are big enough and the beds are incredibly comfortable. I really appreciated the effort that Omar on reception made for my birthday, sending champagne and cupcakes to my room. The location of the hotelis excellent and is near to loads of great bars and restaurants. I definitely plan to stay in this hotel the next time I travel to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Best in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Yeshwant N
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tribeca Grand on my last trip to NYC in November 2011. The hotel is just amazing. The rooms were big, the bed was comfortable, amenities were right up with some of the best hotels I have stayed at. The bar area and the hotel can get noisy but the room has a white noise generator that can drive that down to a great degree. The location is perfect. I always stay in the Soho/Tribeca area and the hotel is close to all the locations I usually visit. Bunch of amazing restaurants and bars within walking distance, including Bubby's Pie Co which is open 24x7 (most of the time). The reception personnel were friendly and concierge was extremely helpful. I will be in NYC this April and I will be booking my hotel room there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terific Hotel, Terrific Location...”
Reviews.Author: LondonLockwood
Reviews.Content: Had 4 nights here recently as a 21st birthday celebration for my daughter. Have to say the whole experience was memorable from the easy and swift check-in to the doorman who sorted out a 5 seater taxi at the end of our stay !.The rooms themselves are a decent size with extremly comfy beds ..really good ! The place is fitting with the area in which it sits super cool,good bar scene . I loved it ! The surrounding boasts excellent restaurants and great boutique shops..i have receipts to prove it ! Must make a mention of Zwenska who was our hostess at breakfast and certainly looked after us well during our stay. I think for the price this is a must stay in the part of town you need to be in.. A big thank you to everyone aand we will be back soon for sure .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a weekend in Tribeca”
Reviews.Author: Townsend_C
Reviews.Content: My wife and stayed here last week and loved it, hotel staff was very accommodating when we noticed lots of elevator noise out side of our room on the eighth floor, they quickly moved us to the other side of the building. Great neighborhood for exploring, dinning and drinks. We would definitely stay here again. Thanks to all at the Tribeca Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Location and a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1foodude
Reviews.Content: This is New York where rooms are the size of broom closets, but the rooms are of decent size. I thought the service was excellent. The check-in process took literally 2 minutes, the bags were brought up promptly and we were explained all of the amenities. This is a boutique hotel, which in Manhattan is usually code for small trying to sell itself as unique. This hotel doesn't feel small, it has a generous lounge which is a pretty cool place to hang out and the bar is small, but it is very hip and gets crowded. Friday night happy hour was difficult to get a drink and on Saturday, the party doesn't start until after midnight. This is right in the heart of Tribeca and blocks from Soho, so there is a lot to do in this area. It also has more of a neighborhood feel in this area and not as noisy as most of Manhattan. If you spend a good amount of your time in the hotel when you travel then this is a good hotel for you. If you aren't planning on spending any time in your hotel, there are cheaper options, but personally I can't stand the claustrophobic amenities of most NY hotels, so this was a nice change of pace.

Reviews.Title: “swanky but service isn't great”
Reviews.Author: Alejandro D
Reviews.Content: The hotel really has a swanky look with all the modern decor. That said, service was quite poor - I arrived close to midnight and it took ages to check in despite being the only client t the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: cocodarling
Reviews.Content: I had written a somewhat negative review of the hotel about a year ago and was invited to return this year. I would now like to say that the staff was very nice, as the last time I was there, the hotel much quieter, the bed excellent and I had a very good albeit short stay. I would recommend this hotel for couples of people on business downtown Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky hotel but rooms need a facelift”
Reviews.Author: KDJ114
Reviews.Content: I am from NY, but stayed here with family for a fun girls night out. The hotel is very fun, with a lounge and restaurant in lobby. Set up is very embassy suites like with the middle open throughout all of the 8 floors where you can look down onto lobby. We were greeted with a glass of champagne (they only do on weekends), and it was a nice touch. I have to say I was disappointed with the room. We checked into a room with 2 queens on the 7th floor and it had seen its days. The furniture was knicked and beat up, The carpet was pulled up, the shower had no pressure and could use new tub/tiling. There are good cafes in the area you can go to. The color scheme in the room was very drab and dark. Room was tiny, but everywhere in NY is. If you like coffee, dont plan on the free stuff on every floor...was terrible. There are good cafes in the area you can go to. Location is good if you want to be near SOHO shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Naperville77
Reviews.Content: I took a weekend with my wife in NYC and we stayed here. Cool hotel, location, lounge, bar, etc... Rooms are small but nice (it's New York - all rooms are small). Love the location in Tribeca. Two subway stops near by. Able to walk to Soho, Greenwich Village and our new favorite Nolita which has lots of trendy shopping, restaurants and bars. The front desk was very friendly. There was a door man who always opened the door and greeted us with a friendly hello. The concierge was very helpful and gave us good shopping and restaurant recommendations. The Church Lounge is a great place to congregate and have a drink. It has a fun energy to it. Cool place... I highly recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but bring ear plugs!”
Reviews.Author: Herbie614
Reviews.Content: Recently spent a weekend at the Tribeca Grand - wonderful staff, room decent size considering it is NY. Nice amenities - free champagne on arrival, free coffee machines on each floor, NY Times every day, easy walk to Soho, etc. Booked room months in advance but was able to get room discounted the night before when I went online and found rates went down. BUT every Friday and Saturday night they blast music in the lounge area from 11 pm - 2 am. All the guest room doors face the lounge area. The hotel provides white noise sound (sounds like an air conditioning unit) to block out the music but it is does not work. The music is louder that any white noise If you want to stay here, bring ear plugs

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay near Soho”
Reviews.Author: Josh N
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. We requested additional pillows and they were delivered in less than 5 minutes. The champagne upon arrival is also a nice touch. The rooms are a little small but they are nice. I was a little worried about the noise level given the open air nature of the hotel and the loud bar in the lobby, but you could not hear it in the room. Overall I would recommend this to anyone looking for a reasonably priced hotel near Soho.

Reviews.Title: “So lovely and in a great part of town”
Reviews.Author: jaws80
Reviews.Content: Stayed on business during an unseasonably warm December. Staff was very nice, at the front desk and in the restaurant. The room was a decent size (especially for one peson) as NYC hotel rooms go. The price was REALLY great in comparison to other hotels in the area. Each room has a dial that turns up this white noise in the room so as to drown out any outside noise. Cool feature I have not seen in any other NYC hotels i have stayed at, though i never needed it. Although i didnt have time to shop, this hotel is walking distance to some great shopping (saw them in my cab rides), not your everyday chains either. The Gym was a tad small, but had the essentials. If you are going to NY for the first time to hit your typical landmarks, this is a bit South for that, but if youve been before and would like to see more of the city, this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Paying for location and reputation, but that's it”
Reviews.Author: cdelucia
Reviews.Content: Considering the price you pay to stay here, you'd think the rooms and amenities would be to a much higher standard, but at the end of the day, you're paying for the hotel name and the location, and that's about it. The lobby and lounge area are extremely nice, and the staff are friendly and helpful, but the rooms and bathrooms, while clean, are really outdated and small. I realize people are excited to be staying in Tribeca, but personally I'd rather stay in a less-hip location, pay a bit less, and get a more spacious and modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great base in NYC”
Reviews.Author: knitter06
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend pre-Christmas. I was a little concerned about being so far from mid-town (most of plans were uptown) but it worked out really well and saved a lot of hassle as we totally able to avoid the chaos of Penn Station coming in and out and had all the transportation options one needs a block away at Canal Street. The hotel is lovely, very contemporary. The room was very clean and well equipped. Staff, both at the desk and in the restaurant, were personable and helpful. Ann, the concierge, had talked with my husband before we arrived and arranged some treats as we were celebrating a birthday and our anniversary. The hotel has an app that can help find local restaurants, entertainment, etc that we found helpful. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Erroneous "no show" Charges and Unresponsive Management”
Reviews.Author: JackieDevonNY
Reviews.Content: I've never written this negative review of a hotel; however, my experience trying (the issue has still not been resolved) to remove two erroneous $487.52 "no show" charges on my bill is the worst example of customer service I have ever experienced in my 20 years of business travel. For the last 3 weeks I have called accounting, reservations and managment no fewer than propably 10 times (most of which went unreturned), and have been unable to get two erroneous "no show" charges removed from my bill. To be clear I paid over $2300.00 for my five night stay at the hotel, so imagine my suprise to find two additional $487.52 charges on my bill appear mysteriously after my stay. I never received any notification or invoice of any sort from the hotel. When I called Tribeca Grand they explained these were "no show" charges to which I explained that I "did show" and had already been charged for my stay. I explained that when I checked-in the desk clerk spent 30 mintues trying to locate my reservation and could not, she said the system was on the "blink". She said she would enter a new reservation into the system for me and reconcile it on the back-end. Tribeca Grand said that this did not make sense and they believed it was actually Expedia's fault for entering a double booking. I had Expedia call them and explain they did not double book, but reservations said there was nothing they could do, since this is not what their records showed. They said I'd need to speak to management. I'm still waiting for the elusive management to call me back, and am in the process of filing a fraud complaint with my credit card company. My company has a corporate relationship with Tribeca Grand, so I've stayed there over the last 5 years, and have been consistently disturbed by the musty and dustry feel of the rooms and overall unresponsive service. That being said, I never imagined I'd experience the type of abusive treatment by staff and management that I have around this issue. I took a look at other negative reviews of this hotel (in particular the one entitle "Overall Horrible Experience" on 9/17) and chuckled to find the GM respond that this type of thing never happens, well I'm certainly experiencing it now, so let me assure you it does. You might want to actually speak to your customers and guests sometime, and then you wouldn't be totally disconnected from the overall poor customer experience offered by your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrasWorld
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five days and found the service excellent and nothing was too much trouble for the staff. The rooms were good and the beds were very comfortable. The breakfast was substantial and the omelette served was delicious. The location of the hotel is very convenient to local attractions and close to the subway. Overall I would really recommend this hotel especially to travelers wanting to stay in an interesting and eclectic part of new York.

Reviews.Title: “Uneven experience and time for a refurb”
Reviews.Author: kapohokine
Reviews.Content: Having spent a lot of time (including 2000 New Year's) at the SoHo Grand, I had medium high hopes for this property. We made reservations very last minute, like driving over the GW last minute. We secured a couple of rooms at a very reasonable price, just under $300, and made our way to the hotel. It takes up a neat triangular end of a block. The valet was exceptionally friendly and helpful, which really was confusing considering. Once inside, reception was well-staffed and was very quick to get champagne in our hands. We were two couples looking for a relaxing night away from the kids, and between the valet's friendliness and the quick and easy champagne we all thought we were in heaven! We were assigned rooms and made our way up. The hotel is one of those 1970s central atrium designs that don't seem to work for a number of reasons, one of which is noise. Especially in a property with healthy nightlife, I was a little apprehensive about getting a good nights sleep. Each room has a white noise speaker over the door to try to drown out any sounds coming from the atrium. So, the rooms are sort of Jetson/Mojave with sleek jet age lines done in browns and oranges. They looked dated and worn. The desk and chair were not very comfortable or usable. The bathroom, too, had a sort of "I used to be super cool" vibe to it. Interestingly, we all thought if the hotel stays exactly as it is it will be back at the cutting edge of style in another ten years, sort of retro chic turn of the new century. We went down to the huge lobby lounge and asked for a wine list. The lounge was very quiet and relaxed, and we got very prompt and friendly service. We got a wine list, with the caveat that most everything on it was out of stock. We got an inventory list that we could order from, but it was their only one and couldn't be left with us. We finished up and left for dinner and NYC fun, returning to the lobby lounge later that night. It was completely different, loud and raucus and what you'd expect. We found our same seats, which were on comfortable couches along an elevator tower, tried to order, with one of us wanting some food. With all of the servers running around like maniacs, one of us went to the lounge manager to ask about ordering food. The manager told him to go to the bar as they serve until they close. He went to the bar, but was told the bar doesn't serve food, and the bartender walked away. He went back to the lounge manager who walked with him to the bar. The manager explained to the bartender that she does serve food and left my friend at the bar with the bartender to order. The bartender wandered off and let him stand there for twenty minutes, so out he goes to find the lounge manager again who took the order. An hour later we had everything we ordered, and were nicely sobered up. So we ordered more drinks and stayed until they closed. That'll teach 'em. Overall, the hotel isn't old enough to be cool and isn't new enough to be cool. It's pretty big, and I'm sure it's a struggle to keep rooms occupied so deals like mine aren't rare. The rooms are not the smallest in NYC, but they don't make you feel special, either. And I'm just not a fan of the indoor atrium as the noise coming in when the bar/lounge was really cranking was really annoying. We cranked up the white noise machine until it sounded like we were stuck inside a TV playing snow, but it didn't help with the thump thump of the bass. Some staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, and some were reminders of how surly and obnoxious bad hotel service in NYC was in the '90s. It's a pretty good value for the money paid, but I just can't figure out why you'd stay there. There are so many options in NYC I am sure it's hard for a hotel to find it's niche, and I hope that this one does.

Reviews.Title: “Cool and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Martini_A_Go_Go
Reviews.Content: Spent only one night but found it to be cool & comfortable, with some great food & shopping options nearby. They gave me a free upgrade to a huge (by Manhattan standards) Superior King room. The decor was great -- modern but warm with some retro touches -- and my room had a beautiful view from the floor-to-ceiling window. The bed was comfortable and the linens were great. The only thing I missed: a big bathtub. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hip getaway away from the tourist traps”
Reviews.Author: CharlieWilmette
Reviews.Content: Just spent a weekend with my wife for a quick getaway to NYC. Really enjoyed this hotel. Staff was great and very accommodating for an early check-in. Room on the small side (and we were told this was an upgrade - hate to see what the smallest room was like) and the decor was nothing to write home about - need at least a furniture update. But the location is terrific, the lobby and bar are fun and hip, and there are awesome bars and restaurants (off the tourist beaten path) within walking distance. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I'LL BE BACK”
Reviews.Author: Sally V
Reviews.Content: Just spent long weekend and it could not have been better. Quiet, clean, great staff and a coffee bar with excellent coffee. Close to great restaurants, subway and buses.

Reviews.Title: “Grand, alright!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth C
Reviews.Content: Impeccable service! Make sure you ask for the pet goldfish when you check in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Services”
Reviews.Author: TaraGNYC
Reviews.Content: White glove service from the beginning. We were offered champagne upon check in and quickly was shown our room. The room was very small but it's NYC so I expect that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, convenient hotel with supberb service!”
Reviews.Author: CynamonKis
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to attend a weekend seminar, which was conveniently located 1.5 blocks away from the hotel. Yes they DO offer a goldfish in your room. The food at the restaurant was wonderful - I was happy to have caviar with my salmon appetizer! They offer you a glass of champagne upon arrival, the decor was very modern and beautiful, the bed comfortable. The staff was friendly, helpful and top-notch. Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “lots of fun. convenient for business travellers exciting get a goldfish!”
Reviews.Author: betsy f
Reviews.Content: You can ask for a goldfish to have in your room - how fun, business center great place to work, lobby awesome place to sit, have a drink, convenient location, food great, Bubby's restaurant in walking distance, take a day and walk the shops. Can be noisy at night especially on thursdays otherwise the place is excellent. you might even see some celebrities! Rooms, bed very comfortable. You really feel like you are in NYC

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Thomasleemd
Reviews.Content: We typically will stay in midtown but to try something new, we chose this hotel. Great location, close to SoHo and Chinatown. Outstanding service from doorman to bartender. A free glass of champagne at checkin is a nice touch. They have THE most expensive cocktails but perhaps one was worth it. A run or stroll along the lower western banks of the Hudson provides a dedicated path with a spectacular view of the Freedom Tower and Statue of Liberty.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and staff”
Reviews.Author: Anna A
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel made our NYC stop-over just perfect. Great staff - very international - the concierge gave us some lovely tips for our trip to Paris, France. The breakfast buffet is totally worth getting up for!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Great”
Reviews.Author: FozzieandBlakey
Reviews.Content: 3 night stay in October - have also stayed at sister in Soho. Hotel is beautifully designed inside, great use of old industrial space. Check in really polite & efficient, champagne on arrival and all staff great throughout. Room fine - a bit dark, issues with TV and only a small openable window. However, these are small gripes - good stay, good location easily walkable for Soho, Ground Zero, High Line etc

Reviews.Title: “If your chose your hotels for sleep quality don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: SaraRWD
Reviews.Content: You know you're in for a bad stay when the other reviews start by talking about how hot the night life is. This hotel is barely in Tribecca, right at Canal and 6th Avenue, heading into one of the tunnels. So, my first night there I spent all night listening to the traffic on 6th. Needless to say I didn't sleep much. I called the desk at 6 am, and asked to be moved. Apparently, this is a common request for rooms on that side, as the person who answered wasn't surprised. I was told the hotel had been full the night before and they would move me that day, but i need to pack everything. Fine, until i went to the front desk to turn in my key. The same nasty woman who I had checked me in the night before, acted like I was a horrible person for expecting them to move me. I think they are horrible for putting me in such an awful room when I was there for three nights. I've NEVER asked to move rooms at a hotel before. and, did i mention I was part of a large group staying at both this and their sister hotel the SoHo grand? I also thought the paint scheme of dark browns was awful. My second night was better, but when I walked up on my third and final night, there were paparazzi everywhere. Apparentlly some c or d list celebrity was gracing the hotel with their presence for an event. The "excellent" treatment I received continued when I was asked repeatedly to show my room key. Obviously, my suit gave away the fact I had no business being at the party. The loud music coming from below kept me up until about 2 in the morning. Finally exhaustion set in, rather than a reduction of noise volume.Each room is equipped with a "noise machine" in the wall. To me it sounded like static on a TV set and I turned it off. It was as bad as the street noise. My favorite thing about the hotel was the "drink" selection on every floor. Instead of the typical in room coffee maker, there was a machine on every floor with a full selection of hot beverages. Not being a coffee drinker, I appreciated the choice. However, if you're like me and expect a shot of caffeine first thing, definitely bring your cutest pajamas and a pair of slippers if you have to wander the halls. I wouldn't stay here again, if my life depeneded on it, and am sad I didn't get to stay at the So Ho Grand. My colleagues there seemed to have a much better experience. Considering I was on a three week road trip and this was the 2nd of 4 hotels in 17 days, the bad experience was doubly magnified.

Reviews.Title: “Top Place”
Reviews.Author: CJ'S1
Reviews.Content: Booked direct with the hotel as best price for King Executive room; got an upgrade to a suite on arrival. Selected this hotel as opposed to Mid town on the basis of reviews and was not disappointed. In a quiet area but everywhere easily accessible either walking or subway. Rooms are a little 'underlit' but reflect the character of hotel; only had breakfast twice but very good; got stuck into the cocktails every evening - great; all the hotel staff were terrific - friendly, efficient. professional and nothing was a problem. Would certainly stay again although not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “A+, 5 stars, special experience. We miss the staff already!”
Reviews.Author: ZoeSte30
Reviews.Content: My family and I, consisting of 7 people aging from age 13 to 55 stayed at the Tribeca Grand for 10 days. We had stayed at the sister hotel the Soho Grand previously but thought we might try the Tribeca Grand for a change of location. We cannot rave enough. From the staff to the food to the location, the rooms and the atmosphere, there is nothing we would fault. The GM Rob is just so incredibly helpful in all aspects as is Ariel the delightful concierge who was happy to attend to anything we needed. Kevin & Sal at the Church Lounge became like family and we are so sad to leave them all. The Tribeca Grand is a fantastic hotel, 5 star recommendation! A home away from home with staff who care. Cannot wait to get back there!

Reviews.Title: “Consistent excellence”
Reviews.Author: Landsteam
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Tribeca Grand several times over the past few years. We were originally "Grand guest" members, but have now converted to "Grandlife" both programs are excellent as you ecru rewards which do not expire as well as receiving a discount on rooms and occasional upgrades. We generally book the "Tryst in Tribeca" package, which includes breakfast as well as drinks in the hotel lounge. The staff always goes out of their way to be helpful and pleasant. The rooms are clean and very comfortable. On our most recent stay 10/14- 10/15 we were upgraded to a studio suite on the 8th floor, which was unexpected and absolutely wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Long Business Stay”
Reviews.Author: PR
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I had an almost 2 week long trial in NY. We stayed at Tribeca Grand because of its proximity to Court House and because one of my colleagues had stayed there quite a bit, so they gave us a discount on rooms. We rented 2 regular rooms and one of the suites to work out of. I stayed in the suite. The suite was nice, but still a little small for 3 people to work out of. The hotel was kind enough to send up a work table and some chairs. The lighting in the room was a little dark, but it was functional. The hotel was very service oriented. Any time we needed anything, they jumped quickly. One thing I liked is that internet was included and you could print on their printer at the front desk for free, which was very helpful. The staff was very courtious. We ate in the hotel restaurant for the first 3 or 4 meals. My biggest complaint was that I thought the restaurant service was a bit slow and the food was way over priced. After paying $25 for some eggs and coffee, I talked to one of the bell men and they pointed me to a diner around the corner which was fantastic and my choice for breakfast each day. The food at the hotel was very good though, it just was pricey. They had just finished remodeling the bar area while we were there and it it really nice. Drinks are expensive. There are all kinds of great restaurants around the hotel (mostly Italian). Plenty of things within walking distance. My biggest complaint would be the workout facility. It was very small. It had dumbells up to 50 pounds and that was all the weight equipment. It had 2 treadmills (one was broken), a bike and a couple of elipticals. My recommendation would be to expand it a bit and add some better equipment. So, I ended up jogging down to the Hudson most days. The views on those runs are great and makes the time go by quickly. For business and if you have meetings down town, this hotel is a great location. I am not sure how good it would be for families or if you were just doing a lot of site seeing. But, overall, I have very few complaints and was very appreciative of the service of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: Lynda M
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival my husband and I were excited to spend the evening in NYC for a quick get away. Soon after, we quickly realized this hotel was anything but the luxury it advertises. The rooms were very small and dusty. There was a musty smell throughout and it was obvious the rooms were not thoroughly cleaned. Instead, they were quickly cleaned on the surface to mistakenly appear fresh. We tried our best to not allow the cleanliness of the hotel to negatively affect our stay. The real problems occurred soon after... During the checkout process I signed the statement to agree to the room charge and all was said and done until four days later.... I notice on our statement that we were charged a $65 parking fee but did not have a car with us!! I called and felt confident the matter would quickly be resolved, boy was I wrong! I was transferred to the "Accounting Department". I then left 3 messages that week and finally received a call back. The woman seemed very uninterested and explained she needed an approval from the hotel manager and would call me back - never happened! Fast forward 3 1/2 weeks later, 2 visits to the hotel speaking with the manager, at least 15 phone calls to the accounting department (phone calls go straight to voice mail at any time in the day and NEVER received a call back, not once!!) and numerous calls to the hotel manager (each time was told she was "interviewing", never receiving a call back, yet again.. not once!!). At one point, upon one of the two visits to the hotel, the manager was unsure how to refund due to a "new system" and printed out a statement which appeared to resolve the matter, although I was not confident. I waited a week and it never appeared on my statement. I was tossed around like a volley ball and no one I spoke with ever attempted to take responsibility or even seem the least bit remorseful. In a desperate plea to the hotel manager I explained I never hear back from the Accounting Department, again receiving the response - "there is nothing we can do". The matter was FINALLY resolved a month later and mysteriously appeared on my statement after I called the hotel in tears due to endless frustration. I never received a call back from the manager (was told she would call me within the hour over a week ago), no apology, no acknowledgment of the issue.... nothing! Within this beautiful city of NY we live in, we will NEVER be staying there again due to their lack of care and concern for their customers!! What a disappointment!!!

Reviews.Title: “My new home in New York!”
Reviews.Author: picturesque08
Reviews.Content: I visit New York frequently for business trips where I stay mainly in the Mid-town area. However this time it was a personal trip and I spend most of my personal time in Downtown, so I decided that I will have to stay in the SoHo/TriBeCa/Lower East Side. I researched a lot of hotels in the area and one thing in common is that they are very pricey compared to the competitive Mid-town hotels. TriBeCa Grand offered the best value for my stay and it is in the area I wanted to stay so I decided for it. Furthermore, the reviews on Tripadvisor have been all positive, even compared to the supposedly more popular & hip sister hotel, SoHo Grand. I still had a concern that the hotel might be all hype with no substance. But I was so pleased that I was proven wrong! From the moment I arrived, the staff were very friendly and helpful, and no pretence. The room feels plush and luxe, and had a beautiful warm homely feel about it while still maintaining a simple minimalist approach. I booked a Superior King Room and it was a large room (definitely for NY standard) on the 6th floor looking out the street and it was very quiet during the day as well as night. The bed was very comfortable with beautiful soft sheets and the pillows are good variety (some softer than the other which give me options to choose). The large floor lamp by the bed has dimmer switch which is great - I know this seems random, but believe me, as someone who appreciates ambiance, I get so frustrated by hotels which only have super bright lights everywhere! -. I also asked for a pet fish to accompany me during my stay and that was certainly a really cute novel touch to my stay at TriBeCa Grand. The location is perfect. I was quite surprised at how close it is to the more hyped up sister hotel, SoHo Grand. It is walking distance to SoHo, NoLiTa etc. And there's subway lines that will take you up town easily. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at TriBeca Grand. I love that it's a sophisticated, hip hotel without the pretence. It's very warm, homely and just simply beautiful and sensuous. I will certainly be back there for my next New York visit!

Reviews.Title: “Average.”
Reviews.Author: meldavall
Reviews.Content: Checked into hotel, no porters waiting to assist you. The front desk staff were helpful and provided us with immediate service. The rooms are average and the layout reminds me of an Embassy Suites. Decor is trendy and adequate. I did not like the fact the the bathroom tubs were equipped with a plastic shower curtain. This cheapens the space. If you utilize the subways, they are easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty decent depending on what you pay and why you are going”
Reviews.Author: ronneedham
Reviews.Content: So, this is one of the original hip hotels. Haven't stayed here in many years but got "bumped" over from the Sheraton Four Points (nice upgrade, that's for sure). Sheraton had water issues due to storms and they sent us here. Very generous of them. Hotel is as I remember it. It was fashion week so it was PACKED with a very good looking crowd. Employees are very professional and helpful. Rooms are a bit small but typical for this type of hip place in New York City (similar to Morgans, Paramount, and the others). I wouldn't pay the 500 a night to stay here as I would rather get the luxury of Ritz or Waldorf for that money but if you get it for 300-375 then it would be a good value. Everything in good shape, location pretty good (unless you are a tourist - in which case you probably want midtown for the sight seeing). Plenty of restaurants. Ate in the hotel and the room service and the lounge restaurant were excellent. Too beat to hit the fitness center so no comment there. I would recommend it for under 500 as a place you will enjoy yourself if this is the environment you are looking for (young, good looking crowd, hipsters, SOHO, and so on)

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: Eclipsepilot
Reviews.Content: Overpriced, tiny rooms, shabby, dirty, rip off, poorly furnished with no taste

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is NOT Important to this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kathy T
Reviews.Content: This hotel was consistent in everything they did to reflect that customer service is not important to them. The stay started fine even with my room's door lock not operational, I calle dthe fron t desk and someone was sent up promptly to fix the door. After an hour and a half it was decided that the door lock was not able to be fixed and I would need to be moved to another room, still everything fine. Then I got to the room they moved me into, it was a closet, smelled, and from appearances it was a room that was not used frequently. Oh, the best part was that the room was on the second floor, and the bathroom window faced a busy intersection and had only sheers. I could not turn on the bathroom lights on without providing a shadow show for free. At check out I was not asked how my stay was, but then neither were the 12 other people in my group. No one in the group was surprised based upon their own experiences at this hotel. The food was very good but was not good enough to make up for the unacceptable level of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Had such a good time, we stayed another night”
Reviews.Author: NyLc
Reviews.Content: The Tribeca Grand is ideally located downtown and it was perfect for a late summer impulsive getaway. There are loads of great restaurants around. The room was quite comfortable and quiet. We didn't explore the hotel too much and we didn't hang out in the lounge/restaurant - although we admired the space. The staff were quite friendly - don't forget to request your vacation pet (the bug eyed goldfish)!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel industry leader in customer service”
Reviews.Author: Shane0067
Reviews.Content: I recent;y spent 5 nights at this wonderfully located hotel. The level of customer service from the front desk staff especially but to all front line staff was the highest I have ever encountered in 23 years of constant travel. I had a noise issue in the room i was originally assigned, they could not have been more obliging in rectifying the problem. The way you were greeted every time you returned to the hotel made it feel very personal. The only down side was the rooms on the 2nd floor on the Avenue of the Americas have subway noise from the trains below. I will stay again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “No NYC attitude here!”
Reviews.Author: DCtraveler68_11
Reviews.Content: Traveling with two kids and so we booked two rooms. However, no connecting rooms. Called Tribeca Grand and explained our dilemma. They canceled one of the two rooms and upgraded us to a suite at a charge no more than what we already intended to pay for two rooms. Very accomodating. Location can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Canal St subway, Chinatown, SoHo, Greenwich Village, Ground Zero”
Reviews.Author: Goldenfish
Reviews.Content: Convenient location - just a few minutes' walk from several subway stations (Canal St subway has multiple lines and so multiple entrances/exits). Walking distance to Chinatown (10 min), SoHo, Little Italy (both 5-10 min), Greenwich Village (15-20 min), Ground Zero (15 min), Wall St, financial district (both 15-20 min), Brooklyn Bridge (15 min). Rooms are a decent size and clean! We didn't have breakfast there so can't comment on food.

Reviews.Title: “Funky & Cozy”
Reviews.Author: Mercedes1976
Reviews.Content: The Tribeca Grand offered small, but clean rooms with funky decor. We stayed there for our 2 year anniversary and were pleased with the hotel, overall. We don't spend too much time in our hotel room, so size isn't a major issue for us. Our must haves when traveling are: clean/quiet non-smoking rooms, comfy beds, and blinds/curtains that block out light so we can sleep in. The Tribeca Grand afforded us all of the above. Also, the staff was very friendly and helpful when in need of directions or recommendations. We also liked that the hotel was not in the middle of a super touristy area. This is a good hotel for low-maintenance travelers, but certainly not cheap. Oh, and you get a goldfish as a "surrogate" pet!

Reviews.Title: “Cool Vibe”
Reviews.Author: diamondsnowball
Reviews.Content: I loved the vibe of this hotel. Very cool bar in the lobby that is visible from all floors from the open atrium. The room was comfortable with a good view. My only compliant is that the lighting is quite dark, so it's not great for make-up application! I would definitely stay here again. The area and vibe can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kgiuffre
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was tops! Waitress in the restaurant on the day of our arrival was persoable and thoughtful. When calling down for additional toiletries and towels they were delivered although it did require two calls; it seems there was some miscommunication between departments. Room was clean and roomy for NYC. Beds were very comfortable. Bathroom was spaceous and well designed although we did not like the placement of the trash receptacle. Wireless service was perfect. Location was perfect for our interests, close enough to the ferry, shopping and awesome food. We had a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mgarmon
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. Staff was very friendly and the room was nice. The sound system in the room was amazing. Couldn't hear anyone in the room right next door to me because it drowned out the noise!

Reviews.Title: “Try way too hard to be hip”
Reviews.Author: justmyopinion1029
Reviews.Content: Great conciege, but staff in bar/restaurant give new meaning to obnoxious. Rooms are small, but okay. Good location if spending most of your time down town.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Come Back. Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth12340
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay in many different NYC hotels for both business and pleasure. We have stayed at the Soho Grand and enjoyed it and same now for our first stay, a romantic weekend, at the Tribeca Grand. The TG has a much more laid back vibe, the staff was helpful and professional. The room was well equipped although not especially large or flashy. I love the white noise machine -- but we really didn't need it. We liked the weekend welcome glass of champagne and we appreciated, but didn't use wireless internet. The hotel is close to many great restaurants and is great if you want to do a lot of walking -- the subway station to carry you uptown is close as well. It isn't flashy, but we didn't need flashy.

Reviews.Title: “Tryst in Tribeca Package = excellent”
Reviews.Author: jillybjolly
Reviews.Content: Last Friday I treated my fiance to a "staycation" for his 30th birthday with the "Tryst in Tribeca" package at the Tribeca Grand. The whole experience was lovely. We were upgraded to a suite, had a tasty cocktail at the Church Lounge (which was a bit dead for a Friday night... not what I was expecting, but not bad either), slept late and had in-room breakfast. Beds were comfy, staff was warm and accommodating, and the room decor was hip. My fiance loved the computer and ipod hookup in the room, and our great view over 6th Ave. It felt like a different world when you step in from the crowded, bustling streets of the city. I'm going to recommend it to our families next time they visit the city!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location, but....”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerAsia
Reviews.Content: I live perhaps a third of my years in hotels and on the road, and while I had a wonderful stay at the Tribeca Grand and found their staff to be wonderful, gracious and helpful, and their location to be great for nearby restaurants, great shopping, etc., I have to stay that I don't have a nostalgic feel for the hotel. The rooms are great, internet was included, everything is fresh and clean (if not a bit dark in design), but the hotel doesn't leave me with with any great sense of nostalgia as some other New York Hotels do in the same price range (even with rooms that aren't quite as nice). At the Tribeca Grand, I don't have the "I can't wait to be back to the Tribeca Grand" kind of feel which some hotels leave you with.. I would absolutely stay there again, but the interior design for me falls rather flat. I can't truly say anything negative about the hotel---but as a hotel, it's not exciting. The only two notes I can make are that having eaten in the hotel restaurant twice for breakfast, on the first day they didn't have any orange juice at the beginning of the breakfast hour and on the second day, fifteen minutes into the breakfast service the coffee was "still brewing" so someone's a bit asleep in the kitchen---and the breakfast staff doesn't pay much attention to the guests as it's hard to get their attention--but they couldn't be nicer when they are paying attention. And the food was tasty once it arrived. Incidentally before you book through a travel agent check out the Expedia rate, as the travel agent price for our last day was showing almost $90 more than the Expedia rate for a Saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “Fell in love again in NYC and the Tribeca Grand”
Reviews.Author: RyanCWallace
Reviews.Content: The staff was tremendous and made our trip. The were helpful and polite and arranged everything we asked. The rooms are funky but modern, comfortable, and clean. The food was incredible, and the ambiance of the hotel made our trip one we will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: RMTraveler099
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on a 4 night fun trip to NYC. The hotel was classy and had a nice modern decor. The lounge was often hopping at night and had excellent drinks. We also endured a first night with a neighbor playing their TV extremely loudly till the wee hours. We asked to move rooms the next day and, not only was that request pleasantly acommodated, but we were put in a nicer room with a better view. The staff were fantastic. The location is easily accessible to all of lower Manhatten and a short walk to the subway. All in all an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Its a grand life at the Tribeca Grand”
Reviews.Author: spider99
Reviews.Content: We visited New York City in May 2011 and stayed at the Tribeca Grand for 7 nights. We have to say it was one of the coolest and friendliest hotels we have ever stayed in. In the heart of downtown Manhattan, we were surrounded by such wonderful places as the East Village,fantastic shopping on Broadway,with Chinatown, little Italy and Greenwich village....all within walking distance. Tribeca itself has wonderful restaurants, and we ate locally most evenings. Definitely go to Bubbys for breakfast and the Tribeca Grill. Also, ask the fantastic and knowledgeable concierge to book you a table at the River Cafe (under the Brooklyn Bridge....with incredible views of Manhattan) The hotel itself was stunning. Immaculately clean, staff brilliant and very helpful, with a real downtown vibe. This hotel is beautiful with stunning decor and architecture. The food fabulous too, and loved the breakfasts here. Our room was comfortable and a good size.We really enjoyed the Church Lounge: plenty going on in the evenings.Perfect to people watch. Bartenders friendly and chatty, and we spent quite a few evenings here. The music was great too. Saturday night was definitely party night, but we didn't hear much noise at all,and we were on the second floor. My tip is "Don't go to bed....or you will miss it!" I am very fussy with my hotel choices and standards, and after 7 nights, I could not find fault with this hotel whatsoever. We will definitely return again and again. I really miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: juju32
Reviews.Content: I was visiting new york in preparation for my move to the city and stayed at the Tribeca Grand. Perfect option for me as the location of the hotel was fitting as well as the style of the hotel perfectly suiting my tastes. Comfortable clean rooms, great trial size products to use in the bathroom, and the bar was a enjoyable evening for some drinks and something quick to eat.

Reviews.Title: “A great place...full of character.”
Reviews.Author: Wayicit
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed every aspect of this hotel. The staff is exceptional. Enjoyed being able to walk to great restuarants,other areas of the city and subway. I would stay here again and hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good”
Reviews.Author: Nixer65
Reviews.Content: I have been using the TriBeCa grand for a number of years now - and have recently completed my fifth stay this year.  What brings me back is the consistency of the place.  I like boutique hotels and this one has a nice buzz without it getting too much. Getting the downsides out of the way: Having stayed so many times I can recommend the following- do not stay on the top floor as you will be disturbed by the lift machinery, and on this note ask for a room away from the lifts.  The best rooms are on 5 thru 7 as a you will hear the bar a little on the lower floors.  Being very picky, some of the rooms are not quite as fresh as they could be and there are signs of wear and tear beginning to appear in a few places. Upsides:  pretty much everything else.  I love the decor.  The right balance of light (trendy without being too dark).  The feel of the atrium is great and the bar is a great place to have a calm drink after a long day.  Room service is good and the food consistently excellent.  I can recommend the eggs Benedict for breakfast.  The staff are always friendly and helpful. Having recently stayed at the Hudson (avoid at all costs) I realised why I like the TriBeCa grand so much.  It's just...comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently excellent”
Reviews.Author: Thethurm
Reviews.Content: Class. The staff is amazing. Accommodating and professional. We spend at least one weekend in Manhattan every year. Very doubtful we'd stay anywhere else. We have fallen in love with Tribecca and the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: cs272
Reviews.Content: Service was first rate and the room was sharp and clean. Dark, party vibe downstairs but no noise at all heard from our sixth floor room. Great location, though a little difficult if you are driving (at the confluence of some bizarrely angled streets and close to the mouth of the Holland Tunnel). Overall, my new favorite NYC hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small room and even smaller bathroom and tiny shower”
Reviews.Author: silasabby
Reviews.Content: Overnight visit and paid standard rate but disappointed with size of room. Strange small circular shower! Service excellent from everyone. Parking valet took 50 minutes on 8:00am Saturday morning.Loud club on first floor, white noise machine helped some. Excellent location for TriBeCa.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay fri/Saturday if you want to sleep before 2am!”
Reviews.Author: CJHopp
Reviews.Content: The hotel Is very nice aesthetically, but something they forget to tell you on reservations or front desk is don't expect to be able to go to sleep before 2am every Friday and Saturday! The rooms are essentially laid out in a spiral around a hollow centre which has a large bar at the bottom which means regardless of whe you are, if there is a party downstairs you feel like you are in it from your room. Lots of shouting and you can sing along to every tune from your room if you want to. I phoned the concierge at midnight after putting up with it for a few hours (it's so loud there is no way you can sleep through it, and unfortunately for me I had an early trip in the mornings was trying for an early night). He gave it to me straight - the music and party is going on until 2am, and it is like this every Friday and Saturday... There you go, if you want to stay where the party's at, this is your place. Just don't expect to be able to leave it when you want to, and def don't come here on the weekend if you are looking for an early night or have kids!

Reviews.Title: “Zero attitude, terrific service, terrific place to stay in NYC.”
Reviews.Author: 327dhg
Reviews.Content: We got married nearby in early April and we had friends and family staying at the hotel for the weekend. EVERY person who interacted with the hotel to make or update their reservation commented on how easy it was and how courteous their contact was. This is a cool, sleek hotel in a cool NYC area...yer there was no "better than thou" attitude to be found anywhere in the hotel. We had kids at the hotel, grandparents at the hotel and everyone in between. People came from all over the US and locally to enjoy the hotel. Everybody loved it--many more than the epected to. I think everyone left with a positive feel for the hotel and would love to stay there again. My wife and I also hosted a party there on Friday night and it was amazing. Easy to plan, perfectly executed and no hidden or extra fees--just exactly what they said it would be and what we had hoped for. This is Manhattan, this is Tribeca. Hotel rooms are not spacious nor inexpensive. But you can definitely count on a cool spot, a well-appointed hotel and welcoming, helpful, genuine service.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone is a VIP”
Reviews.Author: AyArzu
Reviews.Content: In traveling for business and simultaneously apartment-hunting, I was on one of the most hectic trips of my life and could not have been more thankful that I was staying at the Tribeca Grand. After having to extend my stay at the absolute LAST minute multiple days in a row, I was never left in a position of having to change rooms and the front desk even honored the initial rate I had secured, even though I had booked it on a travel site and their actual rate was increasing. I'm sure had I been staying at any other hotel, I would have encountered countless issues with the rate, the room availability and the check-out times. The only "problem" during my entire stay was that there wasn't an upgraded room when I checked in, but I was immediately moved the next day into the room I had requested and comped drinks at the lounge (which happens to be one of the best spots in the city to mingle) for the inconvenience. By the second day, everyone on staff already knew my name and were some of the friendliest and most helpful hotel employees I've ever encountered on all of my travels. The Sunday brunch at Church lounge is already famous locally, and lived-up to it's reputation. To top it all off, the hotel actually gifted me the pet goldfish from my room as a companion for my new apartment! Even though I'll be living in the city, I'm sure I'll be visiting the hotel regularly just for the great atmosphere and people.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it”
Reviews.Author: gmc001
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Tribeca Grand for 5 nights and we loved it. it was friendly and felt like we were part of a neighbourhood rather than in a big hotel. the staff were great, always friendly and helpful. rooms are nice, no noise from the thumping nightlife downstairs and cleaned well each day. would love to return

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Charlie2014_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tribeca Grand for a wedding, and we were amazingly surprised at the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. The size was perfect - only 8 floors - and we were able to park on the street right outside the hotel. We would definitely go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and SO Accommodating!!”
Reviews.Author: newportRI23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Tribeca Grand for 1 night last week and could not be more impressed with the staff and the hotel itself. I was a bit high maintenance- arrived late in the evening and I had ordered a large flower display so I could take it to my trade show the next day. When I arrived, the staff greeted me by name and even let me know that it was going to snow the next morning! They had delivered the flowers to my room and everything was perfect. I love the bathroom amenities, Malin and Goetz lotion smells wonderful. The rooms are beautiful and the location can't be beat. I will definitely return here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, points for being pet friendly but don't expect razzle dazzle”
Reviews.Author: Fab2010_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my dogs and expected better service. I will say that it is dog friendly and that gets a few points but when I got there the valet was nowhere to be found, had to go inside and find him. Expect alot of do-it-yourself service. You are in a good area being in Tribeca. I would recommend not paying the continental breakfast as you are given just a coffee, bagel and orange juice. Go to Broadway and head to the Starbucks or the Subway across the street. The hotel did not feel clean. I think it is good if you want to bring your pets but if you are traveling on your own then find a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff guilty of fraud”
Reviews.Author: siriain
Reviews.Content: After returning home, discovered on credit card statement that bar bills were fradulently altered to increase the tip given. Complaint ignored and had to get money back through credit card company. Very poor customer service - and no apology - even though their employees stole from me. Unbelievabe.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Find”
Reviews.Author: RichterE
Reviews.Content: The Tribeca Grand was everything we hoped for and more. The staff was wonderful, the atmosphere elegant and trendy, the room comfortable and clean. Being greeted by a complementary glass of champagne "to start the evening" upon check-in was an unexpected treat. Our room was very quiet- even being on the second floor, near the street and with a giant dance party going on in the bar- we didn't hear anything. The door men and concierge were helpful, friendly and knowledgable. The only thing that could be said on the negative end, is the room was a bit small, but not bad in any sense for two people.

Reviews.Title: “Want to be in the center of downtown excitement? Look no further.”
Reviews.Author: questionthedogma
Reviews.Content: I'm in NYC every two weeks for business. The Tribeca Grand has become my "home away from home," and the staff is what makes it work. The folks at the front desk, the bellmen, the host/hostess -- ALL make your stay worth it. Special shout out to Svenska in the restaurant...she knew my breakfast order the SECOND day i stayed there -- and she remembers it EVERY time! This trip I stayed in room 420 (it's like they KNEW me ;) ...which might be my favorite room -- it's quiet, a little tucked away, and EASY to remember...if you know what I mean. I won't hesitate to recommend the TGH -- or to stay at it...EVERY time!

Reviews.Title: “One word......Amazing”
Reviews.Author: mjl038
Reviews.Content: A friend & I have been hopping around NYC looking for the perfect NYC hotel to stay in when we are in town. Something fun, hip, warm, great atmospehre, great service, good location, great food and pretty people - FINALLY we found all of that and more at the Tribeca Grand last week. What an unexpected and pleasant discovery.....there wasn't one negative (ok, maybe the smaller than expected gym) but other than that we were super pleased with our experience and our time there. So much so it will be our hotel of choice for all future visits, especially since we can now enroll in their Special guest program. Highly recommend & I am not impressed easily.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Guest Experience”
Reviews.Author: Joseph3011
Reviews.Content: I had the good fortune to be a guest of the Tribeca Grand, I spent four nights there, it was a wonderful experience. From the moment I arrived, I was very warmly welcomed, this warm approach is felt through out the hotel, reception, bell/concierge, housekeeping, restaurant, bar etc, the staff have a passion for excellent but relaxed service. I would highly reccommend the Tribeca Grand to anyone visiting New York on either business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “A Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: lagrive
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are very picky travelers. For example, we just came back from Paris. We NEVER stay at a hotel. We rent an apartment on the Seine. The main reason for this is that we do not like the vibes most luxury hotels emanate. For us the Tribeca Grand is a small boutique hotel where there is always a smile and, “can I help you". We love the feel of the hotel. This was our second time at the Grand. Both times it was for the same reason. It was my wife's pre-birthday present. We actually live in Queens, NY but we wanted something special away from home but not too far. The stay at the hotel was perfectly suited for this occasion. Walking distance to two of our favorite places; Centrico(super Mexican food for a drink prior to dinner at our favorite NY restaurant, Corton. Then the next day a leisurely breakfast and then lunch at Spotted Pig. Onward to home and a full celebration of my wife's birthday. Couldn't ask for more!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Katia20
Reviews.Content: This is the worst designed hotel in the universe. Eight stories of rooms around a hard-surfaced atrium with a noisy lounge feeding music until well past 2 am. Paper-thin walls so you can hear your neighbor on the phone in the middle of the night. Can't decide if they are a club or hotel, but leaning toward club!

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay For An Average Price, But With Good Service”
Reviews.Author: bagoda1
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights on a business trip with 3 colleagues. For New York City, it is reasonably priced. But while they do try hard, and there are conveniences, it is an average hotel when one totals the points. Access is great. A car or cab can pull almost right to the front door, with a helpful doorman ready to assist. The reception desk is literally a matter of feet through the door. So arrival and check in are quick and easy. There is a restaurant and bar which are good not great, but as with the doormen and check in folks, service was terrific. My problem is with the rooms. They are small, old, tired, and rundown. The bathroom has metal everything and I felt like I was in an industrial kitchen. It is more hostel than hotel. I was on a lower floor, and I encourage you to avoid that at all costs. It was insanely loud. And lest one think that I am simply a light sleeper or otherwise sensitive, there is a panel on the wall which emits "white noise" which is meant to drown out the sounds of the street below. That's a first for me. This is simply not a luxurious New York experience by any stretch. But you are not paying for that either. I will not stay here again for a number of reasons unless finances are crucial. It is not well located for either business or pleasure, and the rooms are lousy. But to be fair, if the location works for you, and you need to save a few bucks, and you insist on a high room, and you are only staying for a night or two, I would not vote against this place. For me, the very good service keeps this hotel on the radar.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: Frank1971
Reviews.Content: Great vibe, recently rennovated decent facilities great location..what more could you ask for...Loved it! Only downside...really small porrly equipped workout room.

Reviews.Title: “Get over yourself, Tribeca not- so-Grand.”
Reviews.Author: SillyLilly74
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review from my hotel room at the Tribeca Grand. My husband has been asleep most of the night (very long day), so I've tried to enjoy the hotel on my own. From where I sit, I have a view of a parking lot. There are 10 mid-level cars parked there. 6th Avenue is empty. The view is dark and dreary. I close the curtains and turn on the television for some laughs. Every time I choose a channel to watch I get a message that reads: "If you want to view this channel, please call customer support." I accidentally turn off the television and can't get it to turn back on again. I decide that, rather than going down to the lounge where I was told earlier that I can't sit on a sofa because it was "reserved" for apparently invisible guests (nobody is here), I would write this review because I think if I hear the hostess give me that "reserved" BS again, I'll scream into the cavernous, empty lounge "Nobody is here!" and my echo will bounce back for eternity. A few other notes: when we arrived I asked about the menu and was told by the gentleman carrying my luggage that a new menu had just been devised for the new types of clients that comprised the majority of the hotel guests here: "Business travelers". (Note to management: if your primary client base is business travelers rather than leisure travelers, you are not a luxury hotel and nobody is going to think you are because you put cardboard signs on your table to pretend they are "reserved"). Anyway- back to that newly devised menu- 7 entrees are available for dinner: steak, pasta, chicken, fish, lobster, burger ranging from $14 to "market price". I feel like I'm eating at TGI Fridays! Wow, how much more elegant and special could this night get? Well, I can hear the train running underneath the hotel and I can hear the engines of cars going by (from the 4th floor) so that should lull me right to sleep. Tribeca not-so-Grand after all!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rooms very small, noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: gmassam
Reviews.Content: All was good until the party started at 2am and we couldn't sleep until after 3. It appears there is a dj in the lobby every friday and saturday and the noise carries to all the rooms. On mentioning it at check out there was no apology or discount offered when I was clear we had a very disrupted night. I would not stay again because of this.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: RRockaway
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Tribeca Grand whenever I visit New York, which is at least twice a year. From my very first stay some years ago to my most recent visit, the hotel's staff have made me feel welcome and have extended me every courtesy. Everyone, from the persons cleaning my room to the staffs at the desks, door, and restaurant, have done their utmost to make my stays comfortable. My rooms have always been clean and comfortable; the restaurant food and service has been excellent; and the exercise room adequate for my needs. A big plus is the hotel's location in Tribeca and near SoHo and the East and West village. Since I stay at the hotel on a regular basis, the staff knows me by name and never fails to make me feel welcome. Consequently, the hotel has become my home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Room, Not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: trpsker
Reviews.Content: The hotel has old, dirty, broken down rooms for a premium price. We stayed in a room on the seventh floor. The room ceiling is cracking with chipping paint and poorly finished sheetrock, as are all of the walls. The lighting is dark at best. The carpet is stained and worn out, maybe it had been vacuumed in the last week, we couldn't tell. The painters must have been blind. Blotches of misplaced paint are everywhere in the room. The cheap, old, plastic chair in the room does not make the hotel trendy and hip, but cheaply furnished and uncomfortable. By far, the worst part of the stay is the bathroom. This is where the "grand" hotel took cheap, shoddy work to the max. The shower is a circular shape, with a stainless steel base, and tile walls. Obviously not NYC union work on this shower. The tile is practically falling off the walls, and there is not a level surface anywhere. The vanity and sink is stainless as well, but not in a neat, clean application. There is no framework for the sink area, and the steel feels cold, ugly, and again...cheap. The white noise system by the entry door is just an intercom speaker that is not hooked up to anything, producing fuzz. The hotel bar is never open to the guests. Each of the three nights we stayed we were unable to purchase a drink at the bar because it was closed for private functions. Overall, I was disappointed to experience this below grade hotel room for the $500 a night that it cost. I will never return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: tiredofnick
Reviews.Content: I stay here a lot for work, love it. The staff is very friendly and they recognize me now, which is nice. Occasionally get a cheese plate or snacks in the room after I check in. Nice but pricy bar downstairs as well.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service from Staff”
Reviews.Author: Love2TravelAround042
Reviews.Content: I prefer to stay at places that come with a personal recommendation, but got a great deal for Tribeca Grand and figured I'd try it out. With no expectations, my husband and I had the absolute best service from the moment we arrived until post-checkout. Not being familiar with the neighborhood, relied heavily on concierge for dinner and entertainment tips. Both concierge reps we spoke with were dead-on with reading our requests and making the best recommendations. Beyond that, everybody at the front desk provided great service and attention. I highly suggest you book your stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, second stay!”
Reviews.Author: AndyJD34
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel and it's the second time that i've stayed here now, and probably will when I'm back later this year. From the moment you enter the hotel you're welcomed by the doormen and then taken back by the place as the door is opened for you. The check in was great and quick, with a glass of champagne/cava to help you along followed by a quick short stop in the lift to your room (baggage brought up for you too, so do expect to tip the person). The rooms are very clean with a great selection of complimentary soaps and shower stuff. The TV has you flicking channels all day if you can't be bother to go out anywhere. The Lounge area has the most amazing cocktail list with the dirty Martini being probably the best I've ever tasted (even though it's not on there). The food and drink is slightly more expensive than if you would pay for in a normal hotel but it's worth every cent you pay and the service is superb. I just can't fault this hotel at all hence why I've stayed there twice so far. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL EXPERIENCE & OVERPRICED - DON'T BOTHER!”
Reviews.Author: mshafir
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last month with a friend visiting from Europe. I live in NY so I know what to expect. Boy was I embarassed the entire stay that I chose this hotel out of all the places I could of stayed in nyc. I chose this hotel only because they were having a promotion stay three nights, and get the 4 night free. FALSE ADVERTISING! there is no free 4th night, they just average in the rate of the room and divide it by 4 nights. When I spoke wtith the manager he was completely RUDE and disrespectful. In addition, the staff and manager were not accomodating. Moreover, there furniture, decor and bathrooms are so old, and outdated. I would have to wait at least 5 minutes to get the hot water running in the shower. And no I am not kidding. What a terrible, awful experience overall. The worst hotel experience ever. NEVER would I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel will stay again”
Reviews.Author: paul_findlay
Reviews.Content: My friends, my wife & I all chose to stay at the Tribeca for new years eve. We flew over from Scotland and was 6/8 first time in New york and what an experience. right from arriving at the door the Door men were fantastic really friendly and helpful, they could not do enough for us. the girls on the desk were also very helpful and there was a separate concierge desk that could answer any questions that we had ref the local are or anything we needed in house, We had pre booked our new years eve tickets and we only booked general admission, I lost one of my legs while serving in Afghanistan last year and i explained this to the Noel the girl who was dealing with the party reservations and she made a table available for my party of 8 again really going over and above what was required. The new years party itself was brilliant with a free premium bar there was never a long wait for drinks and the measures were not shortened ( I suffered for it in the morning with a terrible hangover though) the staff who waited on us that evening were exceptional making sure we were never without food or champagne at any point, the DJ was great and the ball drop was a special touch. Whether staying for business or pleasure i can see why it is very appealing, situated in Soho you had the subway on your door taking you uptown or even for myself who cant walk long distances it was not a far walk to ground zero and the financial district if you want somewhere thats very relaxing yet very cosmopolitain then this is your place. A huge thanks to the Staff at the Tribeca you made our trip that wee bit more special. Paul

Reviews.Title: “Luxury with a Personal Touch”
Reviews.Author: Laurel96
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Tribeca Grand Hotel twice and found the service to be friendly and consistent. The location is convenient to shopping and great restaurants are nearby.
