We feel comfortable walking to many locations and, if we have a journey to make, cabs and subways are available. Most importantly, when you return to the hotel, you receive a smile,a greeting and a comfortable room. We ate Thanksgiving dinner in the Church Lounge restaurant during our last visit and enjoyed a delicious and memorable meal. The Tribeca Grand offers exceptional and personal service in the big city!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, pricey, but normal for NYC”
Reviews.Author: knwpsk
Reviews.Content: I stay at Tribeca Grand frequently for business. The location is nice for anything downtown. The room prices and dining prices are high, but that's NYC for you. The service has been great every time I've been there. Door, front desk, room service, bar and restaurant, concierge, etc. (I scanned a few other reviews and am very surprised at the negatives. My experience has never been bad at TG.) I like the modern rooms and bathrooms. Free wireless Internet is a plus. Each room has a white-noise generator with a volume knob on the wall -- it helps drown out city noise from the window. (On my last stay I noticed that there was a large party in the atrium, but I couldn't hear that from my room at all, even with the white noise turned off.) The beds and linens are ample and comfortable. TV/entertainment selection is very good. The bar is very popular and trendy. Always active when I've been there. Overall great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great NYC hotel near SOHO & Village”
Reviews.Author: loxdog
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night and enjoyed everything about the hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful, room was perfect - modern decor. Location was within walking distance to SOHO, Greenwich Village, NYU. Great restaurants and bars. Short cab ride uptown.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Jdpolsin
Reviews.Content: The doormen were all friendly. The front desk person was very helpful with our needs and the hotel is a very trendy, clean and cozy place to stay. The Bar area is hopping but you can't hear anything in your room. The location is fabulous for anything in the city. We stay here every time we are in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Super Nice hotel close to everything but not super busy area.”
Reviews.Author: bryan_m11
Reviews.Content: The Tribeca Grand is a great hotel in a great location. You can walk around SOHO and still go and see and do everything but yet the hotel is on the corner where it's not super busy and annoying. You can wait outside for friends or parking without being harassed. The Hotel it's self is super nice inside and the staff are always helpful and friendly. The rooms seem to be a pretty good size for NYC. The hotel has a really cool feature of white noise speakers located in the walkways to kill any of the sounds coming from the downstairs bar/restaurant area. For those that don't know, it has an inner courtyard area that extends up through the building and the rooms are arranged around this so you have a view down through the entire building. There are also some white noise speakers inside the room too which can be adjusted to different levels. Maybe the street can be noisy but while we were there it was pretty quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal!”
Reviews.Author: johntree72
Reviews.Content: We will definitely be staying at the Tribeca Grand Hotel eveytime we are in NY. The Staff was super friendly and went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable and content. The room was very clean and cozy there was a computer right in the room. Room Service was fast and friendly! The lounge was amazing SO RELAXING and again everyone was super friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: olddog49
Reviews.Content: Service was competent and courteous with one minor mishap. We had prepaid the room with points and on checkout the desk missed that and billed to my credit card again. This was corrected quickly and was partly my fault for not confirming the prepay on checkin. Other than that I would give this hotel high marks. Our room was clean and well serviced during our stay. The bed and bathroom were of good quality. Bathing products were very nice. We were on the 7th flr and so had what would be considered a good view for NY. We found the room to be quiet as opposed to other reviews. I don't know if our white noise device was on because I didn't notice it until the last morning. Slight traffic noise from 6th ave but for us negligible and in a way part of the NY experience. Hey, no extra charge. In fairness I grew up in NY but still...There was some club activity at night but again no bother to us two seniors. We had one breakfast that was of good quality though a little pricey but again that's NY. It was comparable to the other choices in the neighborhood, SOHO. The location was great if you are focusing on lower Manhattan, Soho,Tribeca, Wall Street, Greenwich Village, etc. Also very convenient to subway for travel to other parts of the city. We walked to Ground Zero, the Village and Soho and back again. The neighborhood is great for shops(Soho) and restaurants(Soho,Tribeca). I'm not crazy about the scene on Canal Street but I wasn't 40 yrs ago either so maybe that's just me. I rarely visit NY these days from CA. We have traveled in many parts of the world and we would definitely choose this hotel for future stays.

Reviews.Title: “great stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Diane9060
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with Tribeca Grand...our room was very clean and spacious. The bathrooms are very nice and contemporary. Overall the best place I've ever stayed at in New York. The location was great and we felt very safe there. I will definitley stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Grand by name, grand by nature...”
Reviews.Author: Peter-Lloyd
Reviews.Content: As a journalist who travels the world on various city-break features, I can whole-heartedly say that New York's Tribeca Grand is one of my favourite hotels in the US. A sister venue to the stunning Soho Grand, TG effortlessly embodies the style, vibrancy and allure of the city itself. Cool and savvy without being oppressive, it possesses some of the best service in Manhattan - and some of the best looking! Don't bother staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “You will LOVE TGH”
Reviews.Author: sforbes05
Reviews.Content: The staff had us hooked from the moment we walked in. They were super friendly and offered us champagne and warm hand towels. We were a few hours early for check-in but they had no problem getting us into a room right away. The rooms have a really neat retro decor and we slept really well. Everything was impeccably cleaned. We felt at home right away! There were a lot of people at the club on Friday night, but we were on a higher floor, a little bit off the main atrium so we couldn't hear a thing. Every hotel employee we encountered was very friendly and welcoming. Book this hotel, you'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Overrated”
Reviews.Author: grapeG
Reviews.Content: The rooms are quite small, the furniture is outdated and the surfaces that have been painted look like they have had one too many coats on them. Also the bathrooms feel like you've entered a rest stop, not very clean, stainless steel sink vanity, and tiny tub. Plus, when you are ready for bed it's loud, you can hear music coming from the atrium. Not a place I would ever come back to.

Reviews.Title: “Great people, great place!”
Reviews.Author: DevilGrub
Reviews.Content: Very hard to criticise this fantastic hotel. The environment has an immediately positive impact, the doormen, the recption staff, in fact everyone we met, were extremely helpful. The room made good use of the space, and the furniture and other amenites were well appointed (the widescreen TV was expected, the widescreen computer with free internet access was not!). The Tribeca area is incredibly vibrant. Situated downtown has many of the sights you will want to visit as a tourist, but you feel part of the true city, not the artificial tourist-centric one. Though the walk to midtown sights may be a longish one we managed it on a number of occasions (and the subway is 100yds from the hotel) if you want to go further. The Tribeca serves great food, has excellent room service and a vibrant and atmospheric bar. In all a virtually flawless stay.

Reviews.Title: “New York at its best”
Reviews.Author: BJohnson25
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience at Tribeca Grand for a second time. The rooms are nice, roomy, clean and comfortable. Great atmosphere at the downstairs bar and lounge. Also in a great location with plenty of incredible restaurants and shops a close walking distance. The staff was courteous and helpful and love the free internet. My only complaint would be if you have a Fed Ex package coming to the hotel, it could get hung up in the receiving room. Small price to pay for a good stay at a reasonably priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the cool and friendly atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: Susanloo
Reviews.Content: After watching the Halloween Parade and returning to the hotel with cold hands I was immediately handed a hot towel at the check in desk. How's that for anticipating your customer's needs. Great hotel, attentive staff. Loved the peppermint soap and the coffee machine (included) on every floor.Little things can make a difference.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A NICE LITTLE NEW YORK HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Warminster_PaGovgal
Reviews.Content: I travel all over the country for my job. My first business trip to NY was in April of 2010. I was aware of the high costs associated with hotels in NYC. I knew that I could end up with a less than desirable room, despite the costs. I was also concerned wih safety since I'm a middle aged woman travelling alone. I was very pleased with the hotel. They do not appear on the bed bug registry. The hotel has a trendy--New York--bohemian sophisticated atmosphere. The staff actually look at you when they speak to you--personable The toiletries are of very good quality. The rooms are well appointed. The staff is extremely courteous. I stayed again in November and my April opinion was confirmed I will be staying there once a month for the next 5 months It's walking distance to Chinatown, Canal Street and Little Italy. There's a great wine and cheese type restaurant right across the street. The hotel lounge and restaurant are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth what you pay...”
Reviews.Author: FrancesEugenia
Reviews.Content: The location is great but that is about it. The rooms are small and the room service is sub par especially for what you are paying. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “For the price you can stay somewhere MUCH nicer!!!”
Reviews.Author: rjstro80
Reviews.Content: I would never recommend this hotel! I'm giving it 3 stars because it wasn't horrible, it just wasn't as nice as we had expected. I'm not the type of person who expects perfection by any means, this was just a let down. - The Staff - was great, very friendly & helpful. We did have some room service mistakenly delivered to our room, however we explained that they must have the wrong room & there was never another issue w/ that. Flowers were supposed to be in the room when we arrived & were not, however they were delivered shortly after we got to the room. - The Room - we had the "Studio" room I believe, room 418 w/ a separate living room & bedroom. This was not exactly the case. The "living room" was a tiny love seat & table separated from the bed by a closet that didn't go all the way to the ceiling, more of a 3/4 wall. The space around the bed was literally enough room to walk & that's it. We had a hard time figureing out where we could even open our suitcases besides on the bed! The carpet & curtains were stained, the love seat had a tear in the back of one of the cushions where feathers were coming out, the coffe table had drink ring marks all over it. things just looked kind of beat up, like nothing had been maintained or updated since the place 1st opened. The sheets were kind of scratchy, but the bed & pillows themselves were comfortable. The whole room had only 1 air vent which was near the love seat, so during the night the bed area would get very warm.....the 1 a/c vent just isn't enough to circulate & cool the entire room. It was nearly impossible for us to sleep here, the noise was just out of control.....horns honking all night long, people screaming in the streets, faint thumping of music from downstairs. I literally got a couple hours of sleep the 1st night, the second night was slightly better probably from sheer exhaustion. The room had a "white noise" machine at the door which could not even be heard at the bed....completely pointless in this room at least! The hotel is surrounded by very busy streets, so the noise is kind of unavoidable I guess. They should have some sort of "black out" device on the windows that would muffle some noise. The noise situation was really teh deal breaker for me. Half the fun of a get away is to sleep in & not be woken up all night long which was just not possible here. -The Bathroom - The bathroom was a good size but lacked any place to hang a towel & the water pressure was very weak. The toilet & bathtub were very just normal....looked like the standard thing they would put in an apartment. Not exactly what you expect at a "high end hotel" The products were great! So over all it wasn't horrible, it just wasn't very nice. It surely wasn't overly trendy! We saw a very wide range of guests....some in their 60's, some with kids, some younger couples. So, I'm thinking this may have been a super trendy hot spot at one point, but it definately is not that anymore. The decor was strange, it looked like a 1970's motel room....actually from the 70's. Nothing looked nice enough or new enough to come across as being current. I'm sure the "vintage/modern" look is what they were going for, which probably would have worked had everything not looked so beat up & shabby. So, I would recommend you look elsewhere for a nice hotel in the Tribeca/Soho area!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYstateofmind1968
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in Oct 2010. The staff were all very nice and helpful and I noticed they all looked like they could be models, all young and good looking. Location was great, short walk to Soho, Little Italy and Canal St. My husband and son took advantage of the free bikes and rode along the river all the way to Central Park. Didn't eat at restaurant. Went to the famous Billy's Bakery a couple blocks away (wasn't impressed) but ate at South's just across the street and Bubby's Restaurant for breakfast (Both were so good!!!) We came around the corner from a walk one day and there were Paparrazi out in front! Turns out there was a premier for the movie Conviction. We stood and watched as movie stars hoped out of cars. Come to find out this hotel has many movie premieres here. Music on weekend was fine with us, felt like we were staying at hip hotel. One night there was "After Party" for a high profile party and supposedly numerous famous people down there. Hotel was a little pricey but I loved the location. Bell boys and door men were all very nice which added to the enjoyment. Same young men every day, came to know their names by the end of our stay. Jack, Keith and others were all great. Loved the free coffee, tea and cocoa bar on each floor...Stayed in numerous NY hotels and have yet to come across this. Loved free Wi-Fi as well. Really close to 2 subway stops which was perfect. Took Taxi to JFK but probably should have taken subway...Too stressful - had crazy driver.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE - Did I mention I LOVE!”
Reviews.Author: judybeebowers
Reviews.Content: I went here for Business and got one of the rooms with just a king bed - nothing fancy. I go to NYC once a month, and this was the first time I've been at this hotel. If you haven't been to NYC, then you wont understand the value and spaciousness of the rooms. If you go to their site, they have a lot of deals. I used the pre-pay deal and got a room for 315 / night - AMAZING! Service people always had a smile, and so helpful. This is my new hotel - you will see me here often. LA traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: oosskis
Reviews.Content: Had a good stay, the staff was very nice, the location is awesome, but it's not worth the price. I would pay half and call it ok. Small rooms, no view, decor that was trendy in the eighties. The food is good, but there are so many restaurants in the area that are better and cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Barneymollie
Reviews.Content: It took 45 minutes for them to bring my luggage to my room, even though I called repeatedly and was told it would be right up. I eventually had to go to the lobby and collect it myself. Rooms are in desperate need of updating. Carpet is shopworn, and dresser looked like a garage sale special. Mirror was held in place with duct tape. At $500/night it was a rip off. Subway train ran just below our window and kept us awake all night. STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Quietly elegant”
Reviews.Author: hove123
Reviews.Content: We were worried about this hotel being overly trendy. We should not have worried. The staff were young, friendly and efficient. Any noise on Saturday night did not permeate our 2nd floor room. We appreciated the ice machine and coffee-making facilities on each floor, the quality toiletries and the efficiency of the room cleaning. Plus the very comfortable bed. We only ate in the hotel once. The food was fresh but a little on the expensive side. The hotel is very close to subway stations so even as novice NYC subway users we managed the transfer from JFK by public transport very easily and used the subway a lot during our stay. Soho restaurants are a short walk away. Square diner is 5 mins away and great for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Pick Another Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ccg36
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Tribeca Grand in NY, and I can honestly say that it is one of the worst hotels I've stayed in while traveling to NY. I was in a one room suite, and this was a dark (decorated in chocolate brown), dreary room....even with the curtains open. The furniture was worn and cheaply constructed. As many have stated, this tends to be a loud hotel based on its location. This is true. In a normal room, the sound machine would probably be very helpful, however; in a suite, the sound machine does not extend to the bedroom area. Obviously, this is where you would want the white noise for sleep purposes. It makes no sense why they would put it in the living area. The service is terrible as well. I ordered room service and was told to expect my food in 30 minutes. When I called back after an hour, I was told, "there are several people in front of you so you'll have to wait". I ordered a burger....seems like that would be an easy order to handle. I visited the fitness center, and was not able to even work out as the treadmills were in very bad condition. I would not recommend this hotel unless every other hotel in NY is sold out.

Reviews.Title: “Great locations but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Bthomas314
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our first trip together without our son. A weekend of restaurants and shopping. The city did not disappoint. The location of the Tribeca Grand was great. Two blocks from SoHo, it was a very easy walk into the neighborhood for great shopping and restaurants. The staff at the hotel was very friendly. We enjoyed the staff. The hotel wasn't dirty, but it wasn't clean. It seemed like it was thrown together in a rush and lacked attention to detail. That said, I would stay there again if it wasn't for the noise. The reviews on this site prepared me for the noise. We had a room on the top floor opposite Avenue of the Americas-- the quieter street of the two. so we had minimal noise from either the street or the courtyard area of the interior of the building. The noise we got was from next door. Our neighbor had a coughing attack Saturday night at about 4:00am. It's one thing if the attack was such that she was falling over, banging on the wall in need of help. No, this was the old normal 'I have a cold" cough that went on for two hours. What was especially disconcerting about it was that it felt like it was coming from within our room. The noise reduction system does drown out noise coming from outside the room, but because it is located near the hotel rom door, it does not drown out noise from neighbors. We could hear-- and follow-- normal conversations the following morning. This all happened the second night of our stay. The first night we were neighborless and going to and from the hotel Friday afternoon and night into Saturday morning and afternoon very excited about the property and looking forward to returning. But after hearing our neighbors clearly the second night of our stay, we had second thoughts. That was a big enough downer to question whether we would return. And probably be unable to recommend it to friends. No privacy.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel, if you can get a deal”
Reviews.Author: samanthaonstyle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tribeca Grand in March and it was a great deal. They had a special: $500 for Friday and Saturday nights + $75 credit to use at the hotel restaurant/bars. Pros: The room was very clean and spacious by New York standards. It was by no means large, but plenty of room for two people to move around. The bathroom was clean and larger than others I've seen in New York, too. Despite the thumping club on the main floor, the room was very quiet due to a built-in white noise machine. The hotel is generally very stylish, and a great location downtown, close to the city's best bars and restaurants. Cons: I can't think of any deal breakers other than price. We managed to get a great rate, and the hotel will often have specials and package deals. However, it's pricey without one. The Sunday brunch buffet was EXTREMELY expensive and probably not worth the price, but we used our credit. Though, next time, I'd use the credit for afternoon cocktails and get a deli bagel or go to Balthazar for brunch. Our stay was dampened by a horrific rainstorm all weekend long, but the staff was extremely helpful in getting us taxis and meeting our taxi with an umbrella. I love the Tribeca Grand, and I always check the rates when I travel to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel run by 20,30 somethings with no general manager in site”
Reviews.Author: likeNYC
Reviews.Content: While it was certainly a fun girls weekend, the hotel did not rise to our expectations. The snotty attitude of the people running the front desk was not appreciated, especially one girl in particular. I signed up as a grand guest which was a waste of time since they never put the amenity in my room and when I asked for it, they seemed bothered and said I never entered in my preferences (which I did online before my stay). Still not sure I received my $75 food & beverage credit... The only friendly staff were the door men and that we appreciated. On a Friday night, there were about 6 of us who tried to get seated and buy drinks for the night in the Church Lounge. Again, more snotty attitude from the host/hostesses. When they finally seated us, no one ever took our drink order so we up and left and had wine and drinks in the room - too bad the hotel lost out on the revenue we would have generated that night. I know it's NYC but the rooms were really small and nothing that special. Cool neighborhood but would rather stay in Soho, especially Trump Soho whose attention to detail and customer service was impeccable, when we visited their 7th floor bar/deck.

Reviews.Title: “Priceline 2nd class citizen”
Reviews.Author: tclassey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel while traveling with a good friend. Checked in for a Saturday night stay. Employee at front desk claimed the hotel only had one bed available in all the vacant rooms. One of us had to sleep on the floor. The hotel seemed empty. This made our stay very disappointing. I feel we were treated this way because we booked through Priceline. In my opionion we were treated like 2nd class citizens

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, close to subway, champagne in the afternoon”
Reviews.Author: FloridaShells
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly, the room was ready early and we were able to check in. In fact, they had upgraded our room. Only complaint, needs better lighting in the bathroom. The italian restaurant right accross the street (can't remember name) as you walk out front door it is on the left was absolutely delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alittledabble
Reviews.Content: I'm not quite as enamored with this hotel as I had hoped to be, but I really can't find any complaints. It's a very nice hotel. For NYC, the size of my room is great. Some of the design details are great. i LOVE the sinks and design of the sink and shower. Very modern and fun. I agree with a couple of reviewers about a few details being very slighly worn, like the desk and dresser, but it's no big deal. The white noise machine that's built into the wall is great. I haven't had any noise problems at all. Good room service, not obscenely pricey. My only suggestion to the hotel would be better water pressure in the shower and more clerks at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “A little worn in places but the staff and little surprises make up for it”
Reviews.Author: wawaManchester
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights after staying at the Royalton for 5 nights to get a different view of New York, whereas the Tribeca Grand isnt quite as nice a hotel it still is really nice and the superb staff make up for it. The room was nice if a little worn in places but I would still give it a 4 star. For me what set this hotel apart from the others I stayed in whilst in New York (4 in total) was the free extras that you would normally be expected to pay for - such as a tea and coffee making station on each floor, 2 rooms for free internet access (inc macs) and free dvd hire. The staff were genuine and very helpful - which cannot be said for the Royalton in my experience - it really does make a difference to your overall view of a place.. The location is wonderful - only a 5 minute walk into Soho I read a few reviews that it was a bit far away but I enjoyed the walk ( it really wasnt far!)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel- one of the best! Great Staff and lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: LondonBerry84
Reviews.Content: stunning hotel, great staff! rooms are lovely, you get free drinks and there is even a white noise thing in your room to ensure peaceful night slepp. Beds are so lovely, really liked it here.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Hotel in a Really Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: dougiefreshpdx
Reviews.Content: This is exactly the sort of place that could be obnoxious if your aren't "in the band." Its not a Temple of Hipness, though; just a great hotel with a great staff. Yes, the interior looks a bit like a Euro version of a Grand Hyatt but the rooms are comfortable (though a bit small). My room (#309) had an awesome view of Church Street. The location is perfect; just a few blocks from anything you could possibly want. I grew up in Manhattan and am shocked at how incredible Tribeca is; it used to be full of sweatshops and manufacturing (!) The restaurant is decent though nothing special. I would highly recommend this hotel to savvy travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Funky rooms, good location and comfy.”
Reviews.Author: FatcatJunketeer
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night but left with a good impression. The rooms are actually quite tiny unless you are a smurf but probably fairly priced for NY. The bathroom was unusual in its heavy use of steel, making it look like a park restroom, but not in an unpleasant way. Decent sized tv, dvd player, ipod dock and comp dvds to keep you amused at all hours. Great bed, with slightly noisy but efficient air con. Loved the style and fit-out of the room. Looked funky and modern, but Im no expert on interior decorating. The bed was extremely comfy but took up most of the room. Service was decent, although it was wierd that the bell boys help you unload your luggage from the car but then leave you to take it yourself through the doors to reception and to your room. There's a small fitness room with about three cardio machines in the basement. The rooms and common areas make heavy use of dark colours and tones and the inroom safe uses your credit card as a key which was unusual. No views whatsoever, and the hotel is on the quiter end of a busy area. Subway right around the corner, as are convenience shops and restaurants/shops. Not a bad location; in Tribeca/Soho which is a fair distance from mid town and Times Square etc. Definitely better suited for the younger crowd. Its arguably close to Wall Street making it a viable choice for business.

Reviews.Title: “Wildly FUN!”
Reviews.Author: BoteroS
Reviews.Content: Although we don't fit the age profile, we loved this hotel. Very busy during Fashion week but somehow they took great care of us. The noise was pretty much of control but the white noise machines in our room took care of it. The management also realized we were not there for fashion week and took care of us with a beautiful tray of wine and cheeses. One word of caution, alarm clock was on and woke us up at 5 AM. So be sure to check it. Will stay there again, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “well located and very nice”
Reviews.Author: carter78900
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. well located. Sister hotel of the soho grand hotel. Few minutes away from chinatown. I would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff: friendly and beautiful !”
Reviews.Author: PriscilaO
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel, it is beautiful, has a great staff and a good restaurant and nice lounge bar. A little bit of noise from the outside, but it didn´t disturbed me.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money:(”
Reviews.Author: khope12
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to staying here but I was disappointed in this hotel. When booking the room I was led to believe that we were getting the "Directors Cut" package which includes breakfast, popcorn and other fun stuff. Upon check in the clerk said we were getting the film fest rate and it would take two days to set up for the directors package (we were only there for three nights) Really? Our room (a delux king), was on the 2nd floor I was concerned about noise from the street and the lounge, but it was not an issue. The linens were very nice. The rooms and hotel are dark. The concierges were snobby and suggested that I use Google to find walking tours! Isnt that their job?! Though the door men were very helpful and friendly.I do not reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “5 star staff and 4 star facility”
Reviews.Author: Filmodel
Reviews.Content: Some of the most attentive and friendly staff in NYC (and without being annoying or obsequious) Concierge was of no help with Tribeca Film Festival info, however, even though Susan Sarandon was present for a TFF related event in the restaurant area. Pet friendly :)=)~

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: Ldn_Global
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with really friendly staff who were welcoming and efficient. Big rooms with large comfy beds and all the right amenities. I stayed here because its very near my office but it's convenient for anywhere and fine for taxis up and down town. Great breakfast menu too! Any downers? Sadly, my mojito could have been better (but that's about all!)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service/Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kats16
Reviews.Content: wow....the reviews below make me sad. i left this hotel feeling so incredibly pleased. every encounter we had with the staff was above and beyond pleasant. we were genuinly welcomed by 3 or 4 staff members within minutes of our arrival, starting with our exit from the taxi. this was followed by glasses of champagne and a very friendly escort to our room. this theme of excellent service contiued over our 3 day stay. the room was clean and decorated nicely. a bit smaller than i'm used to, but it didn't bother us. i will definitely be returning to this hotel. very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: alanpho2
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, modern structure trendy rooms, would recommend to ask for a room at the tops floors; as the lounge bar is full at night and a bit noisy if you stay in a room on the first 4 floor.

Reviews.Title: “Attempting to be uber chic with arrogance!”
Reviews.Author: claxtor999
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pleasing on the eye and the rooms are a fair size for NYC. It is not cheap by any stretch, but it is NYC and it is a boutique hotel. Whilst I thought that the hotel was average for a boutique hotel, I thought that the staff were far below average. I think that if a hotel labels itself as 'boutique' it assumes a certain arrogance and this is certainly true of the Tribeca Grand. Whilst I was in NYC I arranged a little surprised get together for my boyfriends birthday with some friends. Apparently the grand is so cool that you are not allowed any accessoires to help celebrate an event (hats etc) and you are not allowed to sing happy birthday. What was even more upsetting about this spiritless 'policy' was the management's treatment of it. When someone is presented with a piece of cake with a candle on it for one's birthday then it is customary to sing 'happy birthday', however you are not allowed to do this at the Grand. The manager tried to stop us singing by doing the cut throat action, when she failed she just threw the cake down on the table and swiftly scurried off. When I challenged her on her absolutely terrible management of this situation she simply told me that we were 'disrespecting her by singing'! I literally could not believe my ears considering she was bringing out a piece of cake with a candle on it for a birthday celebration! Ludicrous. I just think that this type of 'policy' where you are not allowed to celebrate birthdays in a customary fashion is beyond imagination. The Grand is trying to be 'too cool for school' and may be this is why the bar was half empty at 11pm on a Saturday night. I will never be returning to this place, it left such a fail taste in my mouth. It is arrogance gone mad!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel let perfect strangers check us out early of our pre-paid room and stay there with our passports and belongings”
Reviews.Author: skcsf
Reviews.Content: We prepaid for 4 nights stay here and on our 2nd night when we returned to the hotel after a night out at a wedding - we found our room key not working and new guests staying in our room. When we went to the front desk to inquire what happened, they said that we had checked out at 7:40pm and that our room had new guests staying in it. We NEVER authorized a check-out - they allowed perfect strangers to check us out and let new guests take our room without even cleaning or thoroughly checking the room. We had personal belongings including our passports in the drawers of the room. When asked for a signature or proof of check-out, they responded that they do not require signature for "express" checkout, which was not even an option for our room because we had pre-paid for our hotel rooms about 2 months in advance. We were willing to overlook some of the details of our hotel room, but after this ridiculous mistake on the hotel's end, I feel okay being honest about the musty, small and dingy standard rooms at the hotel. We saw a lot of grime and dust for what is touted to be an upscale boutique hotel. We requested non-smoking room but it smelled of old smoke, or some other musty odor. We found stray rubberbands and bits of paper on the floor upon check-in - doesn't seem they vacuumed the room? The rooms are small which is quite typical of NYC hotels - I lived in NYC for five years so can understand the size constraints bu the lack of cleanliness was surprising. BEWARE of this hotel. They are not accommodating at all. I am writing this from my sister-in-law's apartment after such a terrible experience. We had to leave - disgusted by the unprofessional behavior and lack of service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYJPC
Reviews.Content: Tribeca Grand is a beautiful first class hotel. Very professional staff ready to help out in any aspect. The location is perfect for a visit to the city. I couldn't even think of a knit-picky complaint!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Brunch Service for Gluten Free, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Parisgalore
Reviews.Content: I joined friends at the Church Lounge for a Birthday Brunch and thought they had a wonderful selection and the staff was very friendly. However, being Gluten, Wheat and Dairy free I could eat very few items on the menu and asked if they had any alternative options. They didn't, but what really won me over was the fact that the chef asked if I could just give him a moment and he returned with an amazing serving of really tasty vegetables prepared with shrimp. He also offered to make me eggs without the dairy. Needless to say, I was the envy of my table. His comment that he wanted me to enjoy the brunch even though I could not eat the traditional fare was very much appreciated and I would definitely return for another brunch experience and likely a hotel stay as well.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel but service was lacking”
Reviews.Author: vacationtime2000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few times over the years and have seen different types of room. The larger suites are spacious and roomy but the standard rooms are very small for the cost. The location is relatively good. There's a subway close by and it's within general walking distance of the Tribeca restaurants/bars. But, it's probably a short cabride away from LES and W. Village and E. Village. There's a bar scene downstairs. But, can't really hear it in the rooms they have a noise reduction device. The only main downside is the staff - the service is spotty. I find at these boutique-ish type hotels staff have a bit of aloof, too-cool attitude which is fine for a nightclub but not for a $500/night hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find fault, even if I wanted to”
Reviews.Author: shaunyweston
Reviews.Content: Let's begin with the negatives, as there aren't many. So the little leaflet that explains how you can have a Mac 'PowerBook' as a loan while you're staying at the hotel is a bit old, as the laptop is no longer available. The rest is great. The location is superb, being a stone's throw (literally) from Canal St station on the blue line and not far from Franklin on the red line. The room was comfortable during our stay: enough space for two big lads like us, decent bed linen (though no duvet), soft towels (regularly replaced) and a TV that worked (I've been to so many hotels where the TV didn't work). Room service was spot-on, and the food was reasonable and tasty (we shared oatmeal and a continental breakfast), drinks at the bar were a little pricey for us, but not so different from other hotels we've stayed at. The iPod dock/radio in our room was always on when we returned, which I thought was a nice touch. And the heating/air conditioning was sophisticated yet easy to use. The view from our window on the top floor was, though not as glamorous as some views, nice enough and 'very Tribeca'. The staff were courteous, friendly, chatty and personable; they upgraded us on arrival because it was my birthday, and they would always mention my birthday every time we passed through the lobby. All in all, a great hotel that we got through a British Airways deal, and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Check-in and If Only They Could Turn on Some Lights...”
Reviews.Author: lauraAdvertising
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tribeca Grand for four nights last week. I found a great rate on Quickbook, and also had signed up for their royalty program. The rate on their web site was $75/more per night so I booked with Quickbook. When I got there, I asked if I could be upgraded since their 'loyalty' program members get this as an added value but was told that since I booked wtih Quickbooks I could not get upgraded. Instead, they put me in a terrible room facing an alley where there seemed to be trucks loading and unloading garbage all night long. Plus the room smelled like wet dogs. I was able to get the room deoderized, but I also noticed a "white noise" button so you can control how much white noise the room gets because its so loud in there. The bar and restaurant were nice but very overpriced for what they offered. It was convenient to meet friends and business people there but very expensive. I feel that the person at the check-in put me in the bad room as an "FU" for booking with Quickbook, which I think is totally unfair. If the web site does not have the best rates in town, why WOULD someone book directly with them? I will also say that the hotel is EXTREMELY dark, all of the hallways and common areas could use a little light. I would potentially stay there again, mostly because of the great location, but I hate when the person at the check-in counter is rude - they had better rooms so why not give me one? They made their point and now I've made mine.

Reviews.Title: “Poodlerific”
Reviews.Author: yaceny
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel!!! I enjoyed the location, and staff very much. The bar was a nice added bonus. The breakfast was only OK. Allows pets in the hotel which was nice to see. I had a friendly meeting with a standard poodle in the lobby, and later ran into a very unusual chinese crested under the arm of a celebrity.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Mioloto
Reviews.Content: We travel to NY about 6 times a year and stay at this hotel. As you arrive the bellman are FANTASTIC!! Each one of them are very nice and friendly. We love staying at this hotel as they allow dogs. If you can book an executive king room, corner king or junior suite, nice size rooms. Each room has floor to ceiling windows which is great. On the weekends they offer a glass of champagne on arrival. Only caution is if you get a room on the 2nd floor above the bar. There is a private party room behind the bar and it gets unbearable in the room if music is playing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: rubiesmom
Reviews.Content: We go to NYC every year, usually to celebrate my birthday, we even got engaged in NYC last year! We've stayed in several 3 and 4 star hotels all over the city, but this was hand down the best NYC hotel we've ever stayed in simply because of the location. It always surprises me when people comment on room size. People need to understand that in NYC, your room is going to be SMALL compared to rooms in less populated cities. Yes the bathrooms are small, yes you can barely get your suitcases in the room, but that's NYC, deal with it. The decor of the room was modern yet comfy. The white noise maker was GREAT, and blocked out the city street noise. The bed and linens were comfy and the bathroom was small but sufficient. The plasma tv was great and they had a good selection of channels, but you have to pay for internet, which is unfortunate. The doorman was awesome, courteous and friendly, the front desk staff was prompt, friendly and even upgraded us upon check-in. The bags were taken care of, and later transported to our room before we even inquired about them (we arrived before check-in time). The interior is very New York chic, but not intimidating, the restaurant was busy, the bar was full every night. The location of this hotel was phenomenal for anyone who LOVES bargain shopping...a two minute walk to Canal street, 10 minutes from the old cobblestone streets of Soho, about 20 minutes down to the financial district to go to the infamous Century 21. We ate breakfast most morning's in a diner, but if you don't want to sit down and eat, there was a Dunkin' Donuts right on Canal street, so you could always opt to grab a coffee. The restaurants in the area were also to die for: Nobu and Mr. Chow were a 5 minute walk, make sure you make reservations way in advance! We can't wait to return! Will be heading back in the summer!!!

Reviews.Title: “Efficient, stylish hotel with elegant rooms and good location”
Reviews.Author: tobyhd
Reviews.Content: We arrived here after a nightmare at the Hotel Chelsea and were immediately struck by this place. Our bags were taken out of the taxi before we were able to get out onto the street, we were given glasses of champagne at reception and the concierge was knowledgeable and informative. Our room was not huge but more than fine for a couple. It was impeccably clean, stylish and has an excellent view out onto the street. highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: november2728
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here with my daughter. Really nice hotel in Downtown location. Close to Soho, China Town and Greenwich Village. Subway 5 mins walk to Uptown Manhattan. Staff very friendly and helpful. Would recommend this hotel. Within a 20 min walk to the financial district, World Trade Centre and the Staten Island Ferry. Great Value for money, with a good restaurant. Rooms clean and although not big, they have everything you could want. If you want a drink there is a central tea/coffee making service on each floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway, cool hotel, very friendly, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: bookreader5
Reviews.Content: Very cool and funky hotel, but with no attitude. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful - didn't feel at all like a usual hotel experience. Fantastic location right near Soho - great for walking around, shopping, galleries, etc. We had a room on a high floor tucked away in a corner, which was great because most of the rooms are right off the atrium that is open all the way up from the lobby bar, which can be loud (and on Saturday night they had bands starting at 1130). We'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: JSAA
Reviews.Content: Tried to check in early and was advised nothing was available. Front desk attendant offered to call when room was ready and porter would store luggage. Call never came and upon return to hotel, the apology was less than sincere. After finally getting room key, was told that I would have to wait on bag until porter returned (eventhough there were two people behind the desk and no one else waiting for check in or any other service). Doormen were great; but front desk personnel were uncaring, at best. Room was typical cramped NY hotel room; nothing special. Couldn't find a pen, they use #2 pencils and leave a pencil sharpener in the room. Not really that impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service; beautiful hotel; great experience.”
Reviews.Author: VinoVeritasZZ
Reviews.Content: The Tribeca Grand has been a favorite destination when escaping for a night or two to lower Manhattan. A recent trip in October 2009 proved to me that the Tribeca Grand has developed the perfect recipe for the luxury NYC hotel experience - and it all stems from the quality of their people. ALL Tribeca Grand staff (from the valet/bell/door staff to the desk managers, concierge, bartenders and dining staff are pleasant, courteous, helpful, and professional (they actually make eye contact, introduce themselves, smile, and ask if they can help with anything!). The hotel and bar continue to provide a trendy, energetic environment, and the Sunday brunch is amazing. If you enjoy a high-end luxury hotel experience, the Tribeca Grand is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - A little loud on a Saturday night”
Reviews.Author: Jacson_M
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a long flight from Melbourne, Australia. It was early evening and the check in was friendly and smooth. The room was available and although small by international standards, was a good size for New York! Toiletaries in the room were excellent. A large shower with different massage settings on the shower head was just what I needed on arrivel. We had a light dinner in the hotel. The food was well priced and good quality. After dinner we moved in to the bar and lounge area for some cocktails. The drinks were perfect and the staff attentive and helpful throughout. We retired to our room at about 11pm and settled in for some sleep. The only downside to this hotel (depends on what you are looking for) was the noise that resonates from the lounge and the back room bar into the early hours of the morning. If you are looking for a good night sleep on Saturday night, this is not the place to be! If you are looking to join in the crowd and settle in for the night and then go upstairs to your room, then this is a great place to be on a Saturday night in NYC. All in all, I highly recommend the hotel and in great location in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: TripGoat
Reviews.Content: I despise this hotel, but I have to say it is because of one horrible experience and if that hadn't happen, I would probably have not given such a bad review. The hotel itself is large and has a convention center, Las Vegas no soul kind of feel to it. The bad experience - we were celebrating a friend's birthday in the bar with about 8 people. We order a bottle of champagne for around $80. A little later we asked for 2 more bottles. The barman said he was out of that particular champagne and suggested a similar one. What he didn't tell us was that these bottles were $350 each. My husband ended up paying for them as he didn't want to cause a scene for my friend, and the bartender said that he showed us the bottle before pouring so it was our fault. To add salt to the wound, the cheeky bartender went off and told the other bartenders who all had a great laugh. The final insult, gratuity was added to the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service in a Trendy Environment”
Reviews.Author: Insight5
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very convenient to both business and pleasure locations. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and I never once witnessed a rude or uninterested employee. The hotel was clean and comfortable. The decor was a cross between futuristic and factory environments...a very urban feel. I definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends and look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: canadia6260
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for a week. Impeccably classy and elegant hotel, trendy but not in your face. Subdued lighting and excellent furnishings in the lobby made this a very pleasant place to come back to after a long day of meetings. Would recommend it to anyone looking for a bit of old-school style in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful employees, and employees that seem like they actually like their job”
Reviews.Author: iampatrick
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip, I was exhausted when I arrived because I had flown overnight. Even though I arrived at the hotel at 11am, they had a room available for me. The doormen were amazing, they helped me find anything I needed (from a bar to coffee). The employees actually seemed like they liked their job, unlike just about everyone else you run into when in NYC. The location was perfect with subway stops just a block away. I will definitely be coming back there. I am happy to have found this hotel in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a popular section of the CIty . . .”
Reviews.Author: travel8678
Reviews.Content: Tribeca Grand is located in a convenient area in walking distance to Soho, Chinatown and Little Italy. In our past and recent visit, the hotel staff has been exceptional from check-in through our stay. Rooms are very clean, nicely decorated with top rate bathroom amenities. Very nice lounge, and we enjoyed a great breakfast in our rooms --Real plus is the complimentary coffee, tea and hot chocolate areas on each floor. Will definitely be back.. . Love this place and the great staff. . .

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but will probably try another hotel next time.”
Reviews.Author: PhilaNyyc
Reviews.Content: Good location. Stayed in a 1 bedroom suite (actually turned out to be more like an alcove studio). Room is smaller than it looks in the photos. I actually rearranged the sitting area furniture to make the space more usable. "Bedroom" was small enough that the closet door actually hits the side of the bed when you open it. And the computer was a mac that hadn't been updated for years, so it was basically useless. Couldn't even view Google Maps. When you turn on the TV, if you don't hit a channel or something immediately, it wont come on. Power button isn't enough. Right by the bathroom, kept getting a strong whiff of cigarette smoke. So, though it was nice, there was a lot that bugged me. Probably not worth the almost $1200 I spent for a 2 night weekend stay. For that money, I'll try the Standard in Meat Packing next time.

Reviews.Title: “Made a memorable visit even more memorable”
Reviews.Author: lovedesign
Reviews.Content: This is a great boutique hotel. Chic, cool, comfy and fun. Enjoyed the room, drank well in the lounge, and the staff were friendly without being overbearing. Would definitely stay there again. Best of all is the location. A great place to stay, close to all the cool neighborhoods, and perfect for getting away from mid-town madness at the end of a day.

Reviews.Title: “I am in love with the concierge”
Reviews.Author: erictn1247
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel. If you want to live in Tribeca, it is a great hotel. Rooms are small, no view to speak of and I find the "Church Lounge" a bit too dark, but it's still nice to have a semi-fashionable place to revert to when all else fails. Some sort of indie rock festival there when I was staying there made me feel like an elder indie rock statesman, nice. That said, the most spectacular feature of the place is the absolutely gorgeous female concierge who made me weak-kneed just speaking with her and to top it off was superbly competent. I felt like I was back in high school, wanting to pass her a note everytime I walked by, but as in high school I remained silent and admired her "professionalism". What a goddess. The male concierges were good too but I don't swing that way, and the doormen are friendly. A good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent design hotel with nice atmosphere in great location”
Reviews.Author: edith1911
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at the Tribeca Grand. Friendly staff, great location, good atmosphere and excellent restaurants and shops nearby. Good value for money also. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Respite!”
Reviews.Author: kmoss_8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled with friends to NYC for our 25th wedding anniversary celebration. While we love so much about Manhattan, the show, the restaurants, etc., we were really looking to get out of the busy muck of the city. Tribeca and the Tribeca Grand were exactly what we were looking for. Granted, we stayed for several days during the week, rather than weekend, but we found the privacy and solitude we were looking for, all while having easy access to concerts, broadway plays, shopping, and exceptional food. We love the sleek, European styling of the place, too. For NYC hotel rooms, these were amply appointed. The staff was friendly without being overbearing. Manny set us up with a great package that allowed us to sample some of the hotel's offerings, like incredible goat cheese and arugala pizza for late night munching. Try the ginger pineapple mojitos...a perfect blend of unusual flavors. The concierge was incredibly friendly and helpful. He tracked down a bocce court for us in the West Village for an afternoon game in the park, as well as suggested some incredible local restaurants. When I mentioned that I loved the peppermint bar soap in the room, the staff connected me to the website where I could order direct. Much thanks to everyone at the Tribeca Grand. We will be back. ~ Karen M.

Reviews.Title: “Crooks”
Reviews.Author: alexandriano7
Reviews.Content: My ring was stolen from my room. When I alerted security they told me they would take care of it and it was unnecessary to call the police. By listening to them I gave them plenty of time to cover their tracks. When I asked for copies of entries into our room I was told they would get back to me. When I asked about cameras in the hall they said there were none. Now they say they are not liable. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, dated and small.......”
Reviews.Author: WestWalesUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is over priced when compared to other 5* hotels in Manhattan. The rooms are small, dark, dirty and dated. The reality of this hotel is very different to the web site and nothing compared to the local W's or say hotel's like the Omni Berkshire, New York Palace etc. I would not recommend booking into this hotel, even if you do like the night life it offers, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Impeccable, LOVE IT!”
Reviews.Author: vishybaba
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I'm writing a review, but we've (wife, myself, 2 puppies) stayed at the Tribeca Grand more than 5 times and I can't emphasize this enough; I wouldn't stay anywhere else in the city. The rooms always immaculate, the service always excellent, the staff always remembers us, and I've never seen anyone unhappy or complaining. The food is delicious, so good there's no guilt ordering room service. Considering the level of food offered in Tribeca, staying in can be regrettable. The Sunday brunch is lavish and incredible; we once went and weren't even staying there. Best of all, it's quite possibly the most pet friendly hotel in the country. Not only does the staff recognize them and offer them room service but they're also allowed in the church lounge. Where else can you sip martini's or eat a lavish brunch with your precious little puppy babies?? The location is excellent; far enough into Tribeca that you're near everything you want/need, same thing ;), but also a cool 5 minute walk from Soho and Chinatown proper. Nearby restaurants are some of Tribeca's finest (too many to list) and of course the church lounge is always a great place to be, especially during the Tribeca film festival when even the hotel screen movies because they have a theater in the basement. Still not convinced?? For those hectic NYC days, stay in and practically every place in Tribeca delivers and, oh yea, did I mention I've never been denied a late checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, but had a problem with the shower that was not resolved”
Reviews.Author: hike369
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very friendly, but the issue we had with the shower was never resolved. The water poured out of the shower onto the the bathroom floor and soaked the floor and it even reached into the bedroom. We contacted the front desk and they said they'd send and engineer to fix the problem. They said that three days in a row and the problem was never resolved. It made the stay very uncomfortable. They attempted to address the issue by giving us free passes to the Sunday brunch. They apologized at check out but that was not satisfactory. On Friday and Saturday nights there is a party at the Church bar downstairs. The music was so loud that you could hear it in your room all evening. We were on the 5th floor. We will not stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Chic but lacking utility”
Reviews.Author: Aradia123
Reviews.Content: The look of the hotel was great --including the hotel bar Church. It's in a very convenient location in Tribeca with the subway around the corner. Also there is a free coffee, mocha, hot chocolate machine on each floor. Cons: Wireless is about $10 per day. The rooms are cramped and lack outlets, shelving and generally space to put your toiletries etc. Shower leaked out on to the floor (enough to spill into the bedroom) but the shower was made more for looks than use. The response to our complaint about this was cool and not helpful at the moment. (I'm staying here as I write this.) Will update with service responses. By the way, I'm in my 20s and on business.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: Kristinas27
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel & great service upon arrival. The room was sheek and extremely clean & quiet. They rent out an iPod & iPod player, which is a great feature. Cabs are called for you, the lounge downstairs is always happening and the overall atmosphere is upbeat and sexy. The valet was quick with retrieving the car and pulled it right up front, no dents, dings or scratches, so they handle luxury vehicles, and I am sure others, with care. I would absolutely stay again, a very romantic night in NYC...not too far from Nobu, which is a great dinner spot.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, will return”
Reviews.Author: travelinghoya
Reviews.Content: The Tribeca Grand is wonderful boutique-like hotel. The rooms are comfortable, and big enough to hold your luggage. The decor is trendy, but comfortable. The interior is an open concept, with a fun courtyard where we enjoyed our coffee and newspaper. The location is wonderful, especially for people interested in shopping in SoHo and good restaurants. The only caveat is how it is very, very loud at night because ofthe clubb-y atmosphere noise. There is a sound reduction system in the room to help counter it, but unfortunately ours did not work. We just put on white noise on our computer to fix it. I think I would check that upon arriving next time. However, the noise didn't hurt our opinion, we loved the place. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: nikser5
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed at the Tribeca Grand in mid June and loved it. The hotel itself is very nice and we were treated great from check -in to check-out. We utilised Patrick, the concierge, a lot and all of his suggestions were great. The location was perfect for us to explore Soho, Tribeca and Little Italy. Explored mostly those areas but even walked to Little Italy for dinner and it was only about a 10 minute walk. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants both a great hotel and a great location. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: KMcCorry
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights on a short break with my wife. Door and bell staff always very courteous and polite. More than helpful. Same for all staff in fact in the hotel. The hotel rate was steeps but afetr a little bit of searching I got a rate at about 60% of the hotel website rate on hotels.com. It pays to look around. The hotel is well placed convenient to Canal St subway stop and also for exploring and walking. Avoid rooms towards the 6th Ave side and low down--road noise is somewhat offputting and annoying. I would opt for the other side. I suspect we got a poor room becuse we paid rock bottom prices but I could be wrong. Rooms were spacious via NYC standard and bathrooms well stocked with good toiletries, although I note the toiletries were sparingly replenished against what si normal in many other US hotels. Whether this is derived from a green drive or a greenback motivations is unclear. The bathwoom was a bit shabby, but overall the room was a 7 out of 10. we didn;t eat or drink in the hotel once--the prices were quite high and there are any number of spots on East Broadway direction for meals and drinks. (Try Petite Abeille for breakfast, lunch, or dinner, and Another Room beside the Tribeca Tavern for a pleasant micro beer.) All in all, a good spot. We visited friends in the Soho Grand just a few blocks away and the rooms, while the same price, were smaller, and the bar scene didn't seem as good, although the location is arguably better/quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the area!”
Reviews.Author: jenniesarina
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for a long weekend and we both really liked the hotel. You can find trendier hotels in the area, but this one is just perfect. We stayed in a standard room and it was big enough for us and all our shopping! The breakfast was amazing and the staff were very helpful and friendly. A big plus for the free wi-fi which worked really well.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: Hulu
Reviews.Content: Superb service from friendly and helpful staff - with great sense of humour! Good location if you need to be in Tribeca. However, the room was a dissapointment, see enclosed pictures of our socalled "suite" - looked more like a storageroom. Does not correspond with pictures on homepage! For this kind of money one would expect more. Very dark and "hip" room, very small bathroom where you had to shower inside a tiny bath tub. Great beds, but be aware this Hotel does not have twin beds, also not mentioned on the homepage. Ordered roomservice and payd 86 dollars for juice, coffe, toast, one fried egg and an very basic omelette - definitely not worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: cjt9t9
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to the states which included 4 nights at the Tribeca Grand. The room was an ok size for NY and had a large comfortable bed and large TV. There also was a wardrobe with safe and iron. The bathroom was a good size and nicely decorated. The bar/restaurant area of the hotel was stunning and looked quite busy. The doormen were very friendly which was good as the check-in staff weren't overly cheerful! There was free coffee/tea and hot chocolate available on each floor but no milk only half and half meaning a trip to the bar to make tea. The main downside was a very noisy graduation party on one night of our stay which went on til 1am and could be heard in our room. On mentioning it to the concierge the next day we got a brief apology but didn't appear to be overly concerned at our inconvenience. We enjoyed our stay and the area around the hotel was good with subways very close-by.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, Chic, and Friendly...a surprising package”
Reviews.Author: Nursebug27
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Tribeca Grand and I know I will be back in years to come. The staff was amazing....so friendly and willing to help. The hotel itself has a wonderful cool vibe that spills over into the guest rooms. The rooms themselves are a little small but what room in NYC isn't? The location is perfect for visiting Canal St, Soho and the Village...only a short walk to Nobu if you feel like treating yourself :-) Also, the hotel bar ,aka the Church Lounge, was hopping on the Saturday night that I was there. It got busy around 10:30pm and stayed packed until after 2am...they had a DJ spinning and there was great people watching. All in all, worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: jessphi
Reviews.Content: If you need to be in Soho, there aren't many hotel to choose from. This is a great choice of a hotel. Clean and chic. Seemed like the lobby lounge bar was a hot spot for nightlife. Greeted with champaign. Valet was fast enough. The room was on a smaller side but nothing much to complain. Probably the best hotel experience in NYC where you have to lower your expectations on room size and services and load your wallet before you go. I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: NLHTraveler
Reviews.Content: We got upgraded to a bigger room when we first checked in when we asked if any upgrades were available. The service was excellent. Room service always arrived within 15-20 minutes. Everybody greeted us in the hallways and whenever we left and returned to the hotel. The management is doing a great job at this hotel. Our room was a fine size for us. We had a view of the west side. Great location. Within 5-10 min walking distance to Chinatown, 15 min to Soho. We paid $195/night through Expedia. Free wi-fii.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price for the Area”
Reviews.Author: Lattenotes
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located in the heart of downtown Manhattan. The price was great especially in comparison to other trendy downtown hotels such as the Greenwhich or Mercer. The staff is extremely freindly from the time you book a room with their reservations department to the time you check out. They will bend over backwards to make your trip a memorable occasion. Also they give pet goldfish in the rooms, that you can even take home!! This was great seemings we had a short ride home.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: alisontraveller14
Reviews.Content: Tribeca Grand is in a great location for tourists - it's an easy walk to Greenwich Village, SoHo, etc and the rest of downtown. Plus the A-line subway out to JFK is right behind the hotel, and it's generally good for public transport. Also there were bars and restaurants very close by, if you don't want to venture far. My room was fine - sizeable (for NY), clean, big windows, although not fantastic value at 450$. Very helpful concierge service. Didn't bother with restaurant and bar etc, although the bar seemed popular with people from outside in the evenings. I'd go back, for the location as much as anything.

Reviews.Title: “Tribecca is a Nice Neighborhood, this will get the job done”
Reviews.Author: FredTravelVa
Reviews.Content: The Tribeca Grand is a good hotel in the Tribeca district of NYC. The big positive for this hotel is the access to the adjacent neighborhood. You will be happiest if you get out of your room and enjoy this part of New York City. The neighborhood is relatively livable and quiet for New York City. There are a number of great restaurants within a four-five block range of this hotel. I have eaten at an excellent Brazillian and Italian restaurant. The room is clean and adequate but nothing to write home about. The restaurant inside the hotel is just ok and I have found the service slow. The ambience of the lobby/atrium is nice and kind of new-ish looking. But overall, the best advice is not to linger at this hotel. This is no ShangriLa, but the neighborhood is very nice. If you are blessed with good walking around weather, you will have a great time -- provided you leave the hotel property.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: dc23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel from Monday to Friday for business. The room is fairly small in North American standard, kind of disappointed. Internet is slow, and TV is not in good quality. (though a DVD is provided). Overall it's a nice hotel, comfortable bed, nice deco, good location. It's within walking distance to Soho area, downtown Manhattan, and subway station in 3 mins. Staffs are mostly courteous, the concierge are very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Reserved through PriceLine; Treated as though we had paid full price”
Reviews.Author: schnauzerlady
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience with PriceLine. We were delighted --with PriceLine and with the hotel we were assigned, Tribeca Grand. We requested 4* and got a wonderful temporary residence. What impressed me most is that even though we were paying well below the rack rate, we were treated as if we were full fare passengers. First we were given a minor upgrade, something I had experienced only once before in 50+ on line bookings; second, everyone, from the front desk to the concierge, could not have been more welcoming, a sharp contrast to our last NYC visit (reviewed May 2007 on TripAdvisor); third, staff members did not have their hands out for tips: we had problems with the inroom safe; when I tried to give the maintenance man a tip, he thanked me but refused, telling me the problem was their fault as they had not provided adequate instructions. You are within easy walking distance of 6 subway lines ... and there are lots of cute places to eat nearby (including some wonderful, if a bit strange, little holes in the wall for breakfast). Our favorite "neighborhood place" was called, to the best of my memory, "South": walk out the front door of Grand Tribeca and go to 11 o'clock. The food was not the very best -- but adequate; the ambiance was the closest to "Cheers" I've every experienced. Would I pay full rack rate? It would depend upon the situation; were I to again bid on PriceLine and find I had been assigned Grand Tribeca, I would be delighted..

Reviews.Title: “Need rehab and better customer service4”
Reviews.Author: gaylansue
Reviews.Content: We had booked the hotel for two nights. First of all DO NOT book one of their packages and expect to get what they state on their website. I booked the Tryst in Tribeca and the front desk barely knew what it was (thankfully I had printed out what was included and showed it to them) The rooms are very dated and need to be rehabed. Very small, old dirty carpet, paint peeling from ceiling, tiny bathrooms, dirty drapes. We booked the Executive King at 449.00 a night for the package, because we were told it was the largest. I hate to see what the smallest ones are. There was one chair so one of us had to sit on the bed to watch TV. When questioned about whether or not it was the type of room we had booked, the front desk told me they must have had the wrong pictures of the rooms on the website. Nothing at all as described to me at the Grand Guest desk. Very poor customer service. The "lounge" is part of the restaurant. Sort of reminded me of an old Hyatt with the atrium in the middle and rooms surrounding. Food wasn't bad, and the Sunday brunch was good. All in all we didn't stay the second night because the rooms were so bad. Nothing around the hotel either. If you want to be around shops, stay at the Soho Grand. Hotel was very pricy even with the "extras" in the package. There are a lot of much nicer hotels in NYC for less money. Don't be fooled by their website. The hotel looks nothing like the pictures. All in all a terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: MLS_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights over the Labor Day weekend booking a promotional rate on the hotel website. From the being to end our stay went well and we found no issues to complain about whatsoever. The staff were all very nice and we found the concierge very helpful. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars for the 4th!”
Reviews.Author: vkd002
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights over the 4th of July as tourists to NYC for the first time. I had an interview at the end of June (were put up elsewhere for that) and so I was able to take it all in when we got to the Tribeca Grand. My husband and I booked this hotel through Hotwire (chose the 'boutique' option) and read the reviews. Like all hotels, there are a couple of negative reviews here but they are the exceptions. Having lived in the UK for almost 7 years, I was nervous about the tipping at what markets itself as a posh hotel. The location was great. We do everything the hard way, so took the subway everywhere and walked a lot of the time. The subway stop is just around the corner, there is lots in the local area, and even walking to the 4th of July fireworks near Brooklyn Bridge was not too far. We even took the subway back to JFK for our flight and it was manageable - not recommended though! Must-do's nearby: Canal Street and the nearby shops - nothing like it anywhere!, shops up Broadway (keep walking!), a couple of nice trendy eateries/wine bars nearby (did not partake - too busy) or diners the other direction, and the legendary Bubby's for brunch (120 Hudson St). The door staff at the Tribeca Grand were always courteous and were extremely gracious when we did tip them (for taking our bags for the day when we were leaving, and then when retrieving them). Furthermore, the desk staff were very nice in our brief interactions with them, including getting our keys, info, and leaving our valuables in the safe (there is a small one in the room as well) and finally checking out. They seemed to be bending over backwards for customers, too - I was waiting in the lobby as they helped a bride-to-be who was putting up her bridal party there and had a complicated arrangement of treats to leave in the rooms. The room was small (a standard double) but not overly so. What you would expect for a big city. Large windows and clean lines in the decor helped to make it feel airy and we had plenty of space for all of our things. Nice storage for clothes, etc. The bathroom was chic and in good order. Wonderful toiletries, which the staff replaced entirely each day. Good hairdryer, although a) I brought my own and b) it was so humid that once I stepped outside all styling was undone anyway. There were comments from other reviewers about the noise from the atrium. This wasn't a problem for us, even over the weekend. It made for a great atmosphere during the day and evening. The whole hotel is extremely stylish and if you have the chance, take a peek at the film-screening area downstairs (same level as the gym). You have to pay for the wireless connection, and we didn't need it much so I didn't try it. Everything was excellent but I didn't have any food or drinks there as I got the impression that everything was a bit too expensive. If I'd paid full price for the room, I might not have seen it as so great. (We paid about $200/night.) But the location was excellent too, so perhaps it's worth it?! I'd certainly stay there again for the same price and in a pinch might even pay a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten Path”
Reviews.Author: Karen436
Reviews.Content: We decided at the last minute to take a trip to New York City. After searching the internet for the best deals we chose the Tribeca Grand Hotel. As a first time visitor to New York we were leary of not staying in a familiar "chain" hotel. What a pleasant surprise! Our choice of hotels was superb, could not ask for anything better. The rooms were large and modern. The inside atrium was gorgeous and we felt so safe in such a big city. The concierge was very helpful in booking our helicopter tour over the city he even gave us some batteries for our camera, so thoughtful. We chose to eat all of our meals in the hotel restaurant as it was so very very good. The service was superb, our waitress was over the top! We look forward to staying here again when we visit New York.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of a Faded Star”
Reviews.Author: LorTor
Reviews.Content: Wanted to splurge in NYC, and booked a room here. I have mixed feelings about it. The room felt like the absolute pinnacle of design - from about 2003. It just seems that time has ever so slightly passed the Tribeca Grand by. In a regular hotel, that's fine, but I honestly expected more given their reputation. Try the SoHo Grand instead!

Reviews.Title: “Tribeca Grand lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: PlusChild
Reviews.Content: Great service, great location, great rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant... until check out.”
Reviews.Author: msmabel
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Tribeca Grand for a business trip. Because there was a bit of a savings and a few extra things my business partner and I booked the "Tryst in Tribeca" package which included a "full american breakfast delivered to your room" along with champagne on arrival (which we never got, maybe you had to ask for it). We ordered the breakfast from the room service menu the first night - when it was delivered the next morning the guy gave us the bill with the full amount charged to it.
