I told him that we had the "tryst" package and the breakfast was included. I gave him our card that listed all of the items that came in our package and he seemed satisfied with that and said he would correct it. Next day we had arrived too late the night before to order from the room service menu. The next morning we called down to the front desk to see if it was too late to order breakfast that was included in our package - the person that answered said it wasn't and to get "whatever you like". So we got a hold of room service and got two breakfasts (salmon and whitefish platters - not cheap at $25 each), one fruit salad, two oj's and coffee and tea. They brought it up to us and again gave us the bill ($108), we told them that we had the "tryst" package and that it was included. They acted like they knew nothing so we told them to call the front desk and have them explain that it was included.... getting frustrated at this point since our room cost about $400 per night you would think that room service and the front desk could communicate with each other. So.... that morning I go to check out and, of course, the bill has both of our breakfasts on it. Then after I explain about our "full american breakfasts delivered to our room" package the desk person brings it back to the manager. Apparently we had a $60 limit for each breakfast. We were supposed to have received a voucher when we checked in that explained that information (never received it). I explain to them that I never received it and didn't know there was a spending limit (which you would think they would explain to you when you check in or even when you book the reservation... in case your voucher isn't in the packet that they give you.) After 15 minutes of waiting around (and the next customer behind me checking out and having their breakfasts on the bill as well) I had to leave. The manager wasn't able to speak right then so he called me while I was in the cab - I explained myself that we never received a voucher. He said he couldn't do anything about it and that we would have to pay the difference in the amount - he was really not nice about it and basically made me feel like crap. I was really disappointed in their customer service which is why I'm writing this review. If he had been a little more flexible and understanding and offered to not charge for that extra $60 or so bucks (which there is about the cost of 2 oj's, coffee tea and a bagel) then I would be writing a much nicer review. The room was pretty - although the tv sound kept getting softer then really loud. The bed was comfy. The food was yummy. I just wish the people had been more accommodating and understanding. Beware if you book a package from them to get all the info ahead of time and know there is a limit on a "full" breakfast. Oh yeah, and get ready to spend some serious dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth it!”
Reviews.Author: drumchick
Reviews.Content: We booked the Tribeca Grand Hotel through Priceline for a girls weekend in NYC. Wasn't too sure what to expect given some of the reviews we read. Wow, were we ever impressed! The star treatment started when we checked into the hotel and were offered a glass of champagne! We were pleasantly surprised to get a room with two double beds high up on the 7th floor even through the Priceline booking was for a King. Could not hear any noise throughout the whole weekend from the bar. Another plus was the free coffee/hot chocolate machine (found on every floor!). The room itself was extremely spacious - the largest I've ever seen for a NYC hotel. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Location was ideal - walking distance from Canal Street and Soho and steps away from all major subway lines. Would HIGHLY recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LMC_Canada
Reviews.Content: We were a little concerned after reading various reviews about this hotel on Tripadvisor regarding noise. Yes the hotel has an open atrium and on the weekend the bar is loud, but for us noise was never an issue. The rooms are smalli (king sized beds only no doubles) but very nice and the room was very clean. Staff was excellent. Great downtown location. Recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: AlanaJean
Reviews.Content: My mother and I made a reservation to stay with another hotel in New York. The hotel, after discovering that they had overbooked for the night of our check in, made arrangements for us with the Tribeca Grand. The staff were courteous, kind and prompt. Instead of transferring the next day, we asked if the Tribeca could give us a rate comparable to the one our original hotel offered. They could and they did! We stayed our entire vacation with them. On Saturday nights they offer a complimentary flute of champagne! The rooms are clean and cozy-- a welcome respite from the bellows of the surrounding city. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good - Lousy bar staff”
Reviews.Author: BlahBlahScotland
Reviews.Content: Booked on Priceline for $190/night so really didn't care what I got. Got this and was pleasantly surprised by the quality. Was happy to be in Tribeca, an area I've grown to love for the relative tranquility yet proximity to Canal St/SoHo shopping etc. Plenty of restaurants/bars nearby (try the Landmark Restaurant a couple of streets away, great meal and they have a $30 Petite Syrah (only petite on the full bottle menu) that was awesome at such a reasonable price). Hotel room Exactly what I expected. Not huge, not small. Lovely king bed, large flat screen TV. Last review said he/she needed 2 controls..huh?? One remote operated the TV, large channel selection, decent movies. Bose clock radio was good. In room safe is secured using the credit card you used to book. Mini bar looked good but as you would expect...expensive. Toiletries, lovely, peppermint and lavender or some such thing...although conditioner was almost too thick to get out of the bottle. Had no need for the white noise in the room......I had no issues with noise form the bar below but was on top floor. Aircon worked well and was fairly quiet Grand Guest I had signed up for this but booked through Priceline so they said it wasn't applicable....I disagreed and asked for a manager, pointed out to her that this being my first visit, I would contend that looking after me now might bring me back; the promise of a foam pillow , cookies and milk on a future stay when booked through their website only (thus paying 50% more) would not....surely repeat business is the point....she agreed...2 glasses of champage, milk, cookies, foam pillows, goldfish (Bruce - lol), continental breakfast each morning and an 8th floor room soon were agreed upon. Services Free internet behind the concierge or WiFi throughout (I think). Didn't eat there so no idea about that but did try to get some cheesecake about 1am on Sunday morning - room service had an answering machine, I went to bed. Bar NYC bar staff can be a bit brusque but these lot added ignorant, slow, inept and unhelpful to the mix. Friday midday, just arrived, meeting others, went to bar. Sat for 20 minutes unserved (was alone). Female bartender was stocking up/ getting ice etc, fair enough...she sees me gives me the fakest smile ever...no words....looks at me and gives a slight upward motion of her head which I took to mean "Hello sir, how are you today? What can I get you?"........ Saturday night, midnight - bar closed despite there being about 15 persons there, mostly residents....so this whole nightclub thing that seems to be a problem here certainly wasn't this night. I asked for the bar manager.....never appeared, I then watched the greasy haired Lothario wannabe behind the bar serve 2 young girls a full 15 minutes after I was told the bar was shut. I walked right over there, in his line of sight, prepared to let it go and just get a couple of drinks, to be roundly and completely ignored. I lost it at this point so waved him over and told him that his lack of professionalism was beginning to annoy me and that this was not his personal pick-up joint. He seems a tad nervous as I'm a big man, not that I threatened anyone or anything......some manager arrives to 'deal with me' however, I'm a professional, decent, nice person as is my girlfriend so what started out with him preparing for an arguement dissolved into me being apologised to, told that the senior person present chooses when to close the bar based on number of people there etc. made sense to me and I told him that but also told him what had gone on with the girls and Lothario boy...4 drinks were soon in my hands and off we popped to our room. Sunday night 2am - bar closed prior to my arrival, snotty nosed little runt behind the bar treated me like utter filth, sort of like "Duh, it's 2am...what,are you stupid" kind of attitude, with less words. I couldn't be bothered with another fight so we went to bed. Check out They tried to charge me for the cookies and the breakfast (I signed nothing as they were Grand Guest amenities)...this was a different person to the one that I checked in with. Bored with it al now, I asked for another manager, luckily same one came out...nearly had a fit when she saw me again..lol....sorted the problem out. I say all this to highlight that their lack of customer service throughout the property ended up costing them a few $$. A simple "I'm sorry Sir, we're closed for the night but I'd be happy to connect you to Room Service or send something up with them" etc etc was all I was looking for. 3 bar staff and not one of them with the knowledge of how to acknowledge a guest or prioritise those standing at it awaiting service. Given the inconvenience that the bar appears to be to many other guests (to the extent that white noise is in every room) I would have to assume that it is the main source of income here or at least a very significant one...if that is the case, get your staff better trained and learn to milk the cash cow. General Good area, nice, clean property, bell staff excellent, managers excellent but working too hard to rectify mistakes by/atitudes of their staff. I doubt I'll go back by choice but if I Priceline it and this comes up I'll be happy with that too. I'll be sure to take names and challenge bad practice though as the managers are decent people and see sense. Who likes that much confrontation during a weekend though??

Reviews.Title: “Didn't meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: FielderSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tribeca Grand for a business trip. The rooms were nice, but we had some problems with details. First, the windows could not be opened or closed except with the help of an "engineer" from the hotel. I was booked into a smoking room (which was not what I requested but couldn't change rooms because they were full) and the windows were open when I checked in and the following day housekeeping opened them as well (even though I wasn't smoking in the room). After getting in at 12:30 that night, I had to call the hotel "engineer" to come close them for me. One of the people I was traveling with wanted their windows open, and had to call someone to open them for him. What a pain! Would be nice it you could open and close the windows yourself. Additionally, all three people in my party had trouble figuring out how to use the TVs in their rooms (there were two controls that had to be used). Finally, they give you a questionnaire to fill out when you check in about your prefereces (what type of pillow, snack, etc.) which gets you all excited about your assumed special treatment, and find out you get none of your preferences on your first stay; they just keep the information on file should you ever stay there again. It would be helpful if this were communicated up front so as to set expectations, as all of the people in my travel party were expecting their preferences (foam pillows, chocolates, etc.)! On the positive side, the bed was very comfy. Next time I go to NYC I will probably stay somewhere where more "action" is going on -- good restaurants, shopping, etc., as there didn't seem to be much around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tribeca Grand -- Pros & Cons”
Reviews.Author: Buben
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tribeca Grand for an extended work stay. The pros of the hotel: (1) excellent location, in a very cool area of NYC, near public transportion, great restaurants; (2) very nice staff -- helpful, not offputtingly hip. The cons: (1) downstairs becomes a nightclub scene most nights of the week, and even in my 8th floor room, you could hear the noise; (2) decor is getting a little worn around the edges. Overall, this is an above-average hotel, although I would say that some other boutique hotels I've stayed at in NYC (Hotel on Rivington, Bryant Park Hotel) were a bit better in terms of style.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, very helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: littlechickan
Reviews.Content: I spoke to reservations at the hotel and they advised me to become a "Grand guest" as I would get a discount when booking online. I was concerned about the noise from the bar after reading other reviews and so requested a high floor room. We were given early check in and I was really pleased to see we had a 6th floor room (there are 8 floors). Each floor has a coffee machine, which also provides hot chocolate and hot water - which was brilliant for tea-making after a hard days shopping! There's also an ice machine. The room was quite spacious (we upgraded) and had a good view over Avenue of the Americas. The only noisy night was a Thursday when a DJ played in the bar for a party. But once the door is shut we couldn't hear anything. The white noise machine sound like teh air-con but it wasn't needed. I thing noise may be more of an issue if you are on lower floor. The hotel is ideally situated if you want to shop downtown in the SoHo area, but it is also 5 minutes walk away from Canal Street which has loads of different subway lines to all parts of the city. Getting a cab is very easy too as the hotel is at the intersection of 2 main roads. The hotel staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. We asked the concierge to recommend bars, restaurants, diners which were really good. Ask for the shopping map as it has all the shops in the SoHo, NoHo area as well as uptown. This is a great hotel to stay in if you want to be able to access all parts of the city easily but want the feeling of a local neighbourhood. Great shops and bars in easy walking distance and they are friendly and helpful in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: remote1206
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tribeca Grand on 3/29/08 for my 5th Anniversary. It was beyond atrocious. They put us on the second floor, failing to advise us that the atrium (the rooms all overlook the atrium) turns into a nightclub until the wee hours of the morning. Suffice it to say, all of the reasons why you don't want to sleep in a nightclub came true here. Even worse, after agreeing not to charge me for my room, the hotel charged my credit card anyway!! Avoid this hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Great But Not Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: LadyMorgana
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel - don't get me wrong - but for the money you pay there is better value around. I have to say the staff we so friendly and helpful that they did make us feel welcome from the minute we arrived. I usually stay upper west or midtown but decided to stay around Tribeca this time. The location is Ok if you want to be close to Soho but not in the middle of it and its a breeze getting in from the airport on the A train as the stop is right by the hotel. So Canal Street is nearby and there are lots of shops but there was not the number of bars or restaurants I expected. This probably explains why the hotel bar is so busy (untila round 2am on weekends) which can be a bit dull if you are trying to get some sleep. We were on level 5 and could still hear the noise even with the white noise machine turned right up. Rooms are adequate but I don't think they cleaned evry well as by the thrid day everything was very very dusty. Great toiletries (Malin & Goetz) and the coffee machine is also a real bonus. Forget the gym however.

Reviews.Title: “I like this hotel a lot!”
Reviews.Author: SojournerMobile
Reviews.Content: Anyone who has read any of my reviews knows that I am hard to please when it comes to hotels, but this hotel is excellent. I really like this place. It's expensive, but the decor is nice, the rooms aren't closets as SOME artsy fartsy hotels in New York and the service while it had a hiccup when I first checked in was completely excellent. The hotel has a good lobby, you WILL have to pay for Internet access (which is a down for a hotel this expensive), and the TVs were kinda cheapo for what I would have expected from a hotel in this price range. The bed and the bedding was great and the location is prime if you're in town on business. If you're traveling with family or here for more of a vacation, I'm not sure this is the right choice for you because you'll do more traveling than you would otherwise. The price for drinks and the restaurant were lower than the norm which caught me off guard. As for noise since it is in a busy location, I was on the 4th floor and didn't hear anything other than mild background noise on occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel that offers pet fish and ipods with your stay”
Reviews.Author: ms_obvious
Reviews.Content: I was in NYC for business and everything was booked so we had to stay at this hotel. They have a small but nice gym. The rooms have "white noise" pumped in so you can't hear the street noise. They have coffee bars on the floors to. Very good breakfast from the hotel resturant.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Tribeca Grand, great location, friendly staff and worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: Happy-places
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to NY and we decided to stay in SoHo rather than up or midtown as we had seen a lot of the sights and wanted to enjoy the funkier side of the city. The Grand is instantly recognisable due to its corner location, big clock and strange triangular shape! The decor is ultra modern and the vibe is quite "hip" with very youthful and exhuberant staff. The bar and restaurant were great - a little pricey but this is NY and the pricier area of SoHo so only what we expected - attentive staff, table service and a bar area. The food was a la carte sort of style but in american proportions - another words there was plenty! The rooms are very stylish with all the mod cons and a coffee machine is situated on each floor with free fill ups - always helpful for the late nights and early starts! Although the rooms are a little on the cosy side, this is pretty normal for NY and they are more than sufficient for getting ready in, sleeping in and being nosey from! We loved our stay here and found the staff really helpful; directions were given to various night haunts and when BA lost our luggage we were compensated with some lovely bubbly by the amazingly helpful receptionist! There is loads to do in the area, Canal St is literally round the block - not my thing but its there all the same! - the shopping in Soho is better than uptown, unless you want the big stores like Macys, but there is a Bloomingdales and pretty much everything else you could want. There are some great restaurants in the area but I would also recommend the Eggs Benedict at the hotel for breakfast and I would recommend you eat there one night during your stay as it really was that good. Have fun at the Tribeca Grand! Oh and go to TAO for dinner, its uptown, you will need a taxi and a hefty wallet but my god the food is to die for! You will need a reservation - I booked 3 weeks in advance and was lucky to get a table so don't wait until you get there!!

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: maralexa79
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked this hotel last August during our last 4 days out of a 2 weeks stay in New York. For our first 10 days we stayed in On the Ave Hotel. And it was great .Great location, service and great staff .But we decided to treat our selves for the remaining days with a more expensive hotel in the lower part of Manhattan. We saw that the rates of the Grand Hotel were higher than the previous hotel , but we took it any how. When we got there, the staff was indifferent, the room has this pretentious 60s theme that only made it gloomy. We had to call to remind them to bring the bathrobes and to refill the small bottles of shampoo which they would forget to do systematically for our stay there. The lounge area at the entrance was an extra pretentious meeting place for what I assumed were "aspiring actors" and people in the showbiz. And since everybody coming to the hotel to meet other people was overdress , we , as tourists, in our "tourist outfits" felt permanently eyed up and underdressed just by passing by. Useless to say that after the first night, we wanted to move back to our first hotel , but they were fully booked.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown scene; tiny loud rooms”
Reviews.Author: auntiecoco
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on expedia to stay at the Tribeca Grand. A beautiful hotel with great service. Fantastic bar. The rooms are tiny, but hey, it's NYC. I didn't expect a big room. Good Service. Very clean and comfy. If you are staying on the weekend and have trouble sleeping, I would avoid this hotel. There is a central atrium that is stunning to look at, but amplifies the noise from the bar below.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Room takes a back seat to Lobby”
Reviews.Author: Leisureboy
Reviews.Content: While room #225 was average at best in size, maintenace, ammenities and retro design, the real show stopper is the 8 story open atrium with clubby atmosphere and industrial chic decor. Rhythmic lounge music prevails on the weekends into late hours with all the partying hipsters. The noise-dulling device in the room is effective. Friendly and welcoming staff. Puny gym. Pet friendly. Excellent and popular Sunday Brunch in the atrium. Movie viewing room on lower floor. Soho shopping and dining is 5-7 blocks north. Midtown and theater district is a 20-30 minute cab ride away in traffic. Hotel is a good choice to be away from congestion further north, edgey neighborhood and trendy design.

Reviews.Title: “The TGH is FAB!”
Reviews.Author: ellysian
Reviews.Content: We stayed in TGH for 5 nights in mid January. We had previously made a similar visit to hotel some 5 years ago and we were pleased to see that the hotel had lost none of its trendy ambience and a recent refurb had ensured our suite was in v.g. condition. Nothing to complain about with the front desk, concierge and housekeeping service being excellent. The Pound Sterling has good exchange rate with the US dollar at present so this did help immunise us to an extent from the rather steep room rate and bar tab(s). The hotel is in good location for subway. If you need to pick up a taxi the cost to midtown or back is in the region of 12 dollars. We pootered about in Soho/ Tribeca areas on this trip quite a bit and visited the Mercer Hotel and its much revered kitchen restaurant. We were not impressed considering the place very overhyped. Balthazar by contrast was a delight and well worth a visit. We are visiting NY again in the autumn and depending on dates and workload will almost certainly be going back to the TGH.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SERVICE but needs some improvements”
Reviews.Author: chanel49
Reviews.Content: the hotel service was excellent.....but the room needs some small improvements......more lighting(too dark)......cotton balls and q-tips.........a fan in the bathroom..........the upside to the room was a wall sound machine........very good for sleeping.........and a very easy safe to get in and out of...........we had a very nice stay and would consider going back again...:)

Reviews.Title: “Pure NYC”
Reviews.Author: sham1274
Reviews.Content: Had a great long weekend at the tribeca and managed to fit in a 101 things into a few days, The hotel was great with a happening lounge which was good for inviting frineds back to. The location is also really why we picked the grand. So many good restaurants and shopping near by. The concierge was excellent and organised some must see things and table reservations for us. Staff on the whole were professional and curteous as you would expect. I would recommend the hotel for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at the Tribeca Grand”
Reviews.Author: BarnseyLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tribeca Grand for 3 nights just before Christmas and enjoyed our stay very much. The rooms are modern and relaxing. All rooms have a large TV and a Bose CD player/Radio. You can borrow Bose sound docks for ipods as well. We felt the room was definitely spacious enough and not small at all (unlike some reviews on this site). Maybe they are small by American standards (they do not have 2 double beds in them as some American hotel rooms do, the bathrooms are on the smaller side - there are not two sinks - just one!) but it was fine for us! The service in the hotel was generally very good. Our bags were taken care of for us, the hotel doorman flagged down taxis for us, staff were always very courteous and helpful and room service was fairly rapid (took around 20 minutes from ordering - the same amount of time that they said it would take when we ordered). The rooms were cleaned daily and to a good standard. We booked the Tryst in Tribeca package. It is definitely worth booking one of their packages if you can. It actually worked out cheaper than simply booking 3 nights at the hotel and in addition we got an American Breakfast every morning (via room service), champagne and strawberries on arrival, a free cocktail at the bar (they are VERY strong - be warned!) and late checkout on the last day. We felt that by New York Hotel standards, the hotel was very good value for money - as New York is a very expensive place to stay. However, we haven't stayed at other New York hotels so we can't compare to other hotels. The breakfast by the way, was very good - and kept us going until late into the afternoon! Other reviewers have complained about the noise from the bar. Yes the bar can get noisy, but we requested and got a high floor room. We were on the 7th floor (there are 8 floors) and we couldn't hear a thing from the bar even without the white noise. (They have white noise machines in the rooms to mask the noise). Tribeca itself is quite a good location but it depends what you are looking for. There are lots of good restaurants around (We went to Nobu Next Door and would highly recommend it) but for bars, you might want to go to nearby SoHo (about a 10 min walk) as Tribeca is quite quiet at night. SoHo is also excellent for shops! The nearest subway is a 2 minute walk away - and it's about a 10 - 15 minute ride to Fifth Avenue or Times Square when you want to go to bigger department stores or see the sights of New York. We'd definitely recommend this hotel to people who'd like to stay in a good 4 star hotel, which is conveniently located for SoHo. It's not luxury, but it is 'Hip' and very comfortable with great service as well!

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: Will2008
Reviews.Content: Never written a hotel review before, but had to on this occassion. TG may have been cool, edgy or whatever at some stage, but not any more. Spent the weekend wondering why we didn't stay in 60 Thompson or Soho Grand. They're basically the same price and way better. Nobody in reception when we arrived. Bar was booked for a private party so we were stuck in some basement room. General fit-out was dated. Restaurant service was less than enthusiastic...food was average. Concierge was very helpful, as were doormen. Basically came away from the hotel feeling that for the same money, I've stayed in better hotels in better locations in Manhattan. PS Nobody seemed to have a clue where the hotel was located. PPS No fishbowl or i pod player in room as suggested in website...unless you contacted room service.

Reviews.Title: “disgraceful service”
Reviews.Author: Clangerstyle
Reviews.Content: Had the worst experience with a rude surly waitress who ruined our stay here... she actually became aggressive with us and we had to call for assistance from the manager,, rooms ok but small and most rooms didn't have a bath.. don't stay here if you like good service as from the front desk to the waiting staff they were inept and unpleasant..

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place (and I'm fussy!) - Excellent Location, Trendy NYC feel”
Reviews.Author: Piper37
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in grand king room (ave $350 per night). Turned off the white noise system as had no problems with noise. Very little traffic around that area at night and middle of day. Hotel itself was very trendy (don't understand the run down bit in others but perhaps we had a refurbed room?!). The lobby, bar, restaurant area is really cool and great place to relax. We had food at the bar 2 nights and both served quickly and good quality. Had drinks most nights at some point and always greeted very well and seated on comfy sofas even if it was just for a coffee at end of tiring day shopping. The staff were v. friendly and welcoming at door, getting us taxis etc. Bathroom I thought was just average for a city centre hotel. The floor cold have been cleaner though! - great toiletries. Great locatation for restaurants in TriBeca & Soho (Bouley bakery for breakfast, Balthazar for brunch, Loopa or Boom for lunch/dinner, Nobu if your feeling flush!) Across the road from Bubble Lounge for champagne cocktails and also a good wine bar Vino Vino. It's such a good area if you want to wander round the smaller stores in the more trendy streets of soho and be able to go out at night for food etc. Different from the madness of Times Square which we did last time. Overall could not fault the stay here at all - we'll def. be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Tribeca Grand has Great Staff, Super Trendy Bar/Lounge”
Reviews.Author: KStarrr
Reviews.Content: I was surprised at how friendly the staff was at this trendy, boutique hotel. It had all the NY flair without the NY attitude. I tagged along with my husband, as he was doing business in NY, and I was never disappointed with the food, drinks, or service at the hotel. Everyone from the doorman to the housekeeping staff was super attentive. We are in our 20's and wanted to stay somewhere that didn't have a stiff, snooty, atmosphere as many upscale hotels do, and we were not disappointed. My only concern was that the room needed some minor repairs. No big deal! It's NY! The fact that it was within walking distance of all my favorite SoHo shops compensated for the minor room issues. I would stay here again. Yes, it's expensive, but again, this is New York.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive - but its New York”
Reviews.Author: JaseK
Reviews.Content: A very nice trendy hotel, that hosted "the beautiful people" of New York.The gym was pretty poor and we had a room near the lifts and could hear them going up and down all night despite the white noise machine in the room. Staff were very friendly and accommodating, overall pretty expensive and not quite worth it.

Reviews.Title: “nice location, not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: OlivierReykjavik
Reviews.Content: You arrive at this nice place in a charming area, the reception is right in front of you, the check in was easy, professional and nice. The room was Ok, small and noisy, extra small bathroom (excellent shampoo), interesting deco but not in very good condition. Nothing like a room you are paying $750 for. Breakfast in the room was thrown on a tray with no butter with the toast and no salt for the eggs, service was better in the main room - the food was good though. The staff is almost unpolite. It does not make you feel like spending anytime at the hotel. Overall it would be an fine place to stay in the area if the price was reduced by 50% - For 20% more, I would rather stay again at the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Totally amazing!”
Reviews.Author: LeepyLoo
Reviews.Content: Had an absolutely amazing stay at the Tribeca Grand. Chose this hotel as Soho Grand's reviews where not 100% and feel we definitely choose correctly. The hotel was very ultra modern. Staff to open doors for you. After arriving from the UK was absolutely shattered and they did everything for us. Rooms were brilliant. Again really superb modern decor. Beds were amazingly comfy. Sound proofing in rooms, although we didn't use it and noise was fine. No problems at all. They automatically upgraded us when we arrived which was a super touch. Right in the heart of Tribeca where there are loads of fab bars and unlimited restaurants around. Definitely won't go hungry or thirsty. Downside. Unfortunately there will always be something, although it was all rectified immediately. When we arrived and the porter took us to our room which we'd asked for non smoking, the room smelt heavily of smoke. The porter went downstairs and got us keys to another room straight away and apologised. Breakfast on both days which is not included was stone cold!!...once again, they apologies prefusely, sent it back, got us another and didn't charge. Food does take some time to get aswell so don't look to be in a hurry. Overall will definitely go back to New York again soon and will definitely stay at the Tribeca Grand. Superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great for New Year's”
Reviews.Author: bigtimedee
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay during the holiday season. My girlfriend and I spent New Year's 2007 here and loved it. I encourage you to book a room now if you're planning on spending NYE in NYC. The rooms aren't too spacious, but it's Manhattan -- what else do you expect? The Church Lounge has better-than-average food and it's a great spot to people watch. The location (Tribeca) is perfect; it's a prime neighborhood for foodies and you're not too far from just about every subway line. Plus, cab fares to the major nightclubs and lounges won't break the bank. Speaking of $$$, my only complaint is the hotel's policy of charging $150 extra per night on top of the agreed-upon rate. They say it covers any damages to the room. Therefore, upon checking in for a 4-night stay, you're wallopped for an extra $600 that doesn't get credited back to your account for a few days after check-out. Kinda makes you want to break a lamp. Oh, the irony.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaximusMom
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Tribeca Grand was amazing from the very first minute to the very last. The staff was polite and efficient, the club in the lobby very fun and hip, and the room was just plain sexy. They had a fabulous array of cheeses, fruits, and beverages waiting in the room. The bed was so comfortable that it was nearly impossible to leave it. They not only take pets, but welcome them, and will arrange dog walking and/or sitting should you need it. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Tribeca Grand - fabulous for a weekend of shopping!”
Reviews.Author: LondonBlonde
Reviews.Content: The $ is struggling against the £, so a girlfriend and I decide to hit the NY shops for a weekend blitz. We left it until the last minute to get a good deal on a hotel - and were glad we chose the Tribeca Grand.... Great location... 2 blocks from the Soho shops.... Great lobby... spacious and lively but not too noisy Great service... glass of champagne on arrival at reception Great room... received an upgrade EVEN THOUGH we were "budget" lastminute website customers. Huge and comfortable kingsize bed, Bose soundsystem, plasma tv etc. Great food... a delicious breakfast in the restaurant before a hard day of shopping I really would struggle to find fault. Others have observed they found it noisy... but we did not find it at all so, and turned our "white noise" function in the room off. I would definitely return and recommmend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “My First Choice For NYC”
Reviews.Author: Karoshisan
Reviews.Content: I've had two recent stays at the Tribeca Grand when traveling for work. Both stays were lengthy (7+ days) and both stays were very pleasant. My personal favorite features of this hotel are the coffee machines on each floor. In the same area that you will find the ice machine, there is a single cup coffee maker where you can make drip coffee, mocha coffee, tea, etc. The area includes sugar, sweet & low and creamer for your use. This is especially nice for those (like me) that need coffee to get going in the morning, but don't want to pay for room service to bring you a pot of coffee. The rooms are quite comfortable. Beds are nice, Bose alarm clocks and a variety of CD's are in the rooms. Work desk with Aeron chair are nice for those of us traveling on business, although thanks to the wireless internet, I usually found myself working while propped up with pillows in bed watching the lovely LCD television. Windows do open a teeny bit if you like fresh air, but they are difficult to open and close. Housekeeping was spotty, but usually quite good. There were occasions where a newspaper I had left behind to read in the evening was thrown out. All in all, a minor issue as usually the service was very good. Room service is definitely over-priced, but the food is good (not great) and usually arrives quite quickly. Staff are all very friendly and accommodating and really go a long way towards making what few little flaws there were seem insignificant. I have stayed at the SoHo Grand in the past, and by comparison the Tribeca Grand is far superior.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...”
Reviews.Author: LIzVancouver
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. The staff were friendly and I had no problems. I stayed there for two night for over $400/night so expect to pay about that much but it is New York and it is a nice place so that seems to be the going rate around downtown Manhattan (unless you want rats and bugs and hookers). The area was safe and I walked to ground zero in around 10 minutes. There are lots of Canal street subway stops close by and cabs everywhere so getting around is easy. My favorite part was the great peppermint soap...loved it!!! Liz

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in NY”
Reviews.Author: anony8mous
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews i was a bit worried about stopping here, the noise especially, but we were really lucky and got a room on the top 8th floor. im very glad we did because the noise didnt affect us as im sure it would of done if we had been on the lower floors.(the bar is very loud and echoes upwards). room was great, even liked the view. there was absolutely nothing wrong with this hotel, friendly, stylish and a great place to stop. i wont stop anywhere else from now on. only thing i would say is not to bother getting the breakfast from here, not worth it. apart from that the tribeca was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping that will gross you out”
Reviews.Author: SeattleCityGirl
Reviews.Content: I was so disappointed in the terrible housekeeping at the Tribeca Grand. The first night I arrived I found my king size bed made with queen size sheets so I found myself with my legs and feet on the mattress pad. When I went to fix it I was horrified to find a mattress pad stained with bodily fluids. Housekeeping had left by that time (midnight) so after several phone calls a security guard brought up king sized sheets and then insisted on coming into the room to see what I was talking about. I stayed for four nights and each morning I went down to the front desk and asked the manager to call me as well as when I checked out and the manager never followed up with me. I wasn't expecting anything, I just wanted to communicate that no matter what else happens at a hotel if it is dirty it is really hard to enjoy a stay. I can say that of all the hotels I have ever stayed at, and I have stayed at a lot, this was the one with the worst housekeeping I have seen, and I paid $500.+ per night!

Reviews.Title: “Great - but not as bowled over as some other reviewers”
Reviews.Author: Rachy20154
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is good if you want to be in the heart of Tribeca, Soho etc. There are no big attractions near the hotel, but a lot of shopping is within a few minutes' walk (e.g. West Broadway, Spring St, Prince St, Broadway). There is a great mix of larger stores and small boutiques. So whether the location is good depends on why you're visiting NYC... most 1st timers would probably be better somewhere further up town, but if you want to be in a hip neighbourhood that is good for wandering around and people watching, this one is great. I love some of the restaurants in that area (e.g. Balthazar on Spring Street, Public on Elizabeth St) and being able to walk back via a couple of bars is a great, easy night out. There is a subway station outside the hotel, and really you can walk anywhere - one morning I walked to all the way to Central Park and it only took an hour or so. The staff were OK. Check in, front desk and room service were excellent - helpful, polite and warm. For me the doormen were the only weak spot - in 6 days I think they saw me coming three times, otherwise I was ignored as I entered the building. The only time this really annoyed me was when I was using the pedestrian crossing outside, coming back from a long day's shopping and one of the doormen flagged a car to park on the crossing, nearly running me over. Hmmm. Clearly a man driving a sports car was more important than a girl crossing the road in flip flops.... To be fair, the doorman did look pretty sheepish when he saw me entering the hotel. But to me it shouldn't matter if I was a guest or not - it was still rude. So I could have done without their attitude - this was the low of my stay. The room was nice - not amazing, but a LOT better than the death-by-chintz that is some of the larger hotels in NYC. Inside the room, the linen was good, the TV large, the mini bar overpriced, the bathroom decent and well designed. I had no problem with noise from the bar downstairs, even at the weekend. I had a free continental breakfast included, and I have to say it was great. A basket of banana bread, croissant, Danish, muffin, scone, pain au chocolat, with juice and tea/coffee.... Filling, and a good way to fuel all that walking around. My room was well kept and the cleaning staff followed the "Busy" or "Clean" door signs so you could sleep in if you wanted. The facilities are good - the gym was OK, pretty standard (2 bikes, 2 x-trainers, 2 runners, 1 weights station), the bar was good (nice mojitos!) and I only ate once at the restaurant. The restaurant decor was a little scrappy (e.g. peeling seats, scuffed floor) but the food was good and the service well-meaning. There is a small business centre, where you can go online and print so I used this rather than lug my laptop onto the plane. Unless you need it for work, I would recommend this facility rather than bringing your own laptop and paying the high room-connection fee. All in all I enjoyed my stay and would probably go back. Other hotels I considered were The Gansevoort, The Bowery and The Mercer, but the Tribeca Grand won out on price Vs value. So glad I didn't go to The Gansevoort, as I was not wowed by the Meat Packing district when I went there (I find the whole "MePa" renaissance thing pretty half-assed). The Bowery looks great but the location is not as good as the Tribeca's and The Mercer would have been a little too pricey for 6 nights. Anyway, if you're looking for a comfortable, upscale stay somewhere in a neat location, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but my room smelled of smoke”
Reviews.Author: tdowney98
Reviews.Content: Nice but my room smelled of smoke Very hip, terribly trendy but each room has white noise knob to inhibit the bar noise! The rooms are fime not huge. Its clean well appointed and good lobby. I never did get my goldfish.......

Reviews.Title: “Truely grand”
Reviews.Author: MTL1969
Reviews.Content: Had a great time here. Nice design, friendly staff, who went out of their way to accommodate requests. The gym was way above average for a hotel gym, and the wireless internet worked flawlessly. I am a big fan of the location- plenty of stuff to do and see, spitting distance from Soho and Chinatown and right by the Subway. I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “So hip it hurts. . . but in a great way!”
Reviews.Author: Juggins
Reviews.Content: On a recent visit to our old friend NYC, we decided to 'do it up' and stay at the Tribeca Grand Hotel. Initially, my reluctance was obvious as visions of hipsters with super-tight jeans and ultra-small dogs taking dumps in Gucci bags terrorized me the whole flight over but upon our arrival I was pleasantly surprised. The front desk greets you with champagne and a hot towel, which, incidentally, is to be used on your face not to eagerly wipe your hands on and throw back. The staff was more than accomodating and very friendly. The lounge was loud during weekends but the white noise machines in the rooms took care of that, which was a relief as the thumping beats from some new-age german techno group floated up through the ceiling. The rooms were spacious and the bed was spectacular. A whale could rest soundly on the King sized. Okay, maybe not a whale but a small porpoise. I digress, I would reccomend staying at the Tribeca if you want a hip and modern atmosphere, friendly non-pretentious service, a cool location close to soho shops and restaurants and spacious rooms (that offer neat mix cds for your listening pleasure) While it's not the cheapest option, you get what you pay for in location and atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect summer weekend on a "budget"”
Reviews.Author: magnoliamountain
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tribeca Grand Hotel for a weekend using the "grandlife" package. I'm not wealthy by any means, but with all the things we got through this package we spent the weekend living rich and not spending more than $550. The (basic) hotel room is about $400 dollars per night, but with a postcard I recieved in the mail we got a free night if we booked a weekend stay. Which is amazing for this four star hotel! The room was better than anything I have every stayed in. It was perfectly decorated, quiet and comfortable. We even had our own goldfish! The staff at the hotel was extremely helpfull and very friendly. With our package we recieved a glass of champagne when we arrived. We also got an early check in at 12:00 wich was great. The subway is right next to the hotel so we took it to central park for a free summer concert (Neko Case, amazing!) which I highly recommend if you are there in the summer. They also have bicycles for you to use for free to tour the city. Ask for them early because they go quick! We toured all around tribeca and the surrounding areas. It was perfect. No tired feet! With our package we also got a free screening of a movie in their amazing movie theater. After that we went to the lounge and had two free drinks. Also with the package we got free breakfast in our room every morning, and a 2:00 check out time on sunday so we could sleep in. There were other free things we recieved like a music compilation (which was amazing) and a bath and body kit. Don't forget to be a "grand guest". You will find it on there website. Just join for free and you can pick special extra things like bottled water and cookies to be delivered to your room! All around it was a perfect weekend and I don't have one bad thing to say about this hotel. It wasn't just a place to stay, it was our (free) entertainment for the weekend. I highly recommend this to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Good Location, snotty staff”
Reviews.Author: LearningCurv
Reviews.Content: The Tribeca Grand was, at that time, hard to find due to small signage. Tribeca itself is just a great place to kick around - you have the Knitting Factory for music, Soho for shopping, it's not too far to walk to St. Marks place, and at that time you could still walk for a poignant and revelatory visit to the pit at ground zero. The hotel itself is clean and the beds comfortable. It's more stylish than many, but not a stand-out. Not being one to stay at hotels very often, I had some difficulties during check-in and was to some degree belittled by the staff for my unfamiliarity with their hotel check-in process. There are a mix of places to eat - some earthy and casual, some hi-brow and hyped and still others your typical city joints where the food is acceptable and little else. During check-in we were given the opportunity to stay at the sister hotel the Soho grand, we should have taken it. Enough said.

Reviews.Title: “great room and location”
Reviews.Author: weersing
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for 2 reasons. The location and the good reviews. The room was the most clean we' ve ever seen.We had the 405, that's a corner room and more quiet than other rooms. They have music in the lobby downstairs but it didn't bother at all. The hotel has bikes, but almost nobody uses them. We tried on Sunday and we had a great time. We went untill Central Park. That was pretty far, because you have to go back too. But it was worth it. You ask the concierge, because it is really worth it. The location is better as we thought. There are some nice restaurants in the neighbourhood. Try the Flor de Sol in Hudson street. We had a better rate because it was weekend, but on Monday the rate was about $110 higher. This is the only negative thing. The rate for weekdays is too high. Anyway we should defenitely go back if we find the same offer we found with the very nice breakfast in the room included. Very nice staff too.

Reviews.Title: “Tribeca Grand Impeccable”
Reviews.Author: Broadcastgal
Reviews.Content: From start to check out, the Tribeca Grand really shined when it came to customer service. They helped us check in early after a particularly rough flight, helped us stay late when our flight was delayed, and provided excellent recommendations and accomodations in between.

Reviews.Title: “Tribeca Grand- excellent service, fantastic atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: JACAtlanta
Reviews.Content: The staff here provides impeccable service without a hint of the pretentiousness that usually comes with this level of service. The rooms are comfortable and a pretty good size for a Manhattan hotel. The linens and bed aren’t Four Season’s quality but neither are the prices (the service is!). The rooms are loaded with fun little details like Malin+Goetz toiletries and a stereo system complete with a collection of cd’s to use. The décor is wonderful and the lounge area is great. I don’t usually spend much time in my hotel but I did have dinner at the Tribeca Grand one night and I am glad I did. The food is fabulous and the cocktails are great. They even have a mini-theater next to the workout room. If this is your very first visit to Manhattan you probably want to stay near Times Square or overlooking Central Park. If this is not your first time, I highly recommend the Tribeca Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Tribeca Grand a Great Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: SSevi
Reviews.Content: A great overall hotel, with extra perks that made my stay memorable. Clearly customer satisfaction is on the top of their list. All my requests were immediately handled. The room was impecably put together...the bed very comfy, the real goldfish in fish bowl gave it a non-hotel feel, and the daily coffee and breads were delectable. Most definitely will consider this hotel for another NYC stay.

Reviews.Title: “A unique place to stay in the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: louise47
Reviews.Content: What a cool hotel! The decor and layout is fabulous. Very modern tech ambiance. We stayed there for weekend while attending a wedding and were very impressed. The rooms offer all the modern conveniences for business travelers and the staff goes out of their way to make families feel welcome. The Sunday brunch is not to be missed. The variety of dishes is extraordinary and all are delicious. I would reccommend this hotel to anyone and look forward to another visit. The only suggestion I have is that they need to sign the place a little better. The sign is on the face of an antique clock in the front and was easily missed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: FWhite
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from a 5 day stay at the Tribeca and found it to be a great place. I deliberately hunted out somewhere that was an alternative to the chintz filled suites that are in abundence in NY but not find myself in a shoebox in a hip hotel. The grand king room I had at the Tribeca was neither. The room was a nice size and was well presented and clean. The only thing I wasn't too impressed with was the breakfast which I only had the once. Otherwise, the bar area is a good place to hang out but check out the Tribeca Tavern across the street for a more pub style location. The location is perfect for exploring Soho, Little Italy etc on foot and there is a subway literally outside the hotel which will have you in midtown in minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Grand”
Reviews.Author: ValCt
Reviews.Content: As usual my stay at the Tribeca Grand was exceptional. A gracious and impecably adorned hotel with the feel of a intimate gathering of friends. Highly recommended for business stays and for a romantic interlude.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, kid-friendly”
Reviews.Author: nokib
Reviews.Content: We used to live in the neighborhood, and shopped at the flower market that used to be here before the hotel was built. We've always admired the Tribeca Grand from afar, but now that we've moved away from NYC, we've had a chance to stay in it. It went a long way to making NYC a far more pleasant and agreeable experience than when we lived there! Plusses: Beautiful hotel. Sound masking system can be adjusted so that no external noise is heard. They supplied a pet goldfish, which our son *adored*. The room was small, but perfectly adequate for the three of us. Staff was kind and attentive. Room was serene & clean. Bose speakers for your ipod. Negatives: It is a little hard to navigate the website for reservation purposes. For example, on the web, it kept saying that none of their rooms allowed children & that we had to book a second room (for our 20 month son!). Knowing that it didn't seem rational, I called and was able to make a single room reservation without any trouble. It was just annoying to have had to waste the time on the computer trying to figure it out.

Reviews.Title: “As always a fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Sapphira2007
Reviews.Content: This is the third time i've stayed at the Tribeca Grand and the only reason i keep returning is because i know i can relax and am guaranteed flawless service. NY is famous for its hotels - i've sampled quite a few of them, many in a higher price range. This one tops them all every time in terms of ease and convenience. Its not the most beautiful, but you're sure to be met by polite, friendly staff who have your preferences recorded from previous stays. Check in is as easy as presenting your credit card, and from that point on nobody bothers you unless you request something, in which case it will be dealt with promptly and professionally with no mistakes. This particular trip i spent the first half of the week at the St Regis because it had been booked for me by family who were also staying there. Once my family left the city i couldn't WAIT to check out and head back to Tribeca. The contrast was noteable - the one had uppity staff who made a long trail of errors (how is that even possible in 3 days?), and checking into the Tribeca Grand was a breath of fresh air. Cannot recommend it highly enough. And who expected such good service from somewhere so cool?! Try it - you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: CatherineB
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a Grand room which was lovely - fabulous view, enormous comfy bed, great decor and bathroom. We found the white noise system worked very well for us but we were on the top floor so maybe this helped! The staff were helpful and friendly and even managed to get us a cab when the streets were gridlocked on a Saturday afternoon. The vibe is very trendy and the hotel does pride itself on this so there was a long queue for the nightclub which went past the bar and into the lobby on the Friday night. Go for the atmosphere and be part of it!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and friendly”
Reviews.Author: aliaslili
Reviews.Content: We booked the Tryst in Tribeca package (including breakfast in room and other fun gifts like early check-in and late check-out) We were upgraded to an executive room which was huge, lovely decorated and what a view!!! Huge windows, almost a window wall, great bed and linens, nice bathroom The only negative point as mentionned in other reviews, is the noise/music coming form the atrium in the evening Even with the sound reducing system it can be a litlle annoying, furthermore why putting the music so loud if you have only 4 guests in the atrium?? For the rest everything was perfect, super location if you want to travel with the metro (5 lines passing by) and friendly staff (a little bit less in the bar) Would surely come back

Reviews.Title: “Tribeca Grand? Never again”
Reviews.Author: JerseyBeacher
Reviews.Content: The only positives to this hotel were the champagne upon arrival and the soft towels. Other than that, it was a bad experience. We had a "recently refurbished and renovated room" which ironically was the cheapest rate (at $324). Now we think we know why-- it had an awful musty/mildewy smell, mostly in the bathroom but also detected it from the vent system at night. Called front desk to ask for another room but were told none were available except for smoking rooms. We believe the room must have been recently refurbished due to some kind of water damage but the stench is still there. We were on the 2nd floor directly over the nightclub, which was very loud even with the white noise machines they have built into the rooms. Then every so often, the room trembled along with a loud rumble. When I looked out the window down to the street one level below, I noticed the sidewalk was all subway grates instead. So every time the subway went by underground, we felt it and heard it - all thru the night. And a couple of little details -- like they only left one chocolate on the pillow. were we supposed to split it in 2? Also the valet who parked our car in the garage 5 blocks away thought it was okay to change the station on our Sirius radio - he couldn't leave the station alone for a 5 block ride? We live across the river and come into NYC overnight several times a year and like to try new hotels. This is one we would definitely not stay in again, nor recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Stay!”
Reviews.Author: gascoigne63
Reviews.Content: You get all the benefits of a hip NYC hotel, without the accompanying attitude. Attention to detail, smiles, answers to questions and a good sense of what's going on in town. Great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Almost there, but not quite.”
Reviews.Author: allisonivy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted a night away from the kids so we booked a room in the Tribeca Grand. At first, it was great. We liked the small size of the hotel, great location etc. They even have these great white noise systems that you can use to cancel out the noise of the city (or so we thought). At about 11:45 pm, our white noise system broke and the music from the bar was outragously loud. We called reception and they sent a technician up to our room and by about 12:30am it was clear that the machine was broken. We then moved rooms and all was well. But the television wasn't working in our new room. The hotel markets their bar as a scene and place to go on the weekends, so it is clear that their priority is to making the bar crowd happy. The design of the hotel is an atrium, so all the noise just travels right up into the rooms! There are so many great places to stay in NYC that I would not recommend the Tribeca Grand. We definitely won't stay there again. For the money, it just should have been smoother.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: stoneleighpark
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of a package the hotel was offering which included champagne upon arrival, breakfast in bed, complementary drinks at the bars, etc. From check-in to check-out the experience was great. The staff was cordial and helpful. In fact, the concierge made us last minute dinner reservations at what turned out to be one of the best restaurants we've ever been to. We plan to return to the hotel every year.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: MinkieLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend in January and loved it. At arrival we were handed some champagne and our package also included candle in room, chocolate covered strawberries and complementary cocktails. Room wasn't big, but well appointed with big flatscreen, cd player with cool selection of cds, pet goldfish, etc. Complimentary concierge service was brilliant. They managed to get us into a great restaurant on the Friday of restaurant week as the restaurant we booked from London lost our reservation. Even on a Saturday night at 6pm they managed to get us a 8pm table at STK. Very impressed. Not a usual tourist location and be prepared to pay for regular cab rides if you want to go around Manhattan, but the hotel makes up for it. Great bar scene as well, the noise wasn't a problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: swankgirl
Reviews.Content: Loved the Tribeca Grand! Had been to the bar located there many times (Church) and decided to stay there this last trip to NY. It is my new favorite place! When we checked in we were greeted with a pampering hot towel and a refreshingly festive, much needed (after our long flight) glass of champagne. The rooms were not only comfortable but we noticed all the extras that made our stay absolutely wonderful! There is background noise installed in every room to drown out the sometimes very loud noises that go along with hotel stays and guests nearby. We slept like babies! Brunch was delicious and the late night scene was so fabulous we left our friends at a nearby haute to go back to the hotel club and have cocktails and a late night snack. I highly recommend the Tribeca Grand!!

Reviews.Title: “LOUD!!! Atrium style hotel with a popular bar in the lobby.”
Reviews.Author: Tomot
Reviews.Content: I am giving a neutral rating to this hotel because I am sure it is what some people are looking for, but it definitely was not for me. Due to a delayed flight, we did not arrive to the hotel until about 1:30 on a Friday night ---- we were surprised to see that their was a very loud and popular bar in the lobby ---- that would possibly have not been a problem in most hotels, but this is an atrium style building and even though our room was on one of the upper floors, we could clearly hear the beat of the bar's music. The rooms have a silencing machine which creates white noise (i.e., static sound) which is supposed to cover up the noise; the noise of the static bothered me too. Luckily we had packed earplugs (we always do, just in case we encounter something like this)- and, since we were so tired, we fell asleep quickly. To the hotel's credit, the next morning the front desk was extremely understanding when we said we could not stay their another night becuase of the noise. They also held our bags and assisted us in finding another hotel. Although they did not push us on their sister hotel, the Soho Grand, they suggested it and we ended up staying there. I will post on that hotel soon. In summary - It was LOUD! VERY LOUD! VERY, VERY LOUD!!!! But in a good location with nice rooms and friendly professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly, But Not Quite...”
Reviews.Author: PaulM100
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in a number of 4-5 star hotels in the past and unfortunately the Tribeca Grand failed to live upto its billing. On the whole the hotel is very nicely appointed. Our room was nicely decorated, the lounge also was good. Our main problem was with the staff of the hotel who it seemed were interupted from their posing by guests! Our presence there seemed to be a hinderence to the front desk personnel whenever you asked a question. We arrived weighed down with luggage and the doorman stood by and watched us struggle through the front doors without offering to help. As we checked in the receptionist seemed very aloof to us as well. We had heard that visitors to the hotel received a complimentary drink upon arrival. This wasn't offered to us. We ordered room service meals for our first night in the hotel and the standard of cooking was disappointing. Far below the levels I expect of a hotel with 4 stars. It wasn't bad as such, just lacking a level of care and attention to flavour. We ventured in the bar later during our stay to be stopped by one of the staff asking if we required seating. We said yes and he then had to go find the 'hostess' who then took us to our seats approx. 3 steps away from where he stopped us!!! The hotel seems to suffer from a lack of confidence from its staff. People don't seem to know what they're doing. There also seems to be too many staff more interested in preening themselves rather than attending to the needs of guests. Its a shame that there isn't a firmer hand in control of this hotel. It has great facilities, but needs to decide whether it is run for the benefit of customers rather than staff.

Reviews.Title: “Newly Renovated Rooms Make for Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: SophieP-TRIP
Reviews.Content: I checked into the hotel and was show to a small, somewhat depressing room. When asked if they had something a bit bigger we ended up with a newly renovated deluxe king room (a complimentary upgrade). The room has nice duvet, Frette bathrobe and large fluffy towels; wireless internet, bigscreen TV and modern, sort of masculine color scheme. We like the room and the service has been very good. I would consider everything excellent for a 4 star hotel -- and it compares favorably to other 4 stars in NYC. Obviously not quite as good as the 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Lulubella
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, fantastic food and very helpful staff. Lovely extras too - goldfish in room, top rate music equipment provided, complimentary paper each morning, chocolate on the pillow each night, yummy bathroom products. Also great location, about six blocks to West Broadway /Spring Street shopping district and Tribeca Theare / bars, cafes etc.... Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Baram
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights for a business trip and it was the worst hotel experience ever. The bathtub drainage was badly clogged when I first attempted to take a shower. I called the desk and expected some kind of apology and room switch, but they just simply said "oh yeah we'll call an engineer." Then the maid tried to enter my room without even knocking. Ironically, the windows to the street are soundproof and there is minimal noise from the street; you can only hear occaisonal honks. The noise from within the hotel, however, is unberable at nights. Especially on weekends, this hotel turns into a club or something and loud music and noise go on well past 1 am. Their service at the restaruant was also very horrible. On sunday brunch I had to wait 5 minutes before even being seated and on one breakfast they didn't bring out something I ordered and then it appeared on the check. How great. Overall, this hotel's only forte is its downtown location and some level of security but at this price ($600+ per night) you can find better hotels elsewhere (Sofitel being my favorite for their excellent and amiable service).

Reviews.Title: “expensive, but pretty good value overall”
Reviews.Author: MajorVoid
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to subway lines and a short walk from all downtown amenities, SoHo, Wall Street, Chinatown, Lower East Side, Little Italy etc. Laid back but efficient, friendly, helpful and accommodating staff. Bed extremely comfortable - rooms are not huge but this is NYC!! Fantastic opulent Sunday brunch which is a bargain at $29.00. I liked the design, liked the vibe; a preponderance of young-ish fashionista/media types and a sprinkling of weekending suburbanites. Gets pretty hectic on Saturday night in the bar - didn't always want to hang out there but no problem to find plenty of other decent places in the neighbourhood. A good place from which to do your own thing. Loads of great touches - CDs and the BOSE wave player in the room, free bike hire, unexpected and welcome glass of champagne on arrival. Watch prices for room service and minibar - some of them are silly ($10 for a small tin of nuts?) but - will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tribeca trial and Error”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Battersea
Reviews.Content: Booking new hotels when your favourites are full is always a game of trial and error...the Tribeca gets good marks for it's location, interior design, restaurant and door service...BUT the star attraction of a hotel should always be the rooms..and, they were a disappointment. First the good points... location. Close to Soho, lower manhattan and great restaurants. the door staff are the stars of the show here...knowledgeable, friendly, good looking and willing to help (and not just because they are tip monkeys! which, in the US is unusual). The breakfast menu is great, service friendly and food was delicious! The interiors... post-industrial chic - emphasis on chic, exposed iron and metal/wood (very brown...could use some better lighting in the hall/corridors) but stunning atrium. Now for the let down...the room. Small, this includes the bathroom which is very metallic and industrial in appearance.. lighting is poor, and the faux Paul Smith toiletries are a bonus. Towels are small, and a bit rough cotton. The room, bed is comfortable and the noise reduction filter (necessary on a friday night when the atrium bar noise reaches trendy-party crescendo!) worked...thankfully! But, overall...feels like a 70's beige office turned into hotel experiment. It was expensive for what it was... the most impressive thing is the return guest programme of getting a goldfish bowl w/ live goldfish in your room or a choice of pillows. But, you have to return to get that I suppose. Staff are friendly and efficient...but the business centre is a joke...a cramped former utilities closet tucked behind the concierge. They charge $15 a day to use this internet closet and you have to keep walking back and forth from the front desk to the 'centre' to get/return the key...why not have the concierge control the business closet..the desk is right next to the door!?!? I am not a spoiled business traveller, and do not need to stay in the 'hippest' hotel..but, at the end of the day...the bedroom is the most important part and the Tribeca Grand is really just average. If you want to entertain or impress guests, it is an excellent choice because of the lobby/atrium bar. However, I would opt for the Soho House or Gansevoort if you want the perfect combination of both form and function that impresses. Even the sister hotel the Soho Grand rates better...so, the Tribeca is a decent fall-back hotel that makes a change from the chains.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheWeary
Reviews.Content: Had a wondeful stay and the staff was very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Would definetly stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ShayJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for over a week recently during a work / personal trip and i was a little hesitant given some of the reviews about noise etc but decided to stick with the reservation. I had a great stay, from the moment i arrived I found the staff very attentive and pleasant. I ordered room service one night and they were great, they called to tell my flavour of ice cream wasn't available, which i thought was hilarious. i found the room a great size, i have stayed in shoe boxes in new york and although you don't spend much time in the room, when it's your home for over a week you want to feel like you have a bit of space, and i did. i didn't find the room noisy, in fact i was amazed at how loud the lobby seemed till i walked through my door and it just disappared once behind closed doors. The bar was nice, i only had drinks there one night and breakfast one morning, but it was very good. The only hitch came on check-out when i was checking the bill and there was a large bar bill charged to my room which was not mine, they dealt with it very efficently, it was a genuine mistake and very quickly i had a new bill. I would stay here again, the location was great for shopping, bars - short taxi ride to the meat packing district, more great bars and eating out, and quiet enough that it wasn't noisy outside the hotel. I didnt touch the mini bar - it was silly prices, there was a nearby store where i stocked up on water and snacks for the week. I would also make sure you know the address of the hotel, taxi drivers dropped a friend of mine at the Soho Grand instead and whilst its a short walk, i did find with most drivers it's good to know the address - 6th Ave and Church St ought to do it...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience at the Tribeca Grand”
Reviews.Author: jjjbbb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business trip. I thought the location was great because it is close to both the 1 and the A/C/E subway lines (and was convenient to my downtown office). The bed was super comfortable and the room was surprisingly quiet (I was on the 7th floor). The only thing I didn't like was the bathroom. Although it was fully functional, in trying to be trendy it had a cold feel. The room was a fine size, and I was quite happy with the breakfast menu in the lobby restaurant - they were happy to accommodate special requests (changing sides, types of toast, etc.). The staff was also friendly towards a colleague's young child who visited one morning. One negative - and this is true for any hotel that charges for internet access - is the charge for access. I think that this should be part of the included amenities - or at least there should be reduced rates for people staying for more than a day or two.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed staying at the Tribeca Grand”
Reviews.Author: MRW1
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Tribeca and LOVED every second of it. When we arrived after a 3 hour drive we were given a glass of champagne along with hand towels to freshen up. Then we were nicely surprised in our room. Lovely room with rose on the bed, strawberries with chocolate and a great view of a rooftop garden across the street. It was a convenient place to stay for shopping and dining. Also the next day went to the Tenament Museum on Orchard Street - I would highly recommend this tour if your ancestors imagrated into this country. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a comfortable easy place to stay in an area that is interesting and has lots to do.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: Luv4Ricardo
Reviews.Content: I loved the look of the hotel from the moment I walked into the lobby. The bellhops were so friendly, and the front desk staff was extremely helpful. Prior to my stay, I had read reviews that mentioned a lot of noise- so that is what I expected. However, I didn't hear any noise while I was in my room. Perhaps because I was always enjoying the cds and the great stereo. My companion also loved the hotel, and hopes to stay there again during his next visit to NY. The only tiny issue we had was that we received an unrequested wake up call during the first two days of our stay. Once we notified the front desk, that issue was automatically resolved. The area around the hotel has great restaurants, and a cool little bar in walking distance. The subway was close by, and the concierge helped up find any place we wanted to go. I loved this hotel and I would recommend it to anyone who could afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jakepop
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent the past Saturday night at this hotel and had a great time. We had the weekend package which included breakfast in bed, NY Times and 2 cocktails. We were upgraded to a high floor and room and it was much appreciated. The room is large by NYC standards but standard for any hotel outside of NYC. The view was ok but then again the top floor is on the 8th floor and views in NYC at this height are not great. The bed was very comfortable and the plasma TV was nice. Bathroom was interesting with all stainless steel. The hotel staff was excellent. Very helpful. The bar was trendy and the 2 cocktails were excellent and considering the value of $13 each, the free token was great. The hotel is in a quiet area of lower NYC but is actually in an excellent location to walk or take the subway. Canal St. and all of its shopping is only 3 short blocks away and the great shopping and restaurants of SoHo is only 5 or 6 blocks away. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Tryst in Tribeca”
Reviews.Author: donnamg
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tribeca grand last week and we loved everything about it. The staff couldn't do enough for us, they were wonderful. The Tryst in Tribecca special was fantastic with an early check in and a late check out. The champagne was a nice touch as was the roses, candle ,a goldfish and 2 free drinks at the bar and breakfast in bed included. The room was a nice size (we were expecting smaller) and it was perfect. It was very modern and updated and very clean. Our one night at the Trbeca Grand was the highlight of our week in New York.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in downtown NY. One of our favorite hotels in the US”
Reviews.Author: Spamalot
Reviews.Content: We spent a Saturday night (again) at the Tribeca Grand hotel in NYC. It was a wonderful experience from check-in to check-out. Every employee is kind, courtous and helpful. The rooms are spotless with amenities like flat screen television and CDs. We look forward to our next visit which I hope is very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Haven in Hectic NYC!”
Reviews.Author: BusyGal
Reviews.Content: Our original hotel in NYC was in Midtown Manhattan and while close to touristy things, our service was so-so and very impersonal. However, after switching to the Tribeca Grand, we had a lovely experience. It is close to great shopping and accessible to the subway, etc. Overall, in our room, we felt as though we were in someone's (well-decorated) home -- the carpet was soft and clean, linens were nice, plasma tv made my husband very happy and room service was great! However, the attribute that made the stay for us was the service. It was exceptional. The staff made our lives much easier and our stay highly enjoyable. We are already planning our next visit, which will include this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, tired, tatty”
Reviews.Author: pargle
Reviews.Content: Very expensive. Was probably once the height of cool design. Now in desparate need of refurbishment. Service was good but room was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lumpo
