Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before but tried somewhere else on advice - the alternative was dreadful and we shifted to Tribeca after one night. Compared to others it is good/great value, the room was of good size, the fittings were great (big plasma TV etc), a bathroom you can actually use(!), very, very helpful staff (not at all showing any NY indifference to travellers). When we got to our room, we both breathed a sigh of relief "thank goodness". You'll need to go outside for food but there is so much to choose from in Soho and nearby. The subway is 50m away so getting anywhere is quick. We have stayed here four times between us and compared even to the flash hotels (where we get put up when travelling on biz), we will keep coming back. REcommended +++.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Tribeca Grand!”
Reviews.Author: airbetty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Tribeca Grand for three nights the first week of June although we didn't want to pay $511 per night everything we like to do is in that area so we splurged! It was worth it! We were right around the corner from Canal Street where we love to shop for bags and watches and just have fun. We were one block away from the subway that could get us anywhere we wanted to go and near all kinds of fun little restuarants including the Landmarc where we ate and Tribeca Bar where we hung out. My husband hung out at Busters garage to watch the Carolina Hurricanes play and I felt completely safe to walk home by myself! We even stumbled into the Bubble Lounge one night which was cool! The hotel staff were friendly and very accomodating. They gave us an umbrella the day it was raining and the concierege satff were very helpful in finding us places to eat. Although there were comments about the rooms being loud from the bar, I didn't find that to be the case at all, the noise system drowned out everything except my husband's snoring! WE will definitely go back and are telling all our friends about it! When you go back you also get gold fish, fruit cheese etc.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in NYC”
Reviews.Author: raymonk
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed in a two bedroom suite at the Tribeca Grand from June 11 - 14. We arrived early, but the excellent staff at the front desk checked us in right away and we were given rooms on the 6th floor. What great rooms they were! Extremely comfortable, spotlessly clean, and huge windows through which to view all the activity of a Manhatten neighborhood. Although we were late sleepers, (the beds were too comfy to get up early!), we were never bothered by housekeeping knocking on the door, and our rooms were always made up when we returned to the hotel. All staff members we dealt with were very nice, and a few went out of their way to be helpful, even retrieving my cellphone that I had left in a cab, and brining it right up to my room. The room service was excellent, the food arrived quickly, and the steak frites and chocolate cake are to die for. The hotel just kind of wraps you up in this very subtle, luxurious comfort, which of course makes one eager to go back and experience it all over again. Worth every cent and I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: Cumbria72
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tribeca Grand Hotel from the 22nd May til 30th May 2006. Firstly what a fantastic hotel & what a great location this was in. The Hotel itself blends into the surrounding area, no big hotel sign there's just a clock that stands outside the hotel with the name on it - so you would'nt think that there was an hotel here. The hotel staff were brilliant very helpful & friendly, we could'nt have asked for more. The concierge's that worked in the hotel were very good & recommended some great eating places for us, (if you love steak then go to a place called 'The Strip House' it's pricey but it was the best steaked we'd ever had). The hotel room was very simple nothing flashy nice and clean. There was an ambudance of alcohol in the mini bar and nibbles - a choice of cd's to listen to. We had paid extra on booking a room with a view - but in hindsight we need not have bothered as the hotel is in Tribeca and as the receptionist said theres not really much of a view here. After reading much of the reviews about this hotel on this site, we took the advice of a few and went to 'Bubbys' each morning for our breakfast - & what a good choice it was this set us up for the day ahead - Try the sour cream pancakes they were fantastic. On getting around New York we bought a weeks subway pass at around $24 each which was great as we used the subway alot whilst we were there. The hotel is surrounded by some good restaurants there is also a pharmacy over the road & a great little bar called the Tribeca Tavern. This was our second time in New York & we plan to go back soon, the weather was great in the high 80's & it was Memorial weekend when we were there. So the next time we go back we will be staying at the Tribeca Grand without a doubt. This hotel & staying in the Tribeca area met all our needs - if you want to stay somewhere thats not a tourist trap or has the noise levels of Time Square then this hotel & the surrounding area is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Time..Great Locale”
Reviews.Author: NYJulie
Reviews.Content: Great Location if you dont want the tourist insanity of Times Square. Great quiet neighborhood. Easy access to the subway that takes you to all things touristy. And, walk to great SoHo shopping. Staff super super nice, very helpful... white noise machine dulls sound from bar, altho the one in our room was broken. Only negative was no Yes Network so we couldnt watch the Yankee game in our room... Also, a bit put off by email suggestion from Manager that we share our good experience on websites like this one...was going to do it anyway. Again tho... great great place to enjoy NYC without the tourist hell.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great week-end at the Tribeca Grand”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I didn't know what to expect, but from the moment we walked in everyone we encountered (especially at the front desk) was pleasant and helpful. The room was small but very well done....wide screen TV, Bose music player and great pillows. I definitely will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, fair location”
Reviews.Author: rachyj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tribeca Grand over Easter Weekend. The concierge was very helpful in making our reservations before we arrived. THe front desk and bell staff was friendly upon check-in as well. We had requested a non-smoking room, and we had one on one of the newly refurbished floors, but it really had a strong smoke odor. They were very nice and helpful about moving us. We got our stuff together, and when we got back from our day, they had us all set up in the new room. No hassle at all for us. I thought the hotel was good for New York, but wasn't thrilled with the location. It was a close walk to Soho, but we really felt that except for the day we walked into Soho and piddled around, we had to get a cab to get to and from most of our destinations. I think if you know you are going to be doing stuff in Tribeca, it could be great, if you are going to be more in Soho or other areas, just stay there. We did not eat at the hotel, so I don't know about food, but we had drinks in the bar a few times, and the service was very irregular.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: itrapnell
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tribeca Grand in Feb 2006, and was disappointed. The building itself is very impressive - all the rooms surround an Atrium overlooking a very trendy bar area, and it really does look great (apart from the fact that they closed it for the whole of Saturday night to all hotel guests as they had a private party). The rooms are pretty cool and spacious (especially the bathroom) - Bose stereos in all rooms etc. My main disappointment was regarding most of the staff, who are (in my experience) surly, unattentive and more concerned about looking good (which most of them did!) than providing good service. We asked for a broken light bulb to be changed in our room three times over the weekend, and it was never done. When we arrived, there were half used bottles of shampoo etc in the bathroom. Nothing terrible, just not what I would have expected for an expensive hotel like this. Tribeca is OK, but personally I'd stay in Soho or somewhere rather than Tribeca.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: GTX
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a very convenient location. it's right in the heart of soho/tribeca/greenwich area. 5-10 mins walk to west broadway/broadway and the metro is just round the corner. you really get a feel of new york.... all the hotel staff were warm and friendly but not in your face. the concierge was very helpful with "local" tips as opposed to selling tourist packages. She recommended two lovely little cafes to have breakfast - Bubbys and Cuppin it. The hotel has a good vibe with subtle lighting. We hadn't been to NY before and were warned that all hotel rooms are small, but the rooms at Tribeca Grand were perfect. Just right for a city break. The hotel bar, Church Lounge was always buzzing but not imposing or noisy. Great place to have a drink before going out. There was a film premiere when we were there and it looked like the staff were used to it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter wanted to sample SOHO, Chelsea, and the Village all in two days. Relunctantly, I booked this hotel without any knowledge of what I might be getting myself into. Well. Perfect location for all three areas. We had a swell time. The hotel staff and conceirge were top notch. I would not hestitate to stay there again if my destination were somewhat the same.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner & I loved the Tribeca Grand. Staff were wonderful, room was great with lots of added extras like your own safe in the room and a full sized iron and ironing board and your own 'white noise' control. In the 4 nights that we stayed there we were not bothered by either street sounds or noise from the bar - can't work out whether this was because of the 'white noise' thingy or just the huge amounts of shopping / walking we did. Room was a good size and bed a great size! - Bath was a little on the small size though but that's my only moan.. You can walk really easily to Soho, China Town & Little Italy and if walking's not your thing there's a Subway within about 200metres. Would recommend without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Time in Tribeca”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked the Tryst in Tribeca package when we stayed at the Tribeca Grand the last weekend of February of '06. We were effusively greeted by the hotel staff, shown to a room on the hotel's top floor by a very gracious bellman, and even given a quick tour of several rooms on that floor which had undergone a renovation (soon to come to the entire hotel). The new rooms look lovely, but our room was fine, even in its "old age" (which didn't seem very old at all).... the package elements, geared towards romance, were all excellent - from the champagne upon arrival to the chocolate covered strawberries, room service breakfasts, to drinks at their in house bar - and enhanced our experience. We were close to Tribeca and Soho shopping as well as the many great restaurants those neighborhoods have to offer. All in all, a perfect experience and one we are looking forward to having again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfully romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel to celebrate his birthday. I purchased the Tryst in Tribeca package, which gives you an ealry check-in, late check-out, a rose on the bed, champagne toast, drink coupons for the very trendy lounge in the lobby, coupons for in room breakfast (which was delicious!), chocolate covered strawberries and some other nice romantic things. It was very nice. The room had a Bose Wave Radio which was great and the selection of movies were very up to date. The room I thought could use some redecorating, it was a little stale. But everything was very clean. The toiletries were very nice and plentiful. This was the Hotel from the movie 2 Weeks Notice with High Grant. It was very nice and we can't wait for another reason to celebrate something else there. You are also in the middle of trendy Tribeca which is also a hop from Soho and the great boutique shops. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at the Tribeca Grand”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to say I am spoiled by having stayed in some amazing hotels and this was a great experience! Manhattan is HUGE... and although I had some desire to stay in a known name hotel b/c I would know the quality... this was recommended to me. I loved it! It was in a great location... walking distance to Canal, and Ground Zero... just a short cab ride to the Theatre District. Great Service, comfortable bed, Funky yet very inviting interior.... a very pleasant experience! It was a Hot spot at the bar and the hotel was not overwelmingly huge! It was JUST right! I hope to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “See pictures - not the least expensive room”
Reviews.Author: erinys
Reviews.Content: I made an error in my photo description and must correct it. I described it as their least expensive room, which is what we paid for, but perhaps due to snow cancellations they upgraded us despite our incredibly low rate. I don't want anyone to be disappointed. The hotel has the best staff I have ever experienced. They would do anything. One couple asked the concierge if they could borrow snow boots - unfortunately they could not accomodate that request, but it reflects the level of service patrons come to expect, and the concierge apologized that she could not help. Our car was delivered 20 minutes late, but due to the low price I wasn't goinig to ask for any adjustments - I didn't have to, the wonderful gentleman at the desk offered it as a courtesy. At times it was slow, so the sweet bellboy had a gentle snowball fight with a child. It was a lovely experience. The room was perfectly clean although not absolutely exquisite - it was a standard NYC-size room, the carpet was a little older, the room was a little dim (I could have requested stronger lightbulbs). It's really a 4.5. The in-room fax, internet access, and Aeron chair were wonderful. For those worried about noise, each floor has 2 rooms hidden behind (not beside) the elevators which would block noise. We didn't hear a peep, even with the white noise turned off. The hotel is a peaceful respite from the loud crowds uptown while providing easy access to 2 subway lines. We'll be back, even at a higher rate.

Reviews.Title: “The memorable Tribeca Grand”
Reviews.Author: 0Donald0
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Tribeca Grand. The service was flawless from the moment we arrived until departure. The room was meticulous. The hotels location is within easy reach of some great restaurants and should you decide to travel uptown the subway is literally at the doorstep. The hotel staff were constantly smiling and would go out of their way to please you. I would not hesitate to stay at the Tribeca Grand again, which we both plan on doing in the future. Treat yourself and stay at this marvelous hotel. Donald and Elizabeth Ichton

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Tribeca Grand”
Reviews.Author: TravelWell
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tribeca Grand for two nights for their New Year's Eve party. We had a Grand King room on the top floor (8th). Room was good size for NYC. Bose stero and CD's were a nice touch. The noise from the atrium mentioned by other posters did not bother us at all. We walked through the SoHo Grand as well, I did not care for their lobby/bar area. The New Year's party was a blast. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from spending New Years weekend in NYC at the Tribeca Grand Hotel They offer different packages on their website so we purchased the 1st Class package. It was $399.00 for the first night and the 2nd night was discounted at $221, which for New Years weekend I thought was a steal. After we checked in, they offered us a glass of champaign with ginger syrup and a twist. The bellman took our bag and we headed through to the atrium, which was incredible. It's very modern and trendy with a home-y feel. A glass elevator that overlooks the atrium, took us up to our room. The room is a nice size and decorated modern and simple. It has internet access and a work station right in the room which included a fax machine. There is also a 24 hour business center with computers on the main level. We received a complimentary plate of fruits and chocolates the first night there which was a nice touch. We ordered a pizza from room service one evening and it was at our room with in 25 minutes. The menu wasn't over priced as far as room service goes. Sunday morning they have a brunch set up in the atrium and it was out of this world!! It was $25.00 a person plus drinks so our total bill for brunch for the 2 of us was $77.00. The hotel accomodates pets. They have a vet and pet services available. They even have a pet menu to order from which we thought was neat. The staff was extremely helpful. Anything we wanted, they could make happen with ease. It is 1 block from the A,C,E trains so travel is convenient. 2 blocks from canal street shopping and a short walk to Little Italy. I'm not one to get star struck, but my husband and I were waiting for some friends in the lobby and Paul Sorvino(actor)came in with his daughter to get a room. It was kinda cool that he was staying at the same hotel. ;o) I lived in NYC for 7yrs and since I've moved to Chicago, I have stayed at quite a few hotels around the city when I come to visit. The Tribeca Grand by far is my favorite. It is very plush yet very affordable and it's easy to get around the city. Great neighborhood, Great food, Great Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Slightly Above Average”
Reviews.Author: Dr. Ralph
Reviews.Content: Believe it or not, $1700 (tax included) is not bad for 4 nights in a quality hotel in lower Manhattan during the Xmas high season. My biggest beef was the small size of the room and the low water pressure in the shower. Friday and Saturday nights can get quite noisy because of the popular lobby bar and the building's central atrium design. The staff was fairly friendly and helpful. Room service was certainly nothing stellar. Overall it was an adequate stay but I think we'll try someplace different next time.

Reviews.Title: “A cut above”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just spent a wonderful weekend with my girlfriend at the Tribeca Grand. The service was second to none and the hotel has that real "wow" factor from the moment you see the centrepiece hotel bar - the Church Lounge - which just exudes cool. Light sleepers may be advised to take some ear plugs if they anticipate being distracted by the soft murmur of the bar patrons which can be heard from the hotel room, but for those looking for a taste of heaven, just try one of the cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It never ceases to amaze me how little one gets in NY for USD$400 per night. I was disappointed with the Tribeca Grand, for a few good reasons. No one helped me with my bag on arriving or departing. The in-house food was just average, not to mention my room service arriving without cutlery. The rooms were small and were clearly decorated 'on the cheap'. And a small but important observation; the TV remote control was impossible to use. I had to turn the television off every time I wanted to change the channel. There was also a $10 daily charge for a wireless internet connection. Are you kidding? Just not up to scratch for the rate I'm afraid.

Reviews.Title: “not any more”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Used to be a great place but falling well below average. Stabbing guests with outrageous rates on the weekends, $600 for a 230 sq ft room - The Four Seasons doesn't even go that high. It also seems that they have fallen victim to too high of a staff turnover and are left with a classless, slang mouthed, outer bourrough, "I'm cool because i work here" staff. Problem after problem: never a bellman, housekeeping's "knock then quickly enter every 20 minutes", and the basic fumbling on behalf of the staff. I travel to New York from the West Coast and usually stay at the Mercer. I would advise paying the extra $$$ (or maybe less with how high TG's rates have been) to stay at 60 Thompson or The Mercer where the rooms are larger, the bars are less "Jersey", and the staff is respectful.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be coming back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the TG for 4 nights on a business trip. Our convention started on a Sunday, so we spent the weekend in New York. We had a room on the top floor and we could not sleep because of the noise downstairs as well as having noisy neighbors until 4 am. We had to call security at 4am to go to the suite next door to let them know they were to noisy. The rooms are extremely small. The hotel is trying hard to be trendy but this is all show and no quality. I find the decor dark and depressing. We won't be coming back to this hotel. The Soho Grand is a much better hotel and the price pretty much the same.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Tribecca Grand”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my trip to New york. I travel there at least once a month. Lately I have been choosing the Tribecca Grand as my favorite place to stay. The Tribecca has to be one of the best if not the best hotel that I stay in. The service in impecable. The rooms are furnished in a very comfortable format, with wondefrul ammenities. Their sunday brunch buffet is wonderfull, not to mention a very good price. The location for me is ideal, being very close to the Village and great shopping. With all of the hotels that I have stayed in the city this has to be my personal favorite. I have introduced it to several personal friends and business associates, they have enjoyed it as much as I do.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cgar247
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. It's close to some great restaurants and bars - Nobu and 60 Thompson Street. It's also walking distance to Canal street and some cool pubs. The rooms were sleek and comfortable. The staff was tremendously helpful and the hotel lobby and entrance were bright and safe. The food was great, although the bar was a bit stuffy (roped off sections in hotels should not exist). Overall, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Tribeca Grand”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tribeca Grand for the 4th time and it has been one of my favorite Manhattan hotels. The rooms are very contemporary, yet very inviting. The service, from the moment you arrive, is excellent and also very friendly. I highly recomment this hotel for anyone who wants to stay in Manhattan, especially trendy Tribeca.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy but Together!”
Reviews.Author: enofile1
Reviews.Content: Although prices at this hotel have shot up over the past couple of years, The Tribeca Grand will remain one of my favorite hotels in NYC. The rooms are smaller, like most New York hotel rooms, but they are well planned and thought out. The "hip" design of the hotel retains some warmth which many "in" hotels lose in their desire to be so "cool." The service was fantastic and the neighborhood the best as you can walk to Soho, the Village, and Nolita. I would stay at this hotel every time I came to New York if the prices would just come down a little. Certainly, an excellent hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “well over rated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Big let down. Stayed at far better hotels in NYC for half the price. Small rooms. The bar is cool but the service is very, very slow. I was really looking forward to my stay only to feel ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & discreet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent our wedding night at the Tribeca Grand. Everything promised was there along with a complimentary bottle of champagne. Staff was extremely friendly and discreet- they didn't over do the wedding part. Could imagine interior noise being a problem as there is a club in the lobby, but they seem to be aware of it and ready to address any problem. Great smelling hotel products.

Reviews.Title: “New York City at its best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Tribeca Grand over Memorial Day weekend. We live in the tri state area, but just needed a get away from everyday life. Overall we had a wonderful stay! The staff was very helpful. Location, Location, Location- this hotel has it all. Great shopping, nightlife, and NYC culture. The rooms were spacious, neat, and modern. We also loved the hotel bar, I reccomend an apple martini!

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The best Room Service and door teams in america. I could not believe how friendly and down to earth the room service (the English guy was wonderful) and door staff were . The hotel is great. Noisy atrium on weekends, but rooms are quiet. This is the best downtown hotel in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Tribeca Grand - A Grand Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Lobby was well appointed, yet comfortable...Church Street Bar packed with interesting people every night. Room was spacious. All business needs furnished in room. The staff could not have been more friendly or helpful. Every request was granted promptly. Location was perfectly positioned within walking distance to China Town, Little Italy, Soho and The Village.

Reviews.Title: “Go to the W”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The decor is cheap and bland. The TV did not work and the phone fell apart upon use. The staff would quickly try to fix problems but never was able to actually fix them. They thought good customer service was having engineers in your room during your entire stay. No offer to change rooms, we had to insist. I would recommend that the guest relations and services staff attend basic customer service training. The coffee provided on each floor is horrible. I travel to NY frequently and would highly recommend The W or The Bryant Park Hotel. I was trying to find a hotel downtown but will never return to Tribeca.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated and loud”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is poorly designed w/ the bar and gathering area in the middle of the hotel where noise and music travels UP! DO NOT stay on the 2nd or 3rd floors - they are loud! Also, the rooms are kinda dingy and dark...not what I expected to be honest. Lots of attitude and just thought it was overrated from the word go.

Reviews.Title: “Trying to be Cool in New York”
Reviews.Author: transitbag
Reviews.Content: This hotel does it's best to be cool, and there are some very nice things about it. The rooms are modern, bigger than some in New York, and technically very well equipped -- though it doesn't have a wireless network, so you need a laptop, not a PDA, if you want to work. Like almost all American hotels these days, it is decorated in those shades of fawn and brown that become very depressing on a long business trip. The area around the hotel is bustling and raw, without being threatening. Transport links are very good. Although newly built, the Tribeca Grand is designed to look like an old conversion, with galleried industrial-style open corridors round a central atrium. For British visitors it is very reminiscent of inter-war council estates. The central well is also the bar, which gets very noisy at night because the hotel attracts lots of lively young people. The rooms have special hissing machines (under the guests' control) to cut out the noise of the music and the traffic outside (amazingly, they work). Staff are helpful, if a little consecending to anyone who doesn't fit in to the age/social class profile the hotel is aiming for. The good news is that the public areas are so dark that it's possible to look cooler than you really are. The only downside (shared with its sister hotel, the Soho Grand) is the incredibly mean (yet expensive) breakfast. No buffet, just dishes from a menu that take ages to order, and then ages to arrive. In the meantime you have nothing -- not even a glass of water -- to keep you company, though they will give you tepid coffee from a jug if you can manage to find a waiter -- and grugingly replenish it if you beg. The only quickish option is the continental breakfast. Even that takes ages to come and then turns out to be a bowl of fruit salad, plain bread rolls and a croissant (served ice cold). You can't have butter. Horrible. So get breakfast elsewhere -- it's the meal America does best almost anywhere else, and cheaper too.

Reviews.Title: “Love the concept, friendly staff, but subway noise & rattle”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed one sunday night here in their superior room with two double beds with a small dog. Rooms here range superior, deluxe, and up, in that order, making our room the smallest and the most inexpensive of the rooms. I booked through tablet hotels site, for 179. I tend to stay in 4 or more star hotels, and even then I'm extremely squimish and picky about cleanliness and decor. I have previously stayed at Sofitel, Hemsley, and Mariott in NYC, and prefer Sofitel over others for cleanliness, service, and warm and pleasant decor. I was curious to explore the Tribeca and was facinated by the ultra pet friendliness of the hotel, as well as some interesting amenity offerings of bose wave cd players and fax machines in every room, gold fish pet for the pets, ipod and docking stations, power shower, etc. Hotel was never crowded during our stay, there never was any wait by concierge/valet parking/reception desk. Every staff members were friendly, helpful and pleasant. The hotel exterior and lounges were modern and looked well kept or new. There did not seem to be a club scene(the hotel lobby is mainly a lounge for club goers) on sundays, so, minimal noise. The room itself was fine, though led to believe that there is no tub but only a stall shower when booking, it had a full bath. It is decorated in non-descript grays and dark brown tones. The furnishings were all veneer(not wood veener), and looked hagard, but having shopped recently for a city loft with modern decor, I can attest to the lack of quality and durability of most "modern" or contemporary" furnishings. They tend to be inferior at more expensive prices(pay heavily for designs.), so cracks on bathroom floor tiles and peeling veeners didn't surprise nor bother me. What bothered me was: The color scheme of the room was gloomy. Some didn't match at all- dark purple carpet?!? and dark glossy redish brown doors?? And curtains need updating, noticed stains. The WORST issue, unexpectedly, was the noise and physical rattling of the room by the subway trains. The subway either runs directly below the hotel, or below the sideway lining the hotel and runs into extremely late if not all night, it seemed. (noticed subway vents lined along the sidewalk along the hotel(facing a parking lot)). I ended up having a restless night tossing and turning, but finally managed some light sleep in the wee hours with the help of my BOSE noise-cancelling headphone(my own). The room was equipped with what they call a noise cancelling device, but it is not a true noise cancelling device like the headphones that counter with a opposite wave length so that you hear less noise) but a white noise device that you can adjust the loudness of. This proved useless to me as there already were enough white noise in the room(mini refrigerator, computer, etc), and it only aggrevated the noise level by adding to it. Valet parking was about 40, cab fare to south end of the central park costs about 10+tip. I cannot recommend Tribeca Bread or was it Bread Tribeca(italian placed across hotel recommended by concierge), horribly junky food. Probably have been better off ordering room service in quality and cost.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: THIS WAS A LETTER I SENT TO THE GENERAL MANAGER AFTER I RECEIVED AN EMAIL ASKING HOW MY STAY WAS. Mr. Nicholson, I am sorry to report that my stay and service at the Tribeca Grand Hotel was a lot less than even mediocre. A personal emergency with my fiance's family popped up earlier that day so I called the hotel and requested either a cancellation or a change of date. I also asked if I can pay a cancellation fee. The hotel told me no, they would have to charge the whole amount, I didn't notify the hotel soon enough. I understood. Our check in would have to be late that evening, around 1AM. Besides my Master Card not being validated for the full amount and having to pay cash for the room, the reservations woman denied us access to the mini bar. Therefore, on our walk up to the room, we were followed by a young man with a milk crate that had to empty the mini bar and whatever else was on the counter. Embarrassing for all of us is not the word. We had also requested a non smoking room. Of course when we walk in the room we were hit by a stench similar to an ashtray. The young man with the milk cart of juices and liquor, etc., enlightened us that the 1st, 2nd, and 3rd floors are in fact smoking rooms. The heating/air system was confusing us also. One minute we were cold, the next hot. I think we are both educated enough to figure out the controls of the air system. Maybe not? Unable to sleep at 3,4 AM, maybe we should rent a movie. Nope, couldn't do that either. At this point, we decided to just suck up the $500 something up and try to get some sleep. Morning comes, and we are woken up by a woman in our room, wanting to make the bed. Oh my God, we overslept, we must be late for check out....... Wait a minute, it's earlier than 10:00am. Very rude. We're not sure if we heard a knock. The pressure from the shower nozzle was about the only nice thing that happened to us during our stay. The Moss products, by the way are gross too. We wanted to have brunch downstairs while we were leaving but both agreed to not provide the hotel with more of our business. I know I may sound like a person complaining about everything, but having spent many nights in various hotels throughout the city on top of my office being located in the Waldorf Astoria, I think this has made me somewhat of a hotel savvy person. I know what to expect. From the service to room quality, we both decided to never stay at Grand hotel again. Speaking of room quality, a beyond "used" bed covered with a white sheet and terri cloth blanket is NOT up to par or my expectations of a higher end hotel/room. I was truly disappointed and felt like I could've experienced better at a Motel 6. Sleaze, dirt, and low class written all over it. So I am very sorry to report back with an unhappy response, but then again, I am so very sorry that I chose to stay at the Tribeca Grand Hotel. I won't make that mistake again. Neither will friends or clients of mine. Thank you for your time, Jaime Jaime XXXXXXXX FLORALIA DECORATORSat the Waldorf Astoria

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay here. Some rooms might be noisy, but we requested a quiet one and really couldn't hear any noise from the outside when we were in it, despite the DJ on both Friday and Saturday nights! Enjoyed dinner and drinks here Friday night, loved the fitness center, the room was small but the staff more than made up for it by going above and beyond with their helpfulness. Great hotel- nice attention to detail. I particularly liked having the goldfish in the room, the ipod/sounddock, and the welcome package with art, shopping, and dining recommendations. Definitely recommended if you want to stay in a trendy place in a trendy neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Above Avg. Hotel, Great Location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel in November 2004. It was clean and - by NY standards - decently sized for the price. Service was excellent - especially the concierge staff. However, the restaurant was overpriced and the food was just okay. Also, the lounge area was extremely noisy until 2:00 - 3:00 a.m. on Friday night (I was really pleased we weren't going to have to try to sleep through a Saturday!) Since the hotel is designed with an atrium and the lounge is in the lobby, the noise in our 2nd floor room woke me up repeatedly throughout the night. That said ... the location was great - in Tribeca and very close to Chinatown and Soho as well as several subway stops.

Reviews.Title: “Totally pretentious”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 3 nights at the Tribeca Grand. This hotel is pretentious from start to finish. The staff are condescending, and the service very poor. The wastepaper baskets were not emptied, the hair dryer did not work and the wake up call was 20 minutes early. The service in the restaurant was also extremely slow, and that was when it was almost entirely empty. I would be very reluctant to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to park yourself in lower Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After suffering through their trendy, but unusable website, and reading mixed reviews here, I went with my gut, which said that this would be a good destination for an adult night out for my wife and myself (we parked our daughter with her grandmother). Aside from a bit and of a bottleneck checking in, the entire experience was excellent. I booked the "Tryst in Tribeca" package which included champagne on check-in, and an excellent batch of chocolate covered strawberries in the room, breaIt fast in bed, and late check-out. True this was not an inexpensive overnight, but hey this is Manhattan. Budget-conscious should skip this one, but all in all I still thought it a decent value. Not ultra-high shelf, the hotel is new and well designed, but not in any way cookie cutter. Sure it's hip, but style is not the only thing in charge here. And for the folks who complained about noise, this did concern me as my wife is a light sleeper. This was an unfounded fear as there is a noise cancellation system in each room, and for downtown, it was relatively quiet, so no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Cool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very trendy, cool hotel. Expect to meet a celeb whilst there. Real nice bar and environment, chilled and different. Totally recommend it to any young minded funky people who like a place of beautiful people (especially the staff, phew!!) Went for New Years and had the best ever. Go for it.

Reviews.Title: “not returning”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location is great,but I won't be staying at this hotel again. My husbands 40 birthday and we wanted a cool hotel to stay at. The lobby lounge was nice but the staff have no personality and don't even attempt a smile. I'm from New York and they are taking themselves too seriously. If you have any inclination to go to bed before 4 a.m. you can forget about it. The lounge and the club in the basement are going strong until then and I thought my head would explode. If you know you are staying out late and it doesn't matter then go for it. The room is sparce and cold. The furniture is beaten up. All in all, go to the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend it”
Reviews.Author: kathisue
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here and can't recommend it to anyone hoping to get a restful night's sleep...at least over the weekend. The bar/club is located right in the middle of the hotel and the rooms are located above it. Imagine a courtyard situation and that is where the club is. The bass is thumping until 4am and although we were impressed with the amount of soundproofing in the doors/walls, you could still hear that distant thump as you tried to fall asleep. If you are going to NYC to party (as we were) then the Tribeca is a fun, trendy hotel. Beware of the pricey drinks, though...$8 for a domestic mass-produced beer is just stupid. We only used the bar as a meeting place and for nightcaps. All other drinks were purchased elsewhere. The rooms aren't anything to write home about either. I typically like sleek and modern, but there was something really drab about the place. It didn't help that there were stains on the curtains. I can't say I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is Rank!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overpriced, rooms are filthy, the bed actually had fake wood veneer and it was peeling off. I can't believe this place!! The web pictures are NOTHING like the rooms, they are old (after how many years?) and the service was just as bad. We also had the Sunday buffet, the wait staff was snobby as hell and NEVER came back to refill our coffee. Unreal. I paid $2,000 for 4 nights for a 1 star, $20 motel. Pass it up.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, poor location and bad cocktails.”
Reviews.Author: Bunkerbuster
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations of this hotel which were not met in one single respect (other than in the size of the bill when I checked out). All the rooms overlook the noisy bar, so don't expect to get to sleep here until well into the early hours. I had quite a high room but the noise just gets bounced straight up through the whole atrium. To add insult to injury, in said bar (if you can't beat them, join them) I ordered a martini, extra dry and straight up with an olive and received a tumbler full of ice containing some watery vodka with far too much Vermouth and a twist. The hotel sits rather awkwardly between several exciting parts of town without actually managing to be a part of any of them. Spend the considerable sum of money you were contemplating spending here somewhere else that will earn it.
